loans.name: Richelle

texts.en:
Richelle J. is 28 years old and lives in the village of Dalig in Antipolo, an attractive province of Rizal. Richelle makes potholders. She has been in business for more than 6 years. 

Richelle joined Ahon SA Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva field partner, in 2009 to realize her dreams for her family. She believes that her proposed loan will be a big help and will contribute to the growth of her business. That is why she is very firm and carefully controls the use of money that is lent to her. She uses all of the loan funds for her business so she can earn more profits and pay for her family's daily expenses. 

Richelle dreams of sending her children to school and hopes that they end their studies with a degree. She is also a good mother to her three children and silently dreams of the best for her family. She believes that poor families need support so that they can change their standard of living and build beautiful houses for their families to live. 

All of her goals in life are supported by her devoted partner, Joel J., who is 29 years old and a welder. They have three children, Rochelle Ann, 7 years old and a grade 1 student; Rozane, 4 years old; and Jamie, 2 years old. Richelle is a positive and optimistic mother with many dreams for her future.

loans.use: To buy sewing machine oil, thread, needles, and cloth for her potholder business

loans.name: Guido

texts.es:
Guido V. J. es un  señor de 37 años de edad quien vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en una comunidad llamada El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Provincia de Cartago.  Es una pequeña comunidad rural de aproximadamente dos mil habitantes. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche y siembra de café. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. La comunidad tiene paisajes muy pintorescos que combinan el bosque tropical con dos lindas lagunas, plantaciones de café y lecherías. El Sauce se localiza aproximadamente a hora y media en bus de Turrialba, el centro de comercio más cercano. Sin embargo, varias veces al año el camino se vuelve intransitable por las lluvias que azotan la zona. Este es sin duda uno de los principales desafíos para la comunidad. 

Cuando no existían actividades muchas personas optaron por salir a buscar trabajos en Turrialba o en fincas bananeras ubicadas en la Zona Atlántica de Costa Rica. Actualmente los precios del café y la leche han mejorado, por lo tanto los vecinos buscan cómo invertir en proyectos en la misma zona y de esta forma evitar migrar.

Hace dos años, se instaló en la comunidad una planta de elaboración de quesos de la Asociación de Productores de Leche de El Sauce. Por lo tanto, en los últimos dos años don Guido ha ido especializándose en la producción de leche que luego vende a esta planta. 

Don Guido desea obtener un microcrédito por ¢670.000(seiscientos setenta mil colones) para comprar más vacas y así aumentar la producción de leche. El sabe que contar con más  vacas es un mayor sacrificio y demandará más trabajo pero dice que si quiere sacar su familia adelante tiene que esforzarse en producir más.

Actualmente don Guido ordeña en una pequeña instalación de madera que acondicionó como sala de ordeño. Dice que por día logra producir aproximadamente 20 litros de leche y con más vacas su producción aumentaría a 70 litros diarios por lo cual esta muy emocionado de poder ver como su negocio crece y se fortalece.

Don Guido es socio de la Asociación de Productores de El Sauce, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su noveno préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Guido V. J. is 37 years old. He lives with his wife and two children in a community called El Sauce in Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Province of Cartago. This is a small rural community with around two thousand people. They are work producing milk and growing coffee. It has an irregular terrain and a lot of it is maintained as humid tropical forest. The community has traditional landscapes that mix with the tropical forest, with two nice lagoons, coffee plantations and milk factories. El Sauce is located about an hour and a half from Turrialba, the closest commercial center. However, several times a year, the road is closed due to the heavy rain in the area. This is without a doubt one of the main challenges of the community. When there was nothing to do in town, a lot of people decided to go to Turrialba for work or to banana farms in the Atlantic coast in Costa Rica. Right now, coffee and milk prices have improves, so the neighbors are looking for ways to invest their money in the area and avoid migrations. Two years ago, he installed a cheese manufacturing company in his community for the El Sauce’s Milk Producer’s Association. Therefore, Guido has been focusing in the production of milk during this time, that he later on sells to this plant. This time, Guido would like to get a ¢670.00 loan (six hundred and seventy colones) to purchase more cows and increase the production of milk. He knows that having more cattle will imply greater sacrifices, but he wants to support his family so he's willing to make the effort. Right now, Guido milks his cows in a small wooden facility that we turned into a milking room. He says that he’s able to produce around 20 liters of milk a day and with more cows his production will reach 70 liters, so he's very excited about seeing his business grow and get stronger. Luis is a member of the El Sauce Farmers Association, one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his ninth loan. He hopes to continue growing at a personal level and financial level. He also believes it’s important to mention that thanks to these type of organizations he is able to devote more time to productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase milking cows

loans.name: Juana Emilia

texts.es: En el municipio de Somotillo, la señora Juana A. se dedica arduamente a laborar para llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación y así beneficiar a su hijo que depende de ella. Se ha destacado por ser muy trabajadora y tener muchos deseos de continuar mejorando su nivel de vida. Ha iniciado a mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y para ello lo realiza para brindarle a su hijo un techo digno donde vivir. El crédito solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de los materiales de construcción con el propósito de continuar en esta obra y así lograr su sueño de mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Señora Juana A. works very hard in the municipality of Somotillo to provide a home for her son who is dependent on her. She is well known for being very hardworking and for wanting to continue improving her life. She has started to improve her home so that her son has a decent place in which to grow up. The loan she is asking for will be used to buy construction materials so that the work can continue enabling Juana to achieve her dream of a better home.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction material

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Esfuerzo Gracias A Dios Group

texts.es:
El grupo Esfuerzo Gracias a Dios está integrado por cuatro mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y con el ferviente deseo de salir a delante. Una de ellas es María auxiliadora Bermúdez Martínez quien vende cosméticos de forma ambulante según comento ella inicio con pocos productos pero conforme su negocio fue creciendo y aumentando.

Las otras integrantes son Arcadia Gertrudis T. quien realiza costuras y reposterías, Marlin Ivonne R. T. tiene un taller de costura y Coralia del Socorro P. vende hielo y frescos naturales. Ellas invertirán el préstamo en el sus respectivos negocios para que este mejore y crezca.
texts.en:
The group “Esfuerzo Gracias a Dios” (Thankful for God’s Strenth) consists of four hardworking, determined women who have the fervent desire to succeed. One of these women is María Auxiliadora Bermúdez Martínez, who sells cosmetics as a traveling merchant. She says she started her business with few products but now it is growing and expanding.

The other members are Arcadia Gertrudis T. who sews and makes sweets, Marlin Ivonne R. T. who has a sewing workshop, and Coralia del Socorro P. who sells ice and natural refreshments. They will invest their loans in their respective businesses in order to grow and improve.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia V. V., tiene la edad de 50 años, está casada, y tiene 5 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Ellos tienen 24,19,19,13 y 12 años de edad. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado, la idea es tener ganado para doble propósito (leche y carne). Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. No es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le han brindado siempre. Doña Lidia trabaja desde hace varios años con el ganado. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Lidia V. V. is 50 years old, married, and has 5 children who are her biggest priority. They are 24, 19, 19, 13 and 12 years old. The loan she is seeking is to purchase livestock, with the idea being to have livestock with 2 purposes: milk and meat. She wants to give them adequate care to obtain the best earnings possible when she sells them. It's not the first time she has had a loan with FUDECOSUR and she is very content with the facilities that they have always given her. Lidia has worked with livestock for several years. She hopes in the future to bestow her family with a better quality of life and more economic stability, and to be able to continue growing as a person and producer. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth sells loaves of bread to make a living. She has been in this business for a long time and loves it because of the one-on-one interaction she has with her customers. She is 38 years old and married to a trader; they have 3 children. She is requesting a loan of of N60,000 to purchase more loaves of bread to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more loaves of bread to sell

loans.name: Raphatou

texts.fr: A. Raphatou est née en 1990 à Lomé, capitale économique du Togo, pays voisin du Bénin.  Raphatou vit à Adogléta, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Raphatou est célibataire sans enfants. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Raphatou mène comme activité principale la vente de gâteaux à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Raphatou vend également de la bouillie de maïs. Raphatou s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Raphatou n’a pas fréquenté l’école mais cela fait bientôt cinq ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. ALIDé a déjà accordé un prêt à Raphatou, prêt qui a été bien remboursé. Raphatou sollicite un deuxième crédit afin de renforcer son activité et se faire plus de revenus pour acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Raphatou A. was born in 1990 in Lomé, the economic capital of Togo, a country bordering Bénin. Raphatou is single and has no children. To meet her needs, she sells cakes from her home. She also sometimes sells corn porridge. Raphatou stocks up on supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin. She never went to school but has done this work for close to five years. ALIDé has already given Raphatou one loan, a loan which she repaid in full. Raphatou is asking for a second loan in order to strengthen her business and make more profits to buy a plot of land.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn, oil and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase mulches and farm tools

loans.name: Oloa

texts.en:
Oloa I. is 32 and married with 4 children.  She owns a business venture, catching & selling ocean-caught fish.  Oloa has 3 years of experience in this business.  Oloa needs a loan of WST $1250 to purchase a fishing boat.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Oloa is a hard working client wishing to develop her business and assist her family financially.

Oloa joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Oloa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is a widow. Her children have grown up and moved out. Valentina sells clothing at an open market in Kherson town. The very good location of her kiosk brings many clients her way. Her business does well. Valentina has been in this business for nine years, ever since she saw that women's clothing was one of the few products that sells well and produces a stable income. 

Valentina would like a loan of 5,900 UAH to add to the assortment of clothing she sells. She would spend additional income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of clothing she sells

loans.name: Chuo's Group

texts.en: There are four borrowers in this small group, all residents in the province of Siem Reap, Cambodia. Mrs. T. was selected to be the leader. She owns a medium-sized boat that she and her husband use to provide a taxi service. T. picks up merchandise belonging to people across the river and currently earns an income of approximately $8 per day. She is married and has two young children; both of them are single. Mrs. T. is facing an obstacle: the roof of her boat cracked during the heavy rainfall, and this problem has been affecting her service and daily income. Therefore, T. decided to request a loan to renovate the broken roof of her boat. The other three borrowers are Yon S., 44, and Kean T., 39, who sell groceries, and Seat N., 63, a barber. Ms. S. needs a loan to buy more grocery inventory for sale. Ms. T. also needs a loan to accumulate the quantity of grocery inventory to sell, and Ms. N. is applying for a loan to help her finish building a new house.

loans.use: To renovate the broken roof of her boat.

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn M. is from the village of Thailand, Basilan, South Cotabato. She is 40 years old. Ginalyn is married and has 8 school-aged children. To make a living, Ginalyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Ginalyn has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Ginalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ginalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Ginalyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Ginalyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make beignets.

loans.name: Warlito

texts.en:
Warlito A. is from the village of Barandias, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. He is 35 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Warlito owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Warlito has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 5,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Warlito joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Warlito is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be his third from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Miriama

texts.en:
Miriama T. is 53 and married with 3 children.  She owns a business venture selling a variety of different products in the local community.  Miriama has many years of experience in this business.  Miriama needs a loan of WST $2000 to invest in renovating the business.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Miriama joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Miriama's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To invest in renovating the business

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes was born in 1960. She is married to a farmer and they have seven children. She is very hardworking and she has helped her husband pay her children’s school fees.

She sells sorghum beer and green bananas on a retail basis. She also sells sorghum grain, both retail and wholesale. She has done this business for 25 years. The black plastic container by her side contains sorghum beer. She is requesting a loan in order to increase her capital by buying more sorghum and green bananas. Agnes hopes to pay her children’s school fees and have some savings with the profits.

loans.use: Buying sorghum and green bananas for sale.

loans.name: Gricelda

texts.es:
La  Sra. Gricelda  tiene 4 hijos   en edad escolar.
Ella  tiene una pequeña despensa en el barrio Remansito, cuya venta cada vez más está en ascenso, generándole un buen ingreso. 

Con la ayuda de su esposo y toda la familia están  saliendo adelante con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo. 

Hoy día ella es una microempresaria exitosa con una clientela fiel y numerosa, debido a su amabilidad. 
Ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y honesta en sus compromisos por lo que debemos brindarle todo el apoyo necesario. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería que hacen falta en su negocio como harina, arroz, fideos, aceite, y otros
texts.en:
Gricelda has four school aged children. She has a small pantry store in the Remanisto neighborhood, where her sales are constantly increasing. This earns her a good income. With her husband’s help, and that of the rest of the family, and with much effort and sacrifice, she is coming out ahead. Because of her friendliness, she is now a successful small business owner with a large and loyal customer base. She has proven to be responsible and honest in her commitments and we should give her all the necessary support. She is asking for this loan in order to buy merchandise, such as flour, rice, cooking oil, and other things that she needs for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Celestino

texts.es:
Celestino es casada y tiene 4 hijos estudiantes, Celestino tiene una carpintería en un local alquilado, negocio que inicio hace 10 años, Celestino atiende pedidos y tiene 2 personas que le ayudan.
Celestino es socio del Banco Comunal Yanapanakusun que significa Ayudémonos en Quechua y solicita un crédito de 1500 soles para la compra de clavos, pegamento y pintura.
Los sueños de Celestino son ampliar su negocio, tener un taller grande con maquinaria moderna.
texts.en:
Celestino is married and has 4 children who are students. He has a carpenter’s workshop in a rented space. He began the business 10 years ago. He takes requests and has 2 people that help him.

Celestino is a member of the Yanapanakusun communal bank. In Quechua, “yanapanakusun” means “let’s help each other.” He is requesting a 1500 PEN loan for the purchase of hammer, glue, and paint. Celestino’s dreams are to expand his business and to have a large workshop with modern machinery.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase hammers, glue, and paint.

loans.name: Santos Cristina

texts.es:
Santos Cristina es una madre D. familia D. 58 años D. edad que resiD. junto a su familia en una zona rural del distrito agrícola D. TambogranD., una zona que produce principalmente mango y limón para exportarlos a diversos países del extranjero. Pertenece a la provincia D. Piura y se encuentra ubicada en la región del mismo nombre, a más D. tres horas y media D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la preparación y venta D. chicha D. jora (una bebida típica del país que se prepara desD. épocas remotas en base a un tipo especial D. harina D. maíz), ella prepara esta bebida en su domicilio y la ofrece en venta dos veces por semana y con los ingresos que le brinda su venta ayuda a su esposo con los gastos familiares. Adicionalmente prepara y venD. comida durante toda la semana. El negocio tiene buena acogida ya que esta bebida es bastante consumida en la zona, sobretodo en diversas celebraciones y festividades. Además los trabajadores del lugar la consumen antes D. iniciar sus actividades ya que creen que la bebida les ofrece energía y vigor.

Santos desea adquirir mas ingredientes e insumos como harina D. jora, azúcar y leña para seguir elaborando esta bebida e incrementar sus ventas. Por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 500 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr sus metas.

Santos es una mujer trabajadora y entregada a su familia, su mayor anhelo es ver progresar a sus hijos y ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Santos Cristina is the mother of a family, 58 years of age, who resides with her family in a rural zone of the agricultural district of TambogranD., a zone that produces principally mango and lemons in order to export them to diverse foreign countries.  It belongs to the province of Piura and is located in the region of the same name, more than 3 and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

She is dedicated to the preparation and sale of jora liquor (a typical beverage of the country that has been maD. since remote times from a base of a special type of cornflour).  She prepares this beverage in her residence and offers it for sale two times a week.  With the income that she earns from her sales, she helps her husband with the family expenses.  Additionally she prepares and sells food during the entire week.  The business is well received, since this beverage is often consumed in the zone, especially at diverse celebrations and festivities.  Likewise, the workers from the place consume it before starting their activities since they believe that the beverage offers them energy and vigor.  

Santos would like to acquire more ingredients and supplies such as jora flour, sugar and firewood to continue preparing this beverage and to increase her sales.  Because of this, she has requested her first loan from Edpyme Alternative; a loan of 500 new soles that will permit her to achieve her goals.  

Santos is a hard-working woman and cares for her family.  Her greatest wish is to see her children progress and to offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy supplies to grow her business of preparing and selling liquor.

loans.name: Getaro Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married and they have two children.

Mary is servicing a first loan in KADET and has no other MFI (microfinance institution) history. She has been in the general store business for two years and her business is in a densely populated area. With the loan, Mary shall purchase stock for her food shop as well as renovate some portion of the shop.

Mary plans to use the profits that she'll earn from the business to complete some rental rooms for occupation by tenants as she becomes a landlord. Mary hopes to be financially stable and increase her rental income.

loans.use: The loan will be used to renovate her retail shop and add more stock of items like food

loans.name: Mondulu

texts.en: Mondulu L. is 24 years old, married with a husband who is a soldier. They have 4 children who go to school. Mondulu is currently in the business of selling beans, onions, fish, maize flour and simsim (sesame) at the road side.  She is requesting a loan to stock more maize flour, beans and simsim to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, Mondulu hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock more maize flour, beans and simsim to sell

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis de 33 años, tiene un hijo y está casado con ayuda de su esposa tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en la parte delantera de su casa ubicada a las afuera de Guayaquil llamada Duran y caracterizada por su ecología de disolución.
 
El hace años atrás comenzó a buscar una actividad para poder mantener a su familia. En busca de una actividad económica él vio que la venta de víveres era rentable y podía pasar tiempo con su hijo y esposa. Con unos ahorros compro arroz, azúcar, bebidas y readecuo la parte delantera de su casa para vender con más eficacia los víveres. En la actualidad el tiene una pequeña tienda surtida, vende arroz, aceites, bebidas, lácteos etc. Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días.
 
Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, aceites, bebidas para su tienda y así poderla surtir. En el futuro quiere agrandar su negocio y poder así asegurar el futuro de su familia.
texts.en:
Luis, 33, has a son and is married. He and his wife have a small supply shop in the front part of their house located on the outskirts of Guayaquil in a place called Duran characterized by its deteriorating ecology. 

Some years ago he began looking for a business that would allow him to support his family. In search of a business he saw that grocery sales were profitable and he would be able to spend time with his wife and child. With some savings he bought rice, sugar and drinks and remodeled the front portion of her house into a retail store. Currently he has stocked a small store with rice, oils, drinks, dairy products, etc. He works from 7 a.m. until 10 p.m. seven days a week. 

With the loan he wishes to buy rice, oil and drinks for his business and thus be able to stock it. In the future he wants to expand her business and thus be able to ensure the future of his family.

loans.use: To purchase rice, oil

loans.name: Mielin

texts.en:
Mielin G. is a married woman who lives in Cordova, Brgy. Cogon, Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a sari-sari (general) store. Her husband, Garry G., is 33 years old and works as a security guard. They have 1 child who is 9 years old. 

Mielin joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 7 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Mielin has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 7,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 20,000 PHP, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 8th cycle loan, she is borrowing 12,000 PHP, which she intends to use as additional working capital for the general store so that she can continue to save up for the future and for her business. 

Mielin G. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Doraliza

texts.en:
Doraliza A. is from the village of Benhaan, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 32 years old. Doraliza is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Doraliza owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & snacks in the local community. Doraliza has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Doraliza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Doraliza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Doraliza is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like junk foods & beverages. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Doraliza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like snacks & beverages

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Saroeun S. is 31 years old and her husband, Mr. Sophara Chhom, is 32 years old. They are pictured here together. They live in a village approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 1994 and have one young daughter. 

Saroeun sells sewing machines. Her husband is a sewing machine repairman and works along with his wife’s business.  

Saroeun hopes to expand her business by purchasing additional sewing machines for resale, so she is applying for her first loan of $1,000.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Agriphine

texts.en:
Agriphine C. is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent bills and school fees. 

She has operated a beauty salon business for the past three years, neighbors and passersby are her potential customers. Agriphine faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to own a well furnished beauty salon in the future. 

With the KES 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase cosmetics and hair braids for her beauty salon. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to uplift her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and hair braids for her beauty salon

loans.name: Mujeres Alegres Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es del Barrio Arroyo Porá, surguió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la Fundación Paraguaya.
Todas las señoras poseen un quiosco, donde realizan la venta de verduras y frutas, es decir, la venta de mercaderías comestibles.
El monto que recibe cada señora varía de  300.000  a 1.900.000 Gs.
La sra. Lucila Beatriz C. se dedica a vender todo tipo de comidas en su pequeño qiosco, además de verduras y frutas.
texts.en:
This group is from Barrio Arroyo Porá.  It was formed when one of the members encountered Fundación Paraguaya.

All of the women have a kiosk where they sell vegetables, fruit, and food products.  The amount that each woman receives varies from 300,000 to 1,900,000 guaraníes.  Lucila Beatriz C. sells all kinds of food in her small kiosk in addition to vegetables and fruit.

loans.use: Purchase of fruit, vegetables, baked goods, sweets, and drinks

loans.name: Linda Medina Group

texts.en:
Linda M. is from Malaubang, Ozamiz City. She is 67 years old, a widow, and has two adult-aged children. Linda is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Linda M.’s Group.

To make a living, Linda owns and operates a rice retailing business, selling to her neighbors and friends. She has been engaged in this business for ten years and earns approximately $125 a month.

In 2009, Linda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. 

She is now requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. This will be her 4th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living standards of her family.

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Capital for rice selling business

loans.name: Diana Atieno

texts.en:
Diana is 35 years old, married to Lameck, and has three children. They live in Migori town.


Diana has a business selling second-hand clothes and is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD . She intends to use the money to buy more clothes to add to her stock. Her monthly income is KES. 29,000, and she is optimistic that this amount will rise after the loan.

Diana will use the profits to pay school fees for her children.  She hopes to own a boutique in the future.

loans.use: To buy bales of clothes to add to her stock

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en: Merlita is a 48-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: a general store and food vending. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and food vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000. Merlita is borrowing PHP 11,000 to buy more merchandise to sell in her general store and ingredients for her food vending business. This will be her fifth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 9,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Merlita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is from the village of Tonggo, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old, married, and has four adult children. To make a living, Elvira raises crops and sells them in the local community.

Elvira has been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns approximately 4600 PHP a month for these activities. Elvira joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. 

Elvira is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP with which she will purchase fertilizers. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Elvira from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her vegetables.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHUARA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Jovita; ella tiene 50 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos entre otros productos y también se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales como chanchos y ganados, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y crianza de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como arroz, azúcar y aceite al por mayor y también para comprar animales para los animales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHUARA” community bank. The bank is located in the district of Urubamba, which belongs to the province of Urubamba and departament of Cuzco.

This member is named Jovita. She is 50 years old, married and has 3 children. She alternates between her daily activities and her grocery store business. She sells  basic neccesity products such as rice, sugar, and pasta, among others. She also works in the business of raising animals such as pigs and cattle. She wants to expand her grocery store and animal raising business. She is asking for the loan to buy products such as rice, sugar, and oil wholesale and also to buy feed for the animals. 

Jovia is happy with the loan and is committed to making the payments on time.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, sugar and oil wholesale as well as to buy feed for her animals.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 66 years old and married with 10 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

Letecia has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 7 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Letecia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Phonn

texts.en: Selling a few fresh fish is the main activity of Mrs. Phonn. She always takes fish from her husband and other fishermen in bulk for a reasonable amount. The family typically generates a revenue of US$8 each day and has been in their business for over 10 years. Currently, Mrs. Phonn always uses her motorbike to pick up her fish to sell at the busy market but now her old motorbike has broken down while driving and her saving account is not enough to replace it. That is why Mrs. Phonn requested a loan. She will buy a new motorbike as well as more fish to continue selling.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike and more fish to sell.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 29-year-old hardworking man who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the produce business for three years, and with the income, he has been able to construct a house and support his parents. His hardship is high electricity charges, and his dream is owning a food store. Robert needs the loan to buy maize and coffee for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize and coffee for resale.

loans.name: Melania Marlene

texts.es:
Melania Marlene tiene 42 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama NUEVO HORIZONTE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Cachely Grande, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Melania se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol, las compras las realiza en Comercial "Hnos. Olivos" cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abonos para los cultivos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como enfermedades en los cultivos y la falta de no tener el terreno propio. Su sueño es tner un terreno propio.

Le gusta hacer deporte con los hijos.
texts.en:
Melania Marlene is 42 years old, married, and lives with her husband and children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

This community bank is called "Nuevo Horizonte" (New Horizon) and it is located in Cachely Grande, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice, beans and pigeon peas.

Melania grows crops, especially corn, rice and beans.  She makes her purchases in "Hnos. Olivos" store each month and makes her sales in the street market in the same town.

Melania is requesting this loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her crops.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her business such as crop diseases and the fact that she doesn't own her own land.  Her dream is to own her own plot of land.

Melania enjoys taking part in sports together with her children.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Teobaldo

texts.es: Teobaldo es propietario de una unidad de negocios a través de la cual expende carne y  lleva por nombre: "Carnes Finas El Establo"; esta actividad fue heredada ya que su padre se dedicó la mayor parte de su vida a ella, su labor la complementa con sus estudios universitarios de contaduria pública. Su negocio nació  despues de trabajar con su padre,con quien logró mucha experiencia y decidió independizarse para emprender su propia aventura hace un año. Con sus ventas mensuales cubre sus costos operativos entre ellos los sueldos de cuatro ayudantes y aporta a los gastos del hogar al igual que su esposa que es contadora y labora en una empresa en la ciudad de Barranquilla, la fortaleza de su negocio es la excelente infraestructura en cuanto a los activos fijos requeridos para su desempeño. Sus cuentas por cobrar rotan con agilidad y su margen de rentabilidad es adecuado para la actividad que realiza. En la actualidad Teoblado está solicitando su primer financiamiento a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y le ha entusiasmado la linea de kiva por la tasa de interes que se otorga en ella, porque le ayuda ha ahorrar en sus compras que son de contado y por ser en volumen gana descuentos. Con su credikiva comprará carne de res sobre pedidos. Su meta es ampliar su capital de trabajo para extender el negocio en puntos estratégicos y fortalecer sus ingresos pues planea el desarrollo y crecimiento de su familia en el marco de que su hijo tenga oportunidades de estudio futura que le augure total éxito.
texts.en:
Teobaldo owns a butcher shop called "Carnes Fines El Establo"; his father was also a butcher for most of his life.  He is also studying public accounting at a university.  His business developed after working with his father, where he gained the experience he needed to start his butcher shop a year ago.  His monthly sales cover his operating costs, among them the cost of four assistants and his share of the expenses of the household he shares with his wife, who is an accountant and works in a business in Barranquilla.  The strong point of his business is the excellent infrastructure of the equipment and premises. He keeps his accounts up to date, and his margin of profit is sufficient for his business. 

Teobaldo is currently seeking his first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation and is very pleased with the Kiva interest rates because the loan will allow him to make bulk purchases using cash so as to get a discount.  He will use the loan to buy beef for which he has orders.  He is working to increase his working capital so that he can expand his business in strategic ways and increase his income in order to plan the development and growth of his family.  He wants his son can have more opportunities to study in the future and succeed in life.

loans.use: to buy meat in bulk.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en: Philip has been practicing farming for the last twelve years. He is 33 years old, married, and supports three people. Philip was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use it to buy wheat seeds and fertilizer and to hire temporary field workers to assist him in planting. In the future, Philip hopes to become a leading farmer and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy wheat seeds and fertilizer and to hire temporary field workers

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
Luis Alfredo tiene 39 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y con tres hijos de 13, 10 y 9 años, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. EL DIVINO NIÑO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Estero Lindo, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto como siembre de maíz y arroz.

Luis se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial AGRIPAC y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de semillas y abonos de maiz y arroz.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como plagas en los cultivos y la falta de dinero para pagar a mas trabajadores. Su sueño es prosperar economicamente y comprar una finca.

Le gusta hacer deporte y ayudar en la casa.
texts.en:
Luis Alfredo, 39, is married and lives with his wife and three children, ages 13, 10 and 9, in the Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Ríos.

The communal bank EL DIVINO NIÑO is located in the Estero Lindo community which belongs to the Ventanas Canton. This group is involved in growing short-cycle crops, such as corn and rice.

Luis also grows corn and rice. He buys his supplies in Comercial AGRIPAC and sells his produce in the wholesale market in Ventanas.

With the loan he plans to buy corn and rice seeds and fertilizer. The loan helps him economically to meet his needs. He is up against challenges such as crop plagues and lack of money to hire more workers. His dream is to get ahead economically and buy a farm.

He enjoys sports and helping out at home.

loans.use: To buy corn and rice seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Erdenchimeg

texts.en:
Erdenchimeg is 50 years old and lives with her daughters in Gobisumber province of Mongolia. Her two daughters are 18 and 14 years old and are a college student and a high school student, respectively. Erdenchimeg manages a mobile food trading business at the train station in her town. She started her business in 1996 after moving from Erdenet city. Aside from her main business, she is also a salesperson at the Delgereh grocery shop, and her monthly salary is 140,000MNT. She will be retired by the next year. Her oldest daughter also works as a waitress at the Delgereh food court during her summer break.

Erdenchimeg is a diligent and hard working woman who says, "I want to educate my daughters and prepare them to be good professionals". She is requesting a 900,000 MNT loan to pay the her daughter's tuition fee.

loans.use: To pay her daughter's tuition fee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabrics in bulk, thread, needles, and other supplies.

loans.name: Kat

texts.en:
Mrs. Kat is a 44-year-old married woman who is a good mother to her four children. She lives in the Ornlong Veng district of Siem Reap province in Cambodia.

Mrs. Kat is a hardworking farmer who earns a small daily profit to support her family.  All of her children are single.

To help pay her family's expenses, Kat's lovely husband is a construction worker who earns about $3 each day.  He spends money every day to take a motor taxi because his job is located far away from their village.  

Kat and her husband wish to have a motorbike but don't have enough money to buy one. 

Kat would like to request a loan to purchase a motorbike so her husband can get to work more economically.  She hopes that the motorbike will help make her family happier and save them money.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to help her husband get to work.

loans.name: Maria Norma

texts.es:
María Norma tiene 32 años de edad es casada vice con el esposo y con los seis hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la  VCR Vencedores Unidos, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Anchoveta vía al Recinto la Templanza, perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz. 

María se dedica  a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, Compra y vende los  productos en el Comercial Peña.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, insumos, fertilizantes, abonos para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es comprarse una casa y un carro.

En los tiempos libres le gusta asistir al rodeo montubio.
texts.en:
María Norma is 32 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and six children in the Ventanas canton, Los Rios province.  

The members of the Vencedores Unidos communal bank are in the community of Anchoveta, on the way to the community of  La Templanza. It belongs to the Pueblo Viejo canton. this bank is dedicated to short cycle agricultural  such as corn and rice.

María works in agriculture. She plants corn and rice. She does her buying and selling in Comercial Peña. She is asking for the loan to buy seeds, materials and fertilizers for her crops.  The loan will be financial support to meet her needs and face challenges such as pests and disease. Her dream is to buy a house and a car.  

She likes to go to the rural rodeo in her free time.

loans.use: lto buy seeds, materials, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Emommakhmad

texts.ru: Емоммахмад женат и у него 5 детей. Он занимается купля продажей овощей на местном центральном рынке. Более 15 лет он торгует на рынке и у него очень хороший опыт. В основном он продает  лук, картошка морковь и свеклу. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и улучшить свое условие жизни. Он запрашивает займ в размере 1000$ США для покупки овощей с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Emommakhmad is married and has five children.  He is involved in buying and selling vegetables at the local central market.  He has been selling at the market for over 15 years and has very good experience.  Emommakhmad primarily sells onions, potatoes, carrots and beats.  He wants to expand his business and improve his quality of life.  He is requesting this loan in the sum of $1000 for the purchase of vegetables in order to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
Gilberto tiene 38 años, es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador, es soltero y vive con su sobrino en su casa propia, en donde día a día realiza múltiples actividades para poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
El trabajo de Gilberto consiste en la siembra y cosecha de palma aceitera, trabajo que lo realiza desde ya 4 años, es así que se va muy temprano todos los días a su chacra en donde revisa como va el crecimiento y trata de mantener limpia sacando la mala hierva que crece. Para él éste trabajo es importante ya que le permitió solventar su hogar, además que puede apoyar a su sobrino, quien en ocasiones trabaja cuidando la chacra. Cuando hay mucha demanda de trabajo contrata peones para acelara más rápìdo su trabajo. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo para poder realizar algunas otras actividades, le esta yendo bien porque al igual que los demás agricultores sus productos se vende a buen precio. Este será el sexto crédito con MFP, por lo que espera el apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar trabajando. Con el monto solicitado de 1200 soles, comprará sacos de abono para su plantación de palma, además contratará peones para que lo ayuden a limpiar su chacra.
texts.en:
Gilberto, age 38, is a responsible and hardworking gentleman. He is single and lives with his nephew in his own home. Every day he engages in multiple activities in order to improve his quality of life. Gilberto’s work consists of cultivating and harvesting palm oil. He has been in this line of work for four years. Gilberto leaves early every day for his farm where he monitors the growth of his crops and maintains them by clearing out any harmful weeds. His work is important because it allows him to maintain his household and support his nephew, who occasionally does work around the farm. Whenever there is great demand for his product, Gilberto hires laborers in order to accelerate the completion of the work. What he enjoys about his job is having the time to pursue a few other activities. Like other farmers, Gilberto is doing well because he is able to sell his products at a good price.

This will be his sixth loan with MFP. Gilberto hopes to receive everyone’s support so that he can continue working. The loan of 1200 PEN that he requested will be used to buy sacks of compost for his palm tree plantation. In addition, he will hire laborers to help clear his farm.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of compost and to hire workers.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en: Eden is 24 years old . She is married with one child. Eden has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages and at the same time she has a bake shop where they personally bake cakes and breads. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 17,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages and ingredients for making cakes and breads. Eden has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Eden hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages and ingredients for making cakes and breads

loans.name: Sadaqat's Group

texts.en:
A talented 41-year-old lady, Sadaqat makes paper envelopes to support her husband in his paper envelope-making and selling business. Her husband has several different contacts to whom he supplies his material and earns better profits. 

Sadaqat is the mother of 3 sons. Her eldest son has a business of making artificial jewelry, while her second son is a butcher. Her third son is free nowadays. 

Sadaqat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband's business. With the loan, her husband will buy paper and gum, in bulk, for making larger quantities of paper envelopes and increase his sales and profits. Her husband has been operating his business for the past 15 years and is hopeful that an investment will bring positive changes to his business and improve the living standard of the family as a result. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Sadaqat.

loans.use: to buy paper and gum for paper envelope-making business

loans.name: Yelena

texts.ru:
Елена не замужем. У нее есть взрослая дочь Марина, ей 20 лет. Они живут в Никополе. Елена занимается розничной торговлей детской одеждой. У Елены всегда есть качественный товар на любой кошелек и вкус, поэтому на товар всегда есть спрос и постоянные покупатели. Елена начинала свое дело 11 лет назад. Тогда она работала на рынке, но потом перевела свою торговлю с базара в магазин. Теперь товар не затаскивается и не пачкается, а также появилось больше места, чтобы разложить одежду. Кроме того, Елена умело выбирает закупаемый товар, она зарекомендовала себя, как опытный и прилежный предприниматель.  

Елене необходимо финансовое содействие в виде кредита в 6 000 гривен для того, чтобы оплатить 2 семестр обучения дочери в вузе. У Елены нет такой крупной суммы на руках, а внести оплату нужно сразу и целиком. Полученные средства помогут Елене непосредственно заплатить за обучение дочери, а она сможет потом выплатить кредит постепенно. Будучи матерью одиночкой, Елена понимает, что ей не на кого рассчитывать, поэтому она очень надеется на кредит от КИВА.   
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Yelena is not married and has an adult daughter, Marina, who is 20 years old.  They live in Nikipol.  Yelena is involved in retail sales of children's clothing.  She always carries quality merchandise to satisfy every budget and taste, and this is why her merchandise is always in demand, and she has regular customers.  Yelena started her business 11 years ago.  At that time, she worked at a market, but then transferred her sales from the market to a store.  Now her merchandise does not get worn and dirty, and she has more space to display the clothing.  Besides, Yelena carefully selects the merchandise she buys and, thus, established herself as an experienced and diligent entrepreneur.  Yelena needs financial assistance in the form of a loan of 6,000 hryvnia to pay for her daughter's second semester of university study.  Yelena does not have such a large sum on hand, but the payment needs to be made right away and in full.  Obtained funds will help Yelena to pay for her daughter's education directly, and then she will be able to repay the loan gradually.  Being a single mother, Yelena understands that she has no one to count on and, hence, relies on the loan from Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's second semester of university study

loans.name: Bacilia Eugenia

texts.es:
Bacilia es socia del Banco Comunal “Kapia Marca” del distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y tiene 5 hijos, tres de ellos son independientes.

Trabaja desde hace cuatro años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, este dinero lo invirtió en su negocio de venta de productos naturales.

Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevo soles, comprará tres cajas de productos naturales de la marca Herbalife como batidos, medicinas naturales, Napol, extracto de sábila, trabaja junto con su esposo y los vende en diferentes lugares como Azángaro, Juliaca, Macusani y Rinconada.

La señora desea tener más clientes y buen ingreso económico todos los meses para poder solventar los gastos del hogar.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Bacilia is a member of the “Kapia Marca” communal bank in Yunguyo District and Province, Puno Department.  She’s 44 years old, married and has five children three of which are independent already.

She’s worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for four years.  Her first, 300 new sol, loan was used to invest in her business selling natural products.  She will use this new, 3000 new sol, loan to buy three cases of natural products of the Herbalife brand like blended drinks, natural medicines, Napol, aloe extract.  She works with her husband and sells in places like Azángaro, Juliaca, Macusani and Rinconada.

She wants to have more customers and good income every month to cover household expenses.  What she most likes about her communal bank is the punctuality.

loans.use: to buy various natural products.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 31 years old, married and has one child. She sells clothes and shoes to earn a living. She has engaged in this business for five years. Previously, she worked in farming.

She joined a group in Faulu Kenya. Through the group, she is able to save her money and access business loans easily because the members of the group guarantee each other's loans. She also has gained a lot of business ideas from her group members.

Faith hopes to expand her business in five years. She has requested 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: Doña Virginia es una clienta que tiene 41 años de edad, vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos. Es una señora humilde, trabajadora y dedicada a su familia. Se enteró de los servicios que ofrece Fundación Mujer por medio de otra clienta y le pareció la idea. Ella comenzó a generar ingresos propios con la venta de pollo, refrescos gaseosos y golosinas. Ahora ve la necesidad de invertir en una pulpería, debido a que en su comunidad no tiene competencia. Por ésta razón solicita por primera vez un financiamiento a la Fundación. Cuenta con el apoyo de su familia en las decisiones a tomar con respecto a su negocio. Tiene metas por cumplir y con la ayuda en su negocio puede logarlas.
texts.en:
Virginia is a 41 year old client.  She is in a common-law marriage, and she has two children.  She is a humble and hard-working woman who is dedicated to her family.

She found out about the services that Fundación Mujer offers from another client.  It seemed like a good idea to her.  By selling chicken, soft drinks, and sweets she started to generate her own income.

She now sees the need to invest in her grocery store because she does not have any competition in her community.  That is why she is requesting a loan for the first time from the Fundación.

She has support from her family in the decisions she makes with respect to her business.  She has goals to meet, and with the help in her business she will be able to achieve them.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
A sus 14 años, Carlos Alberto es un joven emprendedor que desde pequeño aprendió las labores propias de las ventas al lado de su padre con quien vendía diferentes productos en las calles del municipio de la Ceja al Oriente de Antioquia. 

Con la esperanza de progresar y tener una mejor calidad de vida, este joven emprendedor inició hace poco con su negocio de venta de productos de salud y belleza los cuales espera que se conviertan en el inicio de su gran sueño tener su propio almacén. 

Actualmente necesita de un préstamo para comprar productos propios de su negocio que le permitan ofrecerle a sus clientes mayor variedad y así incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
At 14 years of age, Carlos Alberto is a young entrepreneur who learned how to work on his own. Along with his father, he sells different products as a street vendor in the town of La Ceja, which is east of Antioquia.

With expectations of making progress and having a better quality of life, this young entrepreneur recently launched his own business selling health and beauty products. He expects to fulfill his dream of converting this venture into his own store.

Carlos currently needs a loan to buy products for his business, which will enable him to offer his customers a wide variety and to generate profits.

loans.use: to buy health and beauty products.

loans.name: Zadith

texts.es:
Zadith de 40 años es una madre soltera de 4 hijos de 22, 20, 17 y 11 años. Ella vive con 4 de ellos en su casa propia en la comunidad nativa de Pucharini en la provincia de Chanchamayo. Zadith es una mujer de negocios. A sus 20 años inició con la compra y venta de frutas. Con el pasar del tiempo, probó con las carnes y pescados, dándole buenos resultados. Actualmente se dedica a la compra y venta de yucas y pescados. “Compro las yucas por arrobas y las vendo en los restaurantes cuando me hacen pedidos y si me sobran lo vendo por kilo en mi casa”, comenta. Zadith tiene una tienda instalada en su casa, ahí ofrece frutas surtidas a los visitantes de la zona.  
Le va bien en estas actividades, por que adquiere su mercadería en cantidades considerables para abastecer a sus compradores.  Gracias a su esfuerzo puede mantener a sus hijos, quienes a la vez la ayudan en el traslado y distribución de sus productos. Con el entusiasmo que la caracteriza, admite que varias veces perdió su inversión por no conocer bien a los clientes, pero como ya lleva años en el negocio, confía que no le volverá a pasar. Éste sería su primer préstamo de MFP, por eso se responsabiliza de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. “Los Caciques de Menkoremón”, es el nombre de su reciente grupo comunal, del que confía sus logros futuros.
De recibir el dinero, lo invertirá en la compra de arrobas de yucas para atender sus pedidos en los restaurantes, además de frutas para surtir su puesto venta.
texts.en:
Zadith, 40, is a single mother of four, aged 22, 20, 17 and 11. She lives with all four in her own home in the indigenous community of Pucharini, in Chanchamayo Province. Zadith is a business woman. When she was 22 years old, she started buying and selling fruit. With the passage of time, she tried meat and fish, with good results. Currently she engages in buying and selling cassava and fish. “I buy cassavas by the bushel and I sell them to restaurants on order. If there are left overs, I sell the remainder by the kilo from home,” she notes. She has a store installed in her house and there she also sells assorted fruit to visitors in the area.

Zadith is doing well with these businesses because she buys her merchandise in considerable quantities to meet the demands of her customers. Thanks to her efforts she is able to support her children who at the same time help her in transporting and distributing her products. With characteristic enthusiasm, she admits that several times she lost her investment because she did not know her customers well but now that she has been in the business for years, she is confident that this will not happen again. 

This will be her first loan with MFP and she is committed to being punctual in making her monthly payments. The name of her new communal bank is “Los Caciques de Menkoremón” and she is confident of its future success. Upon receiving the money, she will invest it in the purchase of bushels of cassava in order to fill restaurant orders, as well as fruit to stock her sales stall.

loans.use: to purchase cassavas and a variety of fruits.

loans.name: Abdulai

texts.en: This is 35-year-old Abdulai. He is married and has two children, aged 10 and 13. He has one additional dependents, who lives with him as a sales assistant. In 2007, Abdulai established his business selling slippers, underwear, Pampers, etc. He began his business because he was trained up as a businessman. His business is located in the outskirts of the city, and his main customers are men and women. Working seven days a week, 10 hours a day, he earns about 500,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Abdulai requires a loan in order to increase his stock for resale. In the future, he plans to get a bakery as a source of more income. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more slippers for resale

loans.name: Ren's Group

texts.en:
A villager from the Battambang province’s Bovel district, Ren is 54 years old and married. She has four children. The main source of her family’s income is from farming rice and sometimes she works for others for a fee. Having been in this business for 8 years, she is able to earn daily income of KHR80,000 to support her family. 
This is the first loan for Ren with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Sena Seme 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SENA SEME 2 est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Philomène, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 48 ans est mariée à un certain Antoine. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et un à leur charge. Philomène vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par Philomène et son mari. Philomène n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour cette raison, Philomène vend des chaussures et des tous cousus depuis une trentaine d’années. Philomène s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Philomène sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SENA SEME 2 un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des chaussures et des tous cousus.

loans.name: Justine

texts.fr: Justine âgée de 42 ans n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Justine est mariée à un maçon du nom de Dossa. Le couple a trois enfants, aucun des enfants n'est scolarisé et un seule est à leur charge. Justine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges du ménage. Justine vend des boules d'akassa (pâte à base de maïs fermenté) accompagnées de poissons frits à son domicile depuis dix huit ans. De façon secondaire, Justine  vend aussi du vin de palme ; ce qui lui permet de contribuer à l'éducation et à l'entretien de son enfant. Justine s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. La clientèle de Justine devient de plus en plus grandissante. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Justine sollicite une sixième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter du poisson, du maïs et huile de palme.

loans.name: Jesukpego Group

texts.fr: JESUKPEGO est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la troisième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de A. Céline (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 35 ans, n'a pas fréquenté l'école. A. Céline a appris la coiffure, activité qu'elle exerce depuis dix ans dans sa région. A. Céline est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Taofic. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. A. Céline vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par A. Céline et son mari. Pour cette raison, A. Céline vend des mèches et des produits cosmétiques ; ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. A. Céline s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, A. Céline sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe JESUKPEGO, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des mèches et des produits cosmétiques.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
As the married mother of five children, Francisca works hard to support her family. She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fattening pigs.

Francisca is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Francisca has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Melani

texts.en:
Prior to starting her business, Melani worked as an educator in the local school district for 15 years. She is originally from Pittsburg and graduated with a teaching degree in 1995. Her business, Brick4Kids, offers STEM based after school programs, in-school trips, birthday parties, preschool classes and summer camps.

Melani is passionate about the work she does now because it allows her to continue working with kids while offering enrichment programs. She co-owns her business with her husband and employs between 8-10 teachers and teaching assistants per year. So far, Melani has had great success in witnessing outstanding growth in her students. Her greatest difficulty has been in securing enough locations that allow her to offer all of her programs.

Currently, Melani is seeking a loan to continue paying for marketing for her business and to purchase additional supplies needed for the growing number of after school programs her business now offers.

loans.use: to pay for marketing and purchase additional supplies needed for programs

loans.name: Marciano

texts.en:
41-year-old Marciano raises hogs to earn for a living. He hails from the town of Dagohoy, Bohol  with his wife and one dependent. He has sold hogs to locals and town dwellers in his place.

He join Kiva's field partner CEVI to access financial services. Marciano has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to invest in feed.
He  would like to boost his earnings by raising  more quality hogs and having sufficient supply of feeds to become sustainable.  Slowly, he could able to set aside enough savings to invest any business opportunities.
 
In the future, Marciano  is looking forward to have a stable source and extend thanks for the support.

loans.use: to invest in feed

loans.name: Mehmed

texts.en: Mehmed A. tills over 2 000 decares own and rented land in Razgrad region. He is 56 years old and has two sons. Mehmed grows tobacco, wheat, barley, corn and other grain crops. He also possess al the necessary equipment to till his land. The loan of $ 1200 he applies for will be used to supply fuel fir his machines.

loans.use: To supply fuel fir his machines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Elizabeth would like to buy pesticides to prevent worms from invading her farm

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
A. Esther comes from Tororo found in eastern Uganda. She a married lady with 5 children. She also taking care of other 2 children of her late brother.

She was introduced to life in Africa by another member. She joined in March 2006. She started learning how to make crafts and she perfected in paper beads. Due to her interest in craft making, she even sells her own crafts during the market day. She also makes bracelets where she earns 230,000/= per month.

Before she joined Life in Africa, she had a small business of brick making. This is the business she wishes to expand to earn her extra income to sustain the family.

Therefore she seeks a loan of 250,000/=. She will repay in 5 months. She will be making 10,000 bricks per month. Each brick is shillings 50.

Her break down is as below:

Labour for digging up and softening the mud ----------------------------------------30,000/=

Labour for shaping into bricks (boxing) and arranging ready for burning----------- 100,000/=

Buying firewood and burning the bricks------------------------- 120,000/=

Total 250,000/=

loans.use: Buying firewood and paying labourers

loans.name: Adesuwa

texts.en: Adesuwa Igbeinovia is 40 yearls old and married with 5 children; she is from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.  She sells clothes, shoes & bags. She needs the above loan for expansion.

loans.use: To buy shoes, clothes & bags for resale

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela is married to a tailor and has four children. She is a member of the Pajchani de Villa Tejada in the city of El Alto. She is dedicated to making and selling skirts and tablecloths, which she has been doing for 17 years. The tradition started with her oldest sister, who worked at a dressmaking factory and learned the craft and later passed it on to her siblings. Her main market is in the Villa Dolores zone of El Alto, and she also sells her goods at festivals and other markets. Currently she works with her eldest daughter, who has already learned the trade and makes high-quality goods. Marcela needs capital to be able to purchase more materials and fabrics, with the goal of producing a larger quantity of merchandise to prepare her business for the increased demand at the end of the year.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Marcela N., esta casada con un sastre, y es madre de 4 hijos, pertenece a la asociación Pajchani de Villa Tejada en la ciudad de El Alto.
