El Sr. Jahuer trabaja como taxista, es propietario de un auto con el cual trabaja por toda la ciudad de Cochabamba, su esposa vende Carbon ecologico en una zona comercial llamada "la cancha". Juntos generan ingresos para poder sustentar a la familia.

El Sr. Jahuer necesita dinero para poder comprar un lote de terreno y asi poder independizarse y construir su casa propia. Para mjorar la calidad de vida para su hija y esposa. En el futuro quiere solicitar otro credito para poder terminar de construir su casa y seguir progresando y mejorando las condiciones de vida para toda su familia.
texts.en:
Jahuer is 22, and he has been married to Lizeth Zurita for two years. They have a two year old daughter who goes to nursery school. They still live in Lizeth’s mother’s house. Jahuer is a taxi driver. He has his own car, which he uses to work all over the city of Cochabamba. His wife sells ecological coal in La Cancha, a commercial area. Together they generate enough income to be able to support their family. Jahuer needs money to be able to buy a plot of land. That way he would be able to become independent and build his own house. This would improve the quality of life for his daughter and his wife. In the future, he wants to ask for another loan to be able to finish building his house, to keep progressing, and keep improving life conditions for all of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a plot of land

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina tiene 34 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 3 hijos, con los que vive en su casa propia.
Laboriosamente y con mucha agilidad trabaja en sus cultivos de café y plátanos, de este modo se da tiempo para trabajar como peón en las chacras de sus vecinos, donde le pagan 13 soles a ella y 15 soles a su esposo por el día. Si reciben contratas para quitar la maleza se levanta a las 4 de la mañana, prepara los alimentos y a las 8 de la mañana ya deben estar en las chacras. Por muy pesado que parezca esta labor, a Marcelina no le parece nada cansado, es más ama lo que hace. De ese modo obtiene el dinero que puede gastar independientemente con las necesidades de sus hijos y su madre anciana. 
Sus anhelos para el futuro son de incrementar sus siembras para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Es su tercer crédito con MFP y ratifica su compromiso a su banco comunal de pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita comprará fertilizantes químicos para abonar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Marcelina, 34, lives with her husband and three children in her own home. Laboriously and with much agility she farms her coffee and banana plantations so that she can have time to also work as a paid laborer on her neighbors' farmlands. For this work she is paid 13 soles a day (her husband earns 15 soles a day). If they are hired to do weed removal she gets up at 4am, prepares the daily meals and must be on the farmlands at 8am. As heavy as the work might seem, Marcelina does not find it tiring, what is more...she loves what she does. This allows her to obtain money which she can spend independently on 'the needs of her children and her aged mother. Her dreams for the future are to enlarge her plantings to improve her family's quality of life. This is her third loan with MFP and she pledges to repay on time. The funds will be used to buy chemical fertilizers for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Nkosuo Group

texts.en:
Joyce is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. Fishing is the major occupation of the people.

She is a baker. Joyce is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Nkosuo,' meaning progress. The members of the group are mainly into fishing and other commercial activities and they request a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. Joyce, the group leader, is in the middle of the photograph. It is their desire to give their children the best of education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en:
Mrs. Kalpana D., a resident of Chapagaun, lives in a single family with her husband and one daughter. Chapagaun is one of the developing villages of lalitpur and most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Her husband Mr. Sankhar D. works in a private office and her daughter is in pre-primary school.

Mrs. D. is engaged in goat farming and has four goats in her farm. She sells the goats in the local market. This business helps her to contribute something to upgrading the living standard of her family. She is requesting her third loan of Rs 20000.00 to buy more goats and grain for goat feed.

loans.use: to buy young goats and feed

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarin M. is 50 years old and lives in Kouk Doang village in the Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 4.5 hectares on which to cultivate rice. On this plantation, she has some problems because her field has infertile soil. Thus, Mrs. Sarin Men decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field. She would use the rest of the loan to buy a watering machine to water her crop. 

Her husband, Mr. Lorn Om, is a house contractor and he can earn a little income to help his family. She is the mother of three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the youngest is attending the local school. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support the field and to buy a watering machine to water her crop

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael O. R. is 48 years old, married and has six children between the ages of ten and one years old. He owns a garage and sells auto spare parts on a busy street in Kisumu. He employs three people. He has been in this kind of business for the last 19 years. 

Since his business is doing well, he made a decision to take out a loan to buy more auto spare parts to expand his business. He works hard from early morning to late evening to make sure that he is not thrown out of business as there are so many people doing the same kind of business as his. He hopes to buy a car some day. He is a very hardworking and determined man.

loans.use: Auto spares

loans.name: Salam

texts.en: Salam P.'s main source of income comes from selling cooked food for daily meals as well as vegetables like squash and fruit like pomelo. She is 46 years old, married and has four grown-up children. They are from the village of Panduma, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. Salam has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, Salam joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Salam has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC which was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Salam is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: Martha Lorena D. en el 2004 instalo un pequeño taller de calzado que carecía de las condiciones necesarias para el trabajo pero con los créditos ella ha logrado además de invertir en la producción mejorar las instalaciones con sus ganancias. Esto hizo que establecer un negocio más prospero actualmente invertirá en la producción de una línea veraniega de calzado por lo que está cerca semana santa.
texts.en:
In 2004 Martha Lorena D. set up a small cobbler's shop that lacked the necessary components to do the work. However, with funding she has been able to invest in production and to improve the installations with her profits. This led to a more prosperous business and she will currently invest in a line of Summer shoes because Holy Week is approaching.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoemaking supplies and raw materials.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora confecciona buzos y chamarras deportivas para niños, que son comercializadas en la feria 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto; es madre soltera de un hijo de 17 años, quien le ayuda en la confección de sus productos.

Vive en la casa de sus abuelos ubicada en la zona 16 de julio de la misma ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para comprar materia prima (tela) para poder incrementar sus ingresos económicos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Kiva, la evaluación realizada permite aprobar el préstamo solicitado por Dora.
texts.en:
Dora makes sportswear for children that she sells in the city of El Alto's 16 de Julio market; she is a single mother of a 17-year-old son, who helps her make the clothing. She lives in her grandparents' house, which is located in the 16 de Julio neighborhood of El Alto as well. She will use the funds to buy raw materials (fabric) in order to increase her income. This is her first Kiva loan; the evaluation we carried out indicates that Dora qualifies for loan approval.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric to continue making children's sportswear.

loans.name: Small-Small Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the 'Small-Small' group from Magubraka town, in northern Sierra Leone. They are small-scale entrepreneurs who have applied for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each member of the group in order to expand their businesses. Consequently, they can make more sales, better profit and improve their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Fatmata S. K.. Fatmata was born in Magburaka. She is married and has five children. Fatmata’s husband is a motor mechanic and her children are attending schools – one in secondary school and four in primary school. For eight years now, Fatmata has been selling medicines. With her share of the loan, she will buy Penadol, Chloroquine, ORS, and many different kinds of tablets to add to her pharmacy inventory. 

(Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo.)

loans.use: Buy Penadol, Chloroquine, ORS, etc., to add to her pharmacy inventory

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin se dedica a  trabaja como chofer; su esposa es pasanaquera (Pasanaco es un sistema básico de ahorro donde un grupo establecido de personas acuerdan a ahorrar un monto definido de dinero al año, a ser pagado cada mes y cada mes se sortea a la persona a quien le toca todo ese dinero, y así sucesivamente durante el periodo que dura el pasanaco) la labor de la psanaquera es asegurarse de recoger la cuota mensual de cada uno de los participantes y entregar el total recogido a la persona sorteada; por este trabajo ella recibe una comisión. Estas dos actividades constituyen las principales fuentes de ingreso mensual  con las que cubren la manutención de su familia, tienen 3  hijos con las edades de 15, 6 y 3 años. Tiene su domicilio en la  Zona de Ernesto Torrez  de la  ciudad de La Paz.
 
El préstamo lo destinará a la compra de motor y caja para su movilidad.
 
Es su primer crédito con Impro a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Edwin works as a driver, his wife is pasanaquera (Pasanaco is a basic system of savings where an certain group of people agree to save an established amount of money in a year, to be paid every month and every month a member who will received the money is drawn, and so on during the period that the pasanaco lasts). Her job is to collect the monthly fee from each of the participants and deliver the total collected to the chosen person; for this work she receives a commission. These two activities are the main sources of their monthly income, that they use to support their family. They have 3 children, of 15, 6 and 3 years of age. They live in the area of Ernesto Torres in the city of La Paz. The loan will be used to purchase a new engine and a gearbox for his vehicle. This is his first loan from Impro through Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of engine and gearbox for taxi

loans.name: Valeai

texts.en:
Valeai S. is 40 and married with 6 children (ages one month - 23).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Valeai has 5 years of experience in this business.  Valeai needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Valeai joined SPBD.    This is her 5th loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Valeai's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Yanina

texts.es: Yanina, de  31 años, vive con su hijo de 9 años y sus padres  en su casa que es propia.Desde hace 5 años, trabaja en la venta de artesanías. Aprendió de muy pequeña pues sus padres producen  tejidos y  artesanías. Paralelamente a esta actividad también se dedica a la  venta de comida  en su  casa que esta ubicada en una de las principales avenidas de su localidad. Trabaja durante todos los días, de manera incansable a fin de tener las ganancias que necesita, según ella, la ubicación de su negocio es el punto clave de las considerables ventas que tiene. Y para más adelante desea instalar un local más amplio, muy presentable para mejorar la imagen de su negocio.Es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y agradece  a todas las personas que hicieron posible el préstamo, pues le será muy útil  en el progreso de su negocio.Yanina tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado  en la compra de materiales de construcción para mejorar la infraestructura de su local.
texts.en:
Yanina is 31 years old and lives in the home of her parents with her nine year old son. She has been selling handicrafts for the past five years. As a young girl, Yanina learned how to make woven and handcrafted items from her parents. In addition, she sells food from her home which is located on one of the main avenues in her community. According to Yanina, she works tirelessly every day to earn the income that she needs. The location of her business is a key factor behind her significant sales. In the future, she wants to move into a larger location that is presentable so that she can improve the image of her business.

This is her first loan with MFP. Yanina is grateful to everyone who made this loan possible since it will be very useful for making progress in her business. She plans to invest the money in the purchase of construction materials to improve the infrastructure of her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building materials to improve the infrastructure of her store

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa G., from the village of Nungnungan, Cauayan City, Isabela, is 49 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Teresa has been planting and harvesting rice for sale for over 29 years, earning approximately 65000 PHP during harvest season.

In 2009, Teresa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her fourth from ASKI for 50000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise, Teresa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Honey Fe

texts.en:
Honey Fe G. is from the village of Katutungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 40 years old. Honey Fe is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Honey Fe owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling beauty products and other cosmetics in the local community. Honey Fe is just starting this business.

In 2010, Honey Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Honey Fe is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Honey Fe from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 32 años, es una mujer trabajadora, que vive con su pareja Giovanni, de 37 años y sus cuatro hijos, en su casa propia, el cuál construyó para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Lleva 15 años dedicada al cultivo de café y plátanos, en donde su esposo la acompaña en este trabajo que le resulta gratificante, ya que depende de ello para mantener a su familia. Por tanto procura cuidar estas plantaciones e incrementar su producción. Por otro lado, administra una tienda, instalada en el interior de su casa, en donde aprovecha la afluencia de personas que trabajan en una mina cerca de su domicilio. De esta manera vende productos como: golosinas, bebidas gasificadas y hojas de C. que son muy solicitados por los trabajadores de dicha mina. Por tal razón desea surtir productos de primera necesidad hasta convertirla en un mini Market. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, y está seguro que cumplirá con cada pago puntualmente, como lo hizo en el primer crédito, además le gusta trabajar con su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de plantas de café y varios sacos de abono orgánico, que plantará en los terrenos libres que tiene.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 32, is a hard-working woman who lives with her partner, Giovanni, age 37, and their four children, in their own home which she built to offer their children a better quality of life. For 15 years she has grown coffee and plantains, with her husband. It is a gratifying job, and she depends on it to maintain their family. Thus, she wants to take care of these crops and increase her production. She also runs a store, located in their home, where she takes advantage of the flow of people who work in a mine close to her home. She sells products such as: candy, soft drinks and C. leaves which are highly requested by the mine workers. For this reason she wants to stock basic products and convert her store into a mini market. This is her second loan with MFP, and she is sure that she will complete each payment on time, as she did on the first loan. Furthermore, she likes working with her community group. With the requested loan, she will invest in the purchase of coffee plants and some bags of organic fertilizer, which she will plant on her empty land.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: th purchase coffee plants and organic fertilizer

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en:
Francoise is 37 years old and has three children, aged 2, 10, and 12 years. Two of her children are in school, while the other is not yet of school age.

Francoise and her husband are both welders. She has been in the business for 16 years. She is a person of integrity and she makes good equipment. For these reasons, people like the products she sells.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy more raw materials so she can increase production and make more profits.

loans.use: To buy raw materials in order to increase welding production.

loans.name: Panfila

texts.en:
Panfila C. is from the town of Baclayon. She is 55 years old. Panfila is married and has 5 children. Her youngest is 15 and still goes to school. To make a living, Panfila owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Panfila has been engaged in her business for over 10 years. She recently started cooking meals that she also sells to community members. 

Panfila joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Panfila has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Panfila is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house and pay her child's tuition fees. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Nicha

texts.fr:
Jeune femme de 24 ans, mariée et mère d’un enfant. En 2007 elle se lance dans la vente des produits cosmétiques, mèches, et tissages. Son étalage est juste devant sa maison, donc tous les matins, elle étale sa marchandise et le soir elle la fait rentrer.
Ses ventes journalières sont de 15000 à 20000 fers par jour, ses clientes sont les femmes du quartier, les clientes des salons de coiffure qui sont aux alentours.

A l’octroi de son prêt elle a l’intention d’acheter des produits de beauté comme des douzaines de  lait de toilette, des crèmes de beauté, savons de toute marques , des mèches et tissages de toutes qualités …
Elle épargne parce qu’a l’avenir elle veut aller dans une école professionnelle de coiffure et  a la fin de sa formation ouvrir son propre salon de coiffure ou elle pourrait employer au moins deux coiffeuses.
texts.en:
This young 24-year-old woman is married and has one child. In 2007, she started selling cosmetic products, hair extensions and weaves. She displays her merchandise right outside her home, bringing it out every morning and putting it away every night. Her daily sales average 15,000 to 20,000 francs. Her customers are women from the neighborhood, clients of the local hair salons. With her loan, she plans to purchase beauty products including dozens of lotions, face creams, various brands of soaps, hair extensions and weaves of any grade. She is saving in order to enroll in a professional hairstyling school. Upon finishing her training, she would like open her own hair salon and hire at least two hairdressers.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase hair extensions, weaves, cosmetic products and imported beverages

loans.name: Wilmer Antonio

texts.es:
Wilmer es casado con la Sra. Maritza Hernandez con quien tiene 3 niños: Ana Maria de 13 años estudiando el 1er año de secundaria, Luis Manuel de 10 años en 4to grado de primaria y el menor de 11 meses de edad de nombre Wilmer. Trabaja para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa como policia municipal desde hace 6 meses. 

Esta solicitando  su 1er credito con el objetivo de construir un anexo en su casa y asi contar con mayor comodidad, pues su familia esta creciendo y desea que sus hijos tengan mas espacio y privacidad.  

Wilmer sueña con poder brindarle a su familia las mejores condiciones posibles.
texts.en:
Wilmer is married with Mrs. Martiza Hernandez and they have 3 children together. Ana Maria is 13 years old and she is in grade 7, Luis Manuel is 10 years old and he is in grade 4, and the baby is 11 months old and his name is Wilmer. He has worked as a municipal security guard in the city hall of Juigalpa. He requests a first time loan with the goal of making an addition to their home, to improve the family's comfort. His family is growing and he wants his children to have more room and greater privacy. Wilmer dreams of providing his family with the best living conditions possible.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build an addition to his house.

loans.name: United Group

texts.en:
Helena K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called the United Group. She is 33 years old and married with five children who are between the ages of 2 and 18 years. She was only able to attend school through 10th grade due to financial constraints.

For three years, she has been selling ladies blouses in the Waterside Market in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000-Liberian-Dollars portion of this 30,000-Liberian-Dollars group loan to buy more dozens of ladies blouses.

She describes herself as a friendly woman whose dream is to improve her business and to continue to educate her children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more dozens of ladies blouses

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria B. is from the city of Gango Ozamiz City. She is 50 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Maria owns & operates a general store where she sells a variety of products like dried fish, bagoong (fish paste), rice and corn grits, ripe fruits, candies and bread. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Maria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Maria is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the third loan taken out by Maria from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Mrs. Laxmi C. lives in Bhaishipati, Lalitpur. She lives in a single family household with four members: herself, her husband and two sons. Her husband, Mr. Bishnu C., is a driver. Her older son studies at the university and younger son is studying in grade 12.

Mrs. Laxmi C. started selling cows' milk three years ago. She already owns one cow. Now she is requesting a loan of Rs 15,000.00 to buy another young cow to sell milk, because she lives in a growing neighborhood and in that area the demand for milk is increasing. In Nepal, people love to drink cows' milk so the demand for milk is increasing constantly.

loans.use: to buy a young cow

loans.name: Silva

texts.en:
Silva B. lives in Yerevan with her husband, a son, a daughter-in-law, and a grandchild. 

For about 7 years Silva has been engaged in trading women's clothing.  On weekdays she trades clothes in a rented place in “Surmalu” market, and on weekends at night she runs her business in “Hrazdan” market (where villagers come for wholesale purchases to resell).  

At her stalls she sells tracksuits, dressing gowns, and house suits, which she purchases from Syria and Turkey twice a month.  

Silva's husband helps her a lot at her business, and they support their family and their son's young family, because Silva's son is a singer and he doesn't earn a lot of money yet.    

Silva intends to use part of her business profit to purchase merchandise from China in the future, as it is more profitable (Silva says in China clothes are cheaper than in Syria and Turkey).

Silva is asking for a $2,500 loan to buy a new assortment for her business: blouses, sweaters, etc.

loans.use: To buy blouses and sweaters for resale

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal "VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO"; la socia vive en la comunidad campesina D. Pongobamba distrito D. Chinchero y provincia D. Urubamba, departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Agustina; ella tiene 59 años D. edad ella es V. y tiene 2 hijos;  la socia se dedica a la agricultura como principal fuente D. ingreso económico, la socia trabaja en sus tierras junto a sus hijos ellos solicitan ayuda D. la comunidad porque actualmente como era en el tiempo D. los inkas existía el famoso AYNI (ayuda al projimo en sus tierras para sembrar y cosechar); la socia siembra papa y maíz luego ella venD. estos productos y es así como se mantiene y ayuda en los estudios a sus hijos, la socia no tuvo la suerte D. estudiar ni la secundaria y desD. muy niña se puso a trabajar en las tierras D. sus padres, hoy ella comprenD. que el estudio es muy importante ahora para que ellos tengan mejor oportunidad en la vida. La socia solicita el préstamo para  invertir en la compra D. maíz y pap para sembrar en sus tierras para cosechar el año entrante.

Los otros socios se dedican ala agricultura y a la crianza D. animales menores.

La socia agradece el préstamo que se le otorgará y se compromete a seguir trabajando con mucho ahincó para cumplir con los pagos y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Agustina belongs to the “Virgen del Rosario” (Virgin of the Rosary) community bank.  She lives in the rural community of Pongobamba, in Chinchero district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Agustina is 59 years old.  She is a widow and has two children.  Her main source of income is farming.  She works on her land together with her sons.  They ask for help from their community because currently, as was the case in the time of the Inca,  there exists the famous AYNI system (a form of communal work where neighbors help each other on their lands at sowing and harvest time).  Agustina grows potatoes and corn which she then sells.  This is how she supports herself and helps her children with their studies.  Agustina herself wasn't lucky enough to study at secondary level and she started working on her parents' land when she was a very little girl.  Today she understands that studying is very important if her children are to have a better opportunity in life.  She is requesting a loan to invest in buying corn and potatoes to sow on her lands and harvest next year.

The other members of the group also farm and raise young animals.

Agustina is grateful for the loan which she will receive and pledges to continue working hard to make her repayments and improve her business.

loans.use: To invest in buying corn and potatoes to sow on her lands and harvest next year

loans.name: Mutangu

texts.en:
Mutangu is a 44 year-old man who is married to Mbula, who is a 40 year-old housewife. They are blessed with 2 children. Mutangu sells tomatoes in an open-air market in Emali town. He has been in this business for 20 years, and has been able to get very loyal clients, thus being able to make 15,000 KES as his monthly profit. 

Friends introduced him to KADET LTD. This is his first loan. He plans to use this loan to restock his business with more tomatoes. The anticipated profits will be used to expand the business. Mutangu hopes to become self-sustainable in his business.

loans.use: To restock his tomato business

loans.name: Amon

texts.en: Amon, a 29-year-old married father of three children, owns a house in Kasese, Uganda.  For 10 years he has been operating a retail shop and cattle-rearing business which he started with capital of 150,000 Uganda shillings.  Amon now has 3,000,000 Uganda shillings plus 30 cows. His hardships are low capital and lack of sufficient grazing land.  He dreams of having a wholesale business, cross-breeding his cattle, and educating his children. Amon is requesting  the loan to buy beer, bread and soap for his shop.

loans.use: To buy beer, bread and soap for his shop

loans.name: Pauline Nateleng

texts.en:
Pauline Nateleng L. is 29 years old and has been selling fruits and vegetables in Naivasha market for the last two years.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her second loan.  She repaid her first loan of 25,000 KES in good time.  She plans to use this loan to buy potatoes, carrots, and onions to sell.

In the future, Pauline hopes to be selling fruits and vegetables in large quantities, buying the produce directly from the farmers, and selling to the local retailers.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes, carrots, and onions

loans.name: Confiance Group

texts.fr: Masika M. E.  est entrepreneur, présidente du groupe Confiance, âgée de 42 ans, mariée, mère de 8 enfants.  Son conjoint est entrepreneur d’une officine pharmaceutique. La cliente Masika M. E.  est artiste, elle tisse les chapeaux dames en files à son domicile et les vendre au marché central de Virunga.  Environs 4 ans, qu’elle exerce cette activité d’art.  Elle bénéficia de premier  crédit de l’IMF  Hekima de 50$ vers janvier 2010. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des matériels de confection (files raphia, dentelles, tissus, etc.) et d’augmenter sa part du marché.  En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son activité. La cliente Masika M. E.  remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Le groupe confiance est constitué de 35 membres.
texts.en: Masika M. E. is an entrepreneur, the president of the Confiance group, 42 years old, married and the mother of 8 children.  Her spouse is a businessman in a pharmacy dispensary.  The client, Masika M. E., is an artist.  She weaves women's hats from threads at her home and sells them at the central market of Virunga.  It has been about four years that she has run this art business.  She benefited from her first loan of $50 from the IMF Hekima in January 2010.  This new credit should allow her to restock on clothing materials (raffia threads, laces, cloths, etc.) and to increase her share of the market.  Moreover, her ambition is to grow her business.  The client Masika M. E. thanks Hekima for its actions in favor of the poor, who are excluded from classic banks.  She group Confiance is made up of 35 members.

loans.use: raffia threads, laces, cloths, etc.

loans.name: Pablo Absalon

texts.es:
Pablo es un pequeño comerciante, con una pulpería que inicio hace quince años. Iniciando con ventas ambulantes en varios barrios de la capital, con ventas de atoles, cereales, frutas, verduras. Comenzando con poco dinero lo que con las ganancias lograba aumentar más sus ventas.
Buscando alternativas para hacer crecer su pequeño negocio, comienza con financiamiento de crédito a plazos en Afodenic, en donde en el transcurso del tiempo logra poner estable una pulpería que hoy en día se dedica a vender en su casa de habitación, debido a su edad. Con estos préstamos ha logrado mejorar estabilidad de ventas, la captación de clientes fijas así como la mejora de su vivienda.
Con este nuevo préstamo comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro para hacer un muro en la parte de enfrente el cual tiene cerrado con láminas de zinc. Lo que dará a su casa mejor seguridad, como  a su familia.
texts.en:
Pablo is a small business owner with a local store he started fifteen years ago. He began as a travelling salesman in different neighbourhoods of the capital selling atoles (a maize drink), cereals, fruit, and vegetables. He started with little money and with his earnings was able to increase his sales. Looking for alternatives to make is small business grow, he started with loan funding in installments from Afodenic, and as time went by he managed to open a local store in which he now works selling from his home due to his age. With these loans he has managed to improve the stability of his sales and attract loyal customers, as well as improve his house.
With this new loan he will buy construction materials such as stone, sand, cement, and iron to build a wall on the front of his house which he has closed with corrugated tin sheets. This will give his house and family better security.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a front wall to better protect his house and family

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita T. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 40 years old. Mercedita is married and has two children, ages 20 and 19. To make a living, Mercedita plants and harvests rice and corn for sale. Mercedita works hard to have a stable business.

Mercedita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Mercedita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Mercedita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to buy rice and corn seed, fertilizer, and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Rajube

texts.en:
Rajube is currently in the business of selling beans, fish, onions, cooking oil, small fish and siko (a local beer).  She is 31 years old and married to a man who is in the army.  They have 6 children and one of them goes to school.

Rajube borrowed a loan to stock more beans, fish, onions, cooking oil, small fish and siko to sell. She hopes to expand her business with any extra profits in the future.

loans.use: stock more beans, fish, onions, cooking oil, small fish and siko to sell.

loans.name: Nakali

texts.en:
Nakali is a widow with 10 children, all of whom attend school. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Nakali has operated a restaurant business for the past four years. Her potential customers visiting the restaurant are travelers, those who are in transit. Nakali dreams of expanding her business to a hotel in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, maize flour and sugar

loans.name: Nairi

texts.en:
Nairi N. was born in 1960 in Ijevan city. He is married and has four children: three daughters and a son, who is serving in the Armenian army now. Nairi’s two daughters are married and live separately, and the youngest is a student. Nairi lives in Achajur village within the area of Ijevan.

Nairi and his wife have farmed and raised animals for a long time. They have a fruit orchard and grow grapes, wheat and oats (which they use as a fodder for their farm animals) as well. Nairi and his wife raise pigs and cows and are also beekeepers.

With income from his farm Nairi was able to pay for his children’s education, organized his daughter’s wedding and bought necessary furniture for his home. Now with his income from farming, Nairi supports his son in the army and pays for his younger daughter’s education.

This is Nairi’s fourth loan from Nor Horizon. He is now asking for a loan of 1,000,000 AMD to buy a bull calf and some beehives for his farm.

loans.use: To buy a bull calf and some beehives

loans.name: Aubaine Plus Group

texts.en:
Jean is the president of a Community bank named “Aubaine Plus,” which is composed of 25 microentrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses.

Jean started his business in 2006 with an initial capital of US $80, selling spices. Today, he operates a general store in the northeastern area of Kinshasa.

He is 32 years old, married and has four children between the ages of 10 and 12 years old. The four of them go to school.  

Jean is happy to be part of one of HOPE’s groups. He joined in February 2010, and his business has been reinforced through the three loans he received. He has repaid them all correctly. His dream is to open a soft drink store. He will use the loan to increase the inventory of his business in order to reinforce the working capital

loans.use: to increase the inventory of his business in order to reinforce the working capital

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en:
Seraphine is 34 years old and married.  She has three children between the ages of three and nine. Her business is well-organized. She employs one person to help her. Seraphine has one year of experience and works from 6 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day.

Seraphine has requested a loan from Kiva in order to purchase more bananas to sell. Seraphine will invest the loan in her business and save the extra income to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Safarali

texts.ru: Сафарали житель района Хуросон. Ему 40 лет. Он женат, имеет 8 детей. Живет вместе с родителями. Его жена домохозяйка. В семье он один работает. У него высшее образование. По профессии он агроном. В этой области проработал 5 лет. На сегодняшний день он занимается торговлей. Рядом с домом он открыл продуктовый магазин. Кредит берет для покупки муки, сахара, масла, конфет, и колбасных изделий.
texts.en: Safarali lives in Khuroson. He is forty years old, married, and has eight children. He lives with his parents. His wife is a housewife. He is the only one in the family who is employed.  He has a higher education as an agronomist.  He worked in his field for five years. Now he works in trade. He opened a grocery shop near his house. He is taking out a loan to buy flour, sugar, oil, sweets, and sausages.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, oil, sweets, and sausages.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 29 years old.  She is married and has 6 childdren, 4 of them go to school.  Mary sells fish.  She has borrowed a loan to stock more fish to sell.  She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits.

loans.use: stock more fish to sell

loans.name: Jose Benito

texts.es: José Benito se dedica a la venta y elaboración de bloques. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda, pues es aquí donde obtiene más espacio para la elaboración de sus productos y además es un lugar muy concurrido por sus clientes. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de cemento, piedrín, hierro, arena, perlines ladrillos y otros. Siempre se ha esforzado por brindarle a su familia los ingresos necesarios,  José ha sido un gran padre al proporcionarles a sus hijos los estudios necesarios.
texts.en: José Benito is engaged in the sale and production of cinder blocks. His business is located in his home, as this is where he can get more space for the production of his products.  It is also a popular place for his customers. The reason for the loan is to purchase cement, gravel, iron, sand, bricks and other items. He has always striven to provide his family with the necessary income.  Jose has been a great father, providing his children with the necessary education.

loans.use: to purchase cement, gravel, iron, sand, bricks and other items.

loans.name: Aguida

texts.en: Aguida is a married woman with two children. She is 51 years old and has had a sari sari (variety) store business for a year. Aguida sells items like vinegar, instant noodles. and shampoo. She usually earns about 1,000 PHP per month and hopes to improve her earnings. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, instant noodles and daily use products. In the future, she hopes to rebuild her house and have her children finish schooling.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, instant noodles and daily use products

loans.name: Inviolata

texts.en:
Inviolata is 40 years old and married, with two children. She runs a tailoring business in Kakamega, Kenya. Inviolata has had this business for four years and has three employees. She has borrowed a loan of KES 30,000 to buy materials for making clothes to sell to the local people.

Inviolata's future plan is to grow her business and employ more people. She also plans to buy a plot of land where she will build a house for her family. Inviolata describes herself as a visionary lady.

loans.use: to buy materials

loans.name: Maria Reyna

texts.es:
María tiene 62 años D. edad, es casada y vive en el distrito D. Cayalti, un distrito tranquilo D. la provincia D. Chiclayo, Maria vive con hijo, quien la apoya en las labores D. su negocio, su familia es unida y su comunidad se dedicaban al comercio, agricultura y ganadería..

Maria se dedica desD. hace varios años a la compra y venta D. animales. Ella los cría en corrales que se encuentran en la parte posterior D. su domicilio y cuando estos han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes D. la zona y en algunas ocasiones a sus vecinos y pobladores del distrito. 

Ella desea comprar animales para engorD. y alimentarlos con productos balanceados y  poder así mejorar el desarrollo D. sus animales y venderlos a mejor precio. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 3000 nuevos soles.

María es una persona trabajadora y bastante responsable. Las personas que lo conocen la consideran alguien tranquilo y confiable.
texts.en:
María is 62, married, and lives in the Cayalti district, a peaceful district of the province of Chiclayo. Maria lives with her child, who helps her with her business. Her family is united. In her community, residents work in traD., agriculture and livestock.

Maria has bought and sold animals for several years. She raises them in corrals located at the back of her home, and when the animals have reached a good stage of development she offers them for sale to the various businesspeople in the zone. Sometimes she sells to neighbours and the residents of the district.

She wants to purchase animals to fatten, and balanced feed, and thus be able to improve the development of her animals. This will allow her to sell them at a better price. For this reason she has decided to request a loan of 3000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Maria is a hard-working and very responsible person. Those who know her say she is calm and reliable.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and balanced food for said livestock.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is a fishmonger at Elmina. She smokes and sells fish. To smoke the fish, you go to the sea shore to buy fresh fish from the fishermen.  When you come home with the fish, you clean them. Once you drain the water from the fish, the fish will be ready to be smoked. Firewood and a traditionally-built oven are prepared to smoke the fish. The cooking time for the fish varies depending on the size of the fish and their arrangement in the oven. 
The most important thing about this process is that it is the smoke, not the fire, that cooks the fish. The smoke gives the fish its dark color. Green leaves are used as coverings for the fish to prevent the smoke from escaping into the air. The heat should also be moderate as too much heat would not allow the fish to cook properly.

Cape Coast is a town in the Central Region of Ghana that is known to be a fishing community. Most women in this region are fishmongers who supply other surrounding villages with fish.  

Ama is married to an electrician and lives together with her three children. She assists her partner to pay the utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to smoke. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to smoke.

loans.name: La Bendicion 1 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Altagracia is the coordinator of her group "La Bendicion" (Blessing) 1 & 4. She makes her home here in a simple house with her long-time partner. She says that her most difficult challenge is to raise and provide for her family. Her two children are grown. She plans to continue enjoying working most of the time.

This Esperanza associate began with us because she needed to start up a business. Later, she met some neighbors to form a group in her community and start getting loans to do business and make changes in their lives.  She has had her business for over six years, starting after the first loan she received from Esperanza. 

Her group is located in the rural area surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural area.

Altagracia is excited to be taking out her 11th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanded her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying pants, shirts, underwear and shoes. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and to save.

Her dream is to live safely and comfortably.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Mokire

texts.en:
Mokire is 55 years old.  He is married and has ten children. He has been a wheat farmer for the past  fifteen years.  Mokire has applied for his second loan with KADET ltd, which he will use to buy farm inputs such as wheat seeds and to pay for land preparation.  With the profits generated, he plans to pay school fees for his children. 

Mokire dreams of becoming a prominent farmer. He is a hardworking man who works hard to attain, notwithstanding his limited resources and age.

loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: El señor Manuel Antonio se dedica al transporte escolar de esta misma ciudad desde hace 6 años, trasladando a los estudiantes de primaria y preescolar desde su casa hacia la escuela y viceversa. En este momento el camión donde transporta a los niños necesita mantenimiento por eso quiere un préstamo para comprar las partes que necesita y pagar al mecánico que le hará el trabajo. Manuel Antonio desea tener su unidad en mejores condiciones para ofrecer a los niños mejor servicio y los padres mayor seguridad. De esta manera se prevendrá de tener un accidente a causa de un problema técnico. Para Manuel es muy importante tener el transporte en buenas condiciones por que su fuente de ingresos más fuerte que recibe, aparte trabaja en maquiladora para ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel Antonio has been operating  a school bus in this city for six years, transporting primary and pre-school students from their homes to school and back.

At this time, the bus he uses to transport children needs maintenance. That is why he wants a loan to buy the parts he needs, and to pay the mechanic who will do the work.

Manuel Antonio wants his vehicle to be in better condition, in order to provide better service to the children, and a greater sense of security to parents. In this way, he will prevent an accident due to a technical problem. For Manuel, it is very important to have his vehicle in good condition because it is his main source of income.  

He also works in a "maquiladora" (factory that manufactures goods for export) in order to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To maintain his school bus.

loans.name: Maate

texts.en: Maate is a 45-year-old married man with two children. He lives in his own house in Fort Portal Uganda. Maate deals in selling dry foods, a business he has operated for 20 years. With the income earned, he has been able to build a residential house. His major problem has been price fluctuations and his dream is setting up a food store. Maate needs a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Manuel Ernesto

texts.es: Manuel Ernesto tiene 25 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Tiene más de 8 años en este negocio. Inicio como una fuente de ingreso necesaria para su familia, Manuel es un hombre que a diario con su familia pasan por muchas necesidades él con este medio de ingreso quiere mejorar las condiciones básicas de su hogar. El solicita el crédito con el fin de comprar granos básicos, detergentes, refrescos, pan, galletas, golosinas, entre otra variedad de productos.
texts.en: Manuel Ernesto is 25 years old and he has a grocery store. He has been doing this for more than 8 years. He set up the business so as to have a source of income for his family. Manuel and his family go through a lot every day. With the store as a means of income, he wants to improve the basic conditions of his home. He is asking for the loan for the purpose of buying dry grains, detergents, beverages, bread, biscuits, sweets, and a variety of other products.

loans.use: to buy dry grains, beverages, biscuits, sweets and a variety of other products.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.

Evelyn makes and peddles snacks like rice cakes, cheese cakes, & banana cue (deep-fried banana covered with caramelized brown sugar). She has had this business for five years. She requests a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.

Evelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.

loans.name: Muhamad

texts.ru: Мухамад примерный семьянин имеет троих детей. Он занимается услугами такси на своей автомашине марки Газель. Его жена портниха. Они вместе стараются создать все условия для воспитания своих детей. Мухамад более пять лет занимается данным видом бизнеса. Он хочет получить займ в размере 7000 Cомони для достройки своего дома. Ведь всегда приятно, когда дома созданы все условия. Он надеется на одобрение займа.
texts.en: Muhamad is an exemplary family man, who has three children.  He is involved in providing taxi services using his Gazel minivan.  His wife is a seamstress.  Together, they try to provide all of the necessary conditions for raising their children well.  Muhamad has been in this business for over five years.  He wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 7000 Somoni to build his house.  After all, it is always pleasant when living conditions are well set up at home.  He hopes to have this loan approved.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for building a house

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. She also helps care for her brother and sister. For the last seven years, Ruth has earned a living by going door-to-door to sell second-hand clothes. She is applying for a loan for 400,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more clothing to sell to her customers. Her main challenges are transportation and the seasonal nature of her business. Her goals for the future are to rent a shop where she can sell her clothes and to become a wholesaler. She lives in her own house where her family has access to electricity and piped-in water. Her major monthly expenses are feeding her family and paying her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Isabel Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Isabel, de 47 años de edad, originaria de La Concordia municipio de Jinotega, pero vive en el Coyolito comunidad localizada en las afueras de Estelí, tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos de ellos son independientes y solo se hace cargo de su hija menor de 15 años de edad que esta estudiando la secundaria. Además de ser ama de casa, se dedica a la siembra y comercialización de hortalizas, lleva 10 años con esta actividad pero su experiencia en la siembra la  adquirió cuando tenían 20 años de edad sembrando cebolla. Actualmente vende su cultivo en la ciudad de Managua. Solicita el préstamo para  sembrar 1 manzana de repollo y una manzana de cebolla, compra de insumos, abonos, fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra. Con el crédito le ayudara a sacar una producción de buena calidad. Ya que una de sus metas es vender el producto cancelar el crédito e invertir en comprar 2 vacas paridas para vender leche y preparar a su hija para que logre terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Isabel, 47, is a native of the town of La Concordia in Jinotega, but she lives in El Coyolito, located on the outskirts of Estelí.  She has three children, two of whom are independent, so she is only in charge of her youngest daughter, age 15, who is studying in high school.

In addition to being a housewife, she works growing and selling vegetables.  She has been doing this job for 10 years, but she acquired her experience in planting when she was 20 years old growing onions.  Currently she sells her crop in the city of Managua.

She is requesting the loan to plant one "manzana" [7000 square meters] of cabbage and one of onion, to buy supplies and fertilizer, and to pay for labor.  The loan will help her get a good-quality crop, since one of her goals is to sell the product, pay back the loan, and invest in buying two calved cows to sell milk and prepare her daughter to finish her studies.

loans.use: to plant cabbage and onion, to buy supplies and fertilizer, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Bega Kwa Bega B Group

texts.en:
David is the facilitator of the Bega kwa Bega B group. David and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to David and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

David takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to secure food for his family and to have additional maize profits to send his children to school. In the recent 2011 season, David had a good maize yield, harvesting 9 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, David was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on ½ an acre of land.

With income from maize sales, David will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing as savings for future use.

In 2012, the members of Bega kwa Bega B group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows David with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Libia Graciela

texts.es:
La Señora Libia es socia del banco comunal Fuerza Trabajadora, vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se caracteriza por sus hermosos paisajes, sus cuatro ríos quienes bañan a la ciudad, su gente es muy amable y cordial, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.

Doña Libia tiene 55 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos quienes son todos casados, dos de sus hijos viven independientes y solo uno vive en su casa con quien comparte los gastos de su hogar. Su esposo labora como empleado público, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 

La Señora. Libia labora en un local donde se dedica a la venta de CD de música y películas, actividad en la que se encuentra hace 8 años, también vende cosméticos de varias marcas hace 4 años y en fechas especiales se dedica a la venta de adornos.

Se encuentra reingresando en el banco comunal. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de CD de música, películas, cosméticos y adornos navideños para sus negocios. 

Su meta es crecer  mucho más en sus negocios.
texts.en:
Libia is a member of the 'Fuerza Trabajadora' community bank.  She lives in Cuenca city center.  This city is well known for its beautiful landscapes, its four rivers which bathe the city, and its kind and friendly people who maintain the culture and traditions of their parents.

Libia is 55 years old, married, and has three children who are all married.  Two of her children live independently and one still lives at home and shares in the household expenses.  Libia's husband works as a public employee.  They do not own their own home but live in a rental house.

Libia sells music CDs and movies.  She has been in this business for eight years.  She also sells various brands of cosmetics and has been in that business for four years.  On special occasions, she also sells ornaments.

Libia is re-joining her community bank.  She will invest her loan in buying music CDs, movies, cosmetics and ornaments for her businesses.

Libia's goal is to grow a lot more in her businesses.

loans.use: to buy music CDs, movies, cosmetics and Christmas ornaments

loans.name: Juu Kwa Juu Group

texts.en:
Edwin, who is in his early 30s, is married with one little child. He has had a bar business for three months now.  He works from 6:00 am to 12:00 pm (mid-night) daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he wants to use for buying more stock of drinks like beers, soda, whiskey and wine. His dream is to one day be able to become an international business man.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Juu Kwa Juu" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more stock of drinks like beers, soda, whiskey and wine.

loans.name: Beatrace

texts.en:
Beatrace is a thirty-two-year old lady living in Kasese, Uganda. Her personal goals are to educate her children and build a permanent residential house. 

She has been running a retail shop for the last fourteen years and the major hardships are price fluctuations, inflation and seasonal weather. However, she has goals of expanding her business into new areas. The purpose of the loan is to buy maize flour, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, sugar and salt to sell

loans.name: Hang

texts.en: Hang is 38 years old and has three children who are in school. She is a butcher and runs a small shop that sells fresh pork. Her business started two years ago. In 2008, she focused on raising chickens, but this business did not create enough benefit. For this new loan cycle, she wants to have a loan of 9,184,000 VND to buy pigs as fresh products for sale.

loans.use: to buy pigs as fresh products for sale.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a single mother of three children and all of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (mother and niece). She makes envelopes for photographs and drugs. She has been in this business for 15 years. She gets additional income from selling used clothes. She has applied for a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy materials for making envelopes like glue , rolls of paper. She works from her home seven days a week and sells on both a wholesale and retail basis. Her major business challenges include increasing prices of raw materials. She is aspiring to open up a shop in a market where her customers can find her.. She resides in her own house with access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees,utilities, and food.

loans.use: To buy materials for making envelopes like glue , rolls of paper

loans.name: Anar

texts.ru: Анар, 43 года, замужем, есть 4 дочери. Она очень честная, трудолюбивая, доброжелательная. У Анар - среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Собственный бизнес начала в 2005 году и развила его. В хозяйстве Анар есть 2 коровы, 21 овца. На 3,44 Га земли Анар выращивает перец, клевер и фасоль. На сегодняшний день ежемесячный доход Анар составляет 20,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку лошади, нетели и 2 дойных коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Анар планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, также она планирует дать ее дочерям достойное образование.

loans.use: to  buy one horse, one heifer and two dairy cows in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
For Miss Eulalia the most important things are her husband and her children. They live in the city of Pedro Escobedo. Together with her husband she has been able to provide for their children, having struggled to provide them with all that they need. Miss Eulalia started her business 6 years ago when her husband had an accident and was left temporarily incapacitated. Having the need to somehow support her little children she decided to take action. With a small amount of money she had saved from the family expenses she started a business renting movies, a business that until today she still manages eventhough her husband\'s problem is no longer.

Responsibility, personal strength, and integrity are the characteristics that clearly define Miss Eulalia. Today she requires a loan of $925 that she will put towards the upkeep of her movie catalogue. She needs your support and your generosity. Supporting her is in your hands.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Para Doña Eulalia lo más importante lo constituyen su esposo y sus hijos, ellos viven en la localidad de Pedro Escobedo, junto con su esposo, ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos y han luchado por darles todo lo necesario. Doña Eulalia inició su negocio hace 6 años cuando su esposo tuvo un accidente y quedo temporalmente incapacitado y teniendo que mantener de alguna forma a sus pequeños hijitos decidió tomar acción y con algún dinero que tenía guardado del gasto familiar emprendió un negocio de renta de películas, mismo que mantiene hasta la fecha aún superado el problema de su esposo.

Responsabilidad, fortaleza, entereza son características que definen claramente a la Doña Eulalia, quien requiere en este momento de crédito de $925 DLLS que utilizará para mantener actualizado su catálogo de películas. Ella necesita de tu apoyo y generosidad, apoyarla esta en tus manos.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Tapdig

texts.en: Tapdig was born in 1960 in Salyan region, Yenikand village. He is married and has 3 children. 10 years ago he started his own business. He breeds cows, sheep, and calves. Having borrowed a loan of $500 he bought a pregnant cow. Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy 10 sheep.

loans.use: To buy 10 sheep

loans.name: Matilde Santos

texts.en:
LOCATION: Marcone - Boane, Maputo, Mozambique
ENTREPRENEUR: Matilde Santos N.
BUSINESS ACTIVITY: Retail
LOAN AMOUNT: US$1,200.00
LOAN USE: To increase stock in her shop
START: 06/10/2007
END: 05/31/2008

Matilde Santos Ngovo, 49, native of Magude, Maputo Province, married civilly, was raised by her parents. Her family’s living conditions were decent, but they resided in the countryside where there was no school, so it was not possible for her to study. At age 17, she attended school in the village of Manhiça where she learned to read and write, and worked in the family garden plot and sold produce to help support her family.

In 1979, her husband started work at the Marcone radio station and was transferred to Boane where he built up a business and developed a commercial establishment.

In 2006, her neighbors told her about HLUVUKU ADSEMA, which she approached in order to request a loan.

Currently, her business is going well and provides jobs for 2 employees. With her business income she built a house and opened a bank account.

With a loan of US$1,200, she intends to increase her inventory.

Her business has a big impact in the community because in addition to employing 2 people (herself included), it brings merchandise conveniently close to the customer, in particular, the residents of Marcone.

Translated from Portuguese by Daniel Foster, Kiva Volunteer.



LOCALIZAÇÃO : Marcone - Boane CLIENTE : Matilde Santos N. SECTOR DE ACTIVIDADE : Comercio VALOR DE EMPRESTIMO: 30.000,00MT (1,200.00US$) APLICAÇÃO DO MONTANTE :Compra e venda de produtos Inicio: 10/06/2007 Fim: 31/05/2008

Matilde Santos Ngovo, de 49 anos de idade, natural de Magude, Provincia de Maputo casada maritalmente, cresceu sob a responsabilidade dos seus Pais. As condições da familia eram favoraveis mas por estar a resedir fora da cidade onde não havia Escola nao foi possivel estudar. Aos 17 anos de idade foi ao lar na Vila da Manhiça onde veio a fazer a alfabetização e apendeu a ler e escrever e tambem fazia trabalhos na machamba e vendia alguns produtos da mesma para ajudar no sustento da familia.

Em 1979 o marido começou a trabalhar na Radio Marcone e foi transferido para Boane onde veio densevolver o seu negocio e construiu um estabelecimento comercial.

Em 2006 por indicação de vizinhos teve conhecimento da existencia da HLUVUKU ADSEMA, tendo aproximado e solicitado um emprestimo.

Actualmente o seu negocio esta num bom ritmo e providencia emprego a 2 pessoas, e, com o rendimento do negocio construiu uma casa e abriu uma conta bancaria.

Com o emprestimo de 30.000,00MT pretende aumentar o volume da mercadoria.

A sua actividade tem um impacto maior na comunidade porque para alem de providenciar emprego a 2 pessoas, incluindo ela proporia, coloca o produto mas perto do cliente, com particular destaque todos residentes de Marcone.

loans.use: To increase stock in her shop

loans.name: Doralina

texts.en:
Doralina is 50 years old and has been a widow for more than 15 years. Since her husband died in a traffic accident, she has lived alone with two sons and a daugher, all of whom work and are financially independent.

She had the difficult mission of raising three children alone, as her oldest son was only 10 years old when her husband died. Today, her youngest daughter is 19 and works and attends school. Her middle son works and attends law school and her oldest son works as a teller at a bank. They all help her out in her business with a voluntary monthly contribution.

Doralina runs a small grocery store where she sells staples such as sugar, flour, milk, pasta and rice. Despite stiff competition, her business thrives and is the most successful in the neighborhood thanks to her good service and her extensive inventory.

Doralina is requesting a loan in the amount of US $200 to purchase additional inventory of soft drinks, dairy products, flour, sugar and canned goods at wholesale prices to take advantage of the growing population in her area and the increased demand for her products.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Doralina tiene 50 años de edad, es viuda ya hace mas de 15 años, su esposo falleció en un accidente de tránsito. Desde entonces vive sola con sus dos hijos varones y una mujer, quienes ya poseen independencia económica pues todos trabajan.

Ella tuvo la difícil misión de criar 3 niños, sola, ya que su marido falleció cuando su hijo mayor contaba con apenas 10 años. Hoy día, su hija menor tiene 19 años estudia y trabaja, el segundo de sus hijos trabaja en un negocio y estudia leyes en la facultad; el mayor trabaja en un Banco de la zona como cajero, todos le ayudan a su madre en el negocio con un aporte mensual que cada hijo le entrega de forma voluntaria.

Doralina tiene una despensa donde vende productos de primera necesidad, como leche, azúcar, harina, fideos, arroz, etc. Actualmente ya con mucha experiencia y clientela formada, y a pesar de que en la zona en donde se encuentra hay varias despensas, su negocio es el que más éxito tiene gracias a su buena atención y variedad.

Doralina solicita un crédito de $ 200, pues desea adquirir en mayor cantidad bebidas como gaseosas y lácteos, además de azúcar, harina, productos enlatados y fideos de esta forma puede aprovechar mejor el crecimiento de la población en la zona y poder satisfacer la necesidad de toda su clientela.

loans.use: To purchase inventory at wholesale - soft drinks, dairy products, flour, sugar, canned goods and pasta

loans.name: Siyavush

texts.ru:
Siyavush was born and lives in the city of Saatli in Azerbaijan. He is 27 years old. He was born in a low-income family. 5 years ago he started his own business. To begin, he rented a two room facility, which he equipped with 5 computers and an Internet connection. He also provided his clients with software and sold parts for computers and cellphones. Naturally, computers become outdated as fast as technological progress marches forward and currently Siyavush is a situation where he has to either update his equipment or lose his clients. The latter would be detrimental to the well being of his family since the income from the business is used to support his parents and five siblings. This is why Siyavush come to the Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro), a Kiva partner, to ask for a loan that will allow him to update the equipment in his Internet club.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volnuteer

Сиявуш родился и живет в г. Саатлы Азербайджанской Республики. Ему 27 лет, он выходец из малообеспеченной семьи. 5 лет тому назад он начал своё дело. Для начала он арендовал двух комнатное помещение в центре города, оборудовал его, купил 5 компьютеров, провел в салон интернет. И в то же время он поставлял своим клиентам программное обеспечение и продавал запчасти для компьютеров и мобильных телефонов. Конечно же скорость морального старения компьютерного оборудования прямо пропорциональна скорости развития техники. И сегодня Сиявуш оказался перед дилеммой обновления оборудования или потери клиентуры. Последнее грозит Сиявушу быть роковым, т.к. его заработок обеспечивает необходимым минимумом его родителей и пятерых братьев и сестер. Поэтому Сиявуш обратился к Норвежскому Микрокредиту-партнеру KIVA- за предоставлением ему займа чтобы получить возможность переоборудовать свой Интернет клуб.

loans.use: For the renovation

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: 'I sell kitchen utensils to people living in my community', says Mrs. E. Joy. She is 35 years and married with 4 children. She lives in Benin City. She learnt her business for 3 years and then opened her own in the year 2003. She is seeking for the loan amount of $475 to buy more kitchen utensils for sale.

loans.use: To buy more kitchen utensils for sale

loans.name: Adjo Odette

texts.fr:
Mrs. Adjo Odette A. was born in Lomé on April 17, 1963 and lives in the district of Adobou-Komé in Lomé. Born with a handicap, she is single but is responsible for the livelihood of two other people. She sells ice water and "Pure Water" and her business is thriving. Because she has no capital of her own to invest in her little business, she is requesting a loan of US$ 300 which will help her to get a refrigerator and sufficient stock of bottled water for her business. She is a devoted businesswoman and manages her accounts well, which should allow her to improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame A. Adjo Odette est née à Lomé le 17 Avril 1963 et réside au quartier Adobou-Komé. Née handicapée, elle est célibataire et a à sa charge 2 personnes. Revendeuse d’eau glacée et de « pure water », un commerce qui lui réussit bien. Par manque de fonds, elle sollicite un prêt de $300. Ce fonds l’aidera à se procurer d'un refrigérateur et achat en quantité suffisante ses articles en vue de faire face aux différents aléas du passé ; Par son dévouement, elle fait preuve d’une bonne gestion de ses activités ce qui lui permettra d’améliorer ses conditions.

loans.use:
purchase of a refrigerator

Achat de refrigérateur

loans.name: Laila Yvonne

texts.es:
In March, 1989, before Laila was married, she began selling well-known brands of cosmetics and clothing to her friends and family because there wasn't enough money to cover expenses at home. She later married and left the business, but once her children began growing, she was faced with paying school expenses that her husband's earnings couldn't cover. In 2002, she turned again to sales but this time selling roast chickens on weekends and cakes and tacos during the week. Little by little, she's built a following in the neighborhood.

Now Laila is asking for a US$550 loan, to be repaid in 5 months, with which she can buy ingredients like meat, bread, tortillas, pastry dough, green vegetables, condiments, seasoning, etc., along with things like dishes, pans, spoons, "comales" (a traditional griddle for making tortillas), etc. With your help, Laila will be able to improve her business and help her husband pay their 2 children's school expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman

Marzo de 1989, cuando Laila aún no estaba casada comenzó a vender cosméticos de reconocidas marcas y ropa entre amistades y familiares, ya que en su casa no contaban con suficiente dinero para poder mantenerla. Después se casó y dejó el negocio, después de que sus hijos comenzaron a crecer y con lo que gana su esposo no les alcanza para pagar todos los gastos que les piden en la escuela de sus hijos. En el 2002 reinició sus ventas pero ahora vendiendo pollos rostizados los fines de semana y tortas y tacos durante la semana. Poco a poco se a ido haciendo conocida en su comunidad.
