Sin embargo Laila está solicitando un crédito de US $550 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses con este dinero Laila podrá comprar material como; carne, pan, tortillas, masa, verduras, desechables, condimentos, aderezos, así como enseres menores tales como platos, sartenes, cuchillos, comales, etc. Con tu ayuda Laila podrá salir adelante y ayudar a su esposo a que sus 2 hijos salgan adelante con los estudios.

loans.use: Buy ingredients for food business.

loans.name: Mnuka C Group

texts.en:
J. A., age 36, is married with four children (ages 16, 14, 8 and 1). He has a tailoring business which he started 13 years ago. He opens from 8am to 6.30pm daily and makes a monthly profit of approximately $393.

In the past, J. took out one loan with Tujijenge Tanzania to expand his business. He now hopes for a new loan to buy more sewing machines for his business. He wil share this loan with his sub group members who have businesses selling fuel, clothes and tailoring.

In the picture, J. is first from the left

loans.use: To buy sewing machines

loans.name: Candido Valerio

texts.es:
Mr. Candido has been a working man from a young age. He is 53 years old, and is happily married to children’s mother. His five children are 30, 23, 20, 17, and 12 years old, and his wife has always dedicated herself to caring for their children and home while he works so that his family has what it needs. He began a small tailoring shop which had much success, due to his high quality workmanship. He has now been in business for ten years, and he always has work. Sometimes, he even gives some of his work to other tailors when he has large orders so that he can complete them on time. While his workers complete orders, Mr. Candido will often go and fine new clients and jobs. He often gets contracts to make uniforms for large companies that pay well. He is requesting a loan in order to buy material in order to fulfill the contracted order he recently received to make uniforms, therefore guaranteeing this new client. He dreams that someday his children will continue his business.

Translated from Spanish by Mindy Burns, Kiva volunteer

Don Candido es un hombre trabajador desde pequeño, de 53 años de edad, es felizmente casado con la madre de sus 5 hijos de 30, 23, 20, 17 y 12 años de edad, su esposa siempre se dedicó al cuido de los hijos y el hogar mientras él trabajaba para que no le faltara nada a su familia. Montó un tallercito de Sastrería que tubo mucho éxito por su calidad y que ahora es una sastrería de mas de 10 años de prestigio que siempre tiene trabajo y que a su vez da trabajo a otros jefes de familia ya que cuando tiene pedidos grandes contrata a otros que conocen de sastrería para lograr a tiempo la entrega de ese pedido, de esta manera mientras sus trabajadores laboran sale a las calles a ofrecer su trabajo consiguiendo contratos de elaboraron de uniformes en Empresas que le pagan bien. Esta solicitando un crédito para comprar telas y cumplir con un contrato de trabajo que acaba de conseguir para uniformes y así garantizar a ese cliente. Algún día sueña que sus hijos continúen con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase material

loans.name: Margarita's Group

texts.es:
Isabel and Margarita belong to the Santo Domingo de Acocro Communal Bank, from the Acocro district, located two hours away from the city of Ayacucho.

Isabel is 27 years old, married and mother of three children. Along with her husband, she manufactures typical breads and sells them at the Acocro main plaza on weekdays and at her district fair on Saturdays. She bakes her breads in a rented oven. She also raises small animals and sells them at the fairs.

Margarita, on the other hand, is 35 years old, lives with her partner and has two children. She is a peddler at Acocro’s main plaza, who sells fruit, chicken and fish. She also buys cereals and potatoes at her district to them sell them at Ayacucho’s markets. Isabel and Margarita need loans of 600 and 1500 soles respectively, which they will invest in buying wheath, sugar, rice, produce, meat and hens.

Isabel and Margarita’s dreams are to have a cart to transport their products, educate their children, increase their businesses capital and own an oven.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Isabel y Margarita pertenecen al Banco Comunal Santo Domingo de Acocro, las socias son del Distrito de Acocro, ubicado a 2 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Isabel es casada, tiene 27 años y 3 hijos. Junto a su esposo, elabora panes típicos de la zona y realiza sus ventas en la plaza principal de Acocro de lunes a viernes, y los días sábados vende en la feria de su distrito. Isabel hornea los panes en un horno alquilado. Además Isabel se dedica a la crianza de animales menores que posteriormente vende en las ferias.

Por otro lado Margarita es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos. Vende frutas, pollo y pescado en la plaza principal de Acocro de manera ambulatoria. Además Margarita compra cereales y papa en su distrito y lo vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Isabel y Margarita necesitan préstamos de 600 y 1500 soles respectivamente, dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo, gallina, azúcar, arroz, verduras, frutas y carnes.

Los sueños de Isabel y Margarita son tener un carro para transportar sus productos, educar a sus hijos, incrementar el capital de su negocio y tener un horno propio.

loans.use: Isabel and Margarita need loans of 600 and 1500 soles respectively, which they will invest in buying wheath, sugar, rice, produce, meat and hens.

loans.name: Khady Isagui

texts.fr:
Khady Isagui D., aged 56, is a widow with one child and three grandsons to take care of, and has been a member of the Médina Plateau Village Bank for three and a half years. She sends away to Mali for a special dyed cloth called “thioub,” which she then sells in Bignona. She wants to boost her capital. The income she makes from her business enables her to contribute towards the support, health and clothing of the children. Khady is requesting a loan which will be repaid after six months in a single installment.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Khady Isagui D., 56, veuve,01 enfants et trois petits fils en charge est membre du banc villageois de Médina Plateau depuis 3 ans et demi. Elle envoi acheter des thioub (tissus teintés) au mali pour les revendre à Bignona. Elle veut renforcer son capital. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent de contribuer à l'entretien, la santé et l'habillement des enfants.Khady sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy dyed cloth

loans.name: Salustiano M

texts.es:
Salustiano Medardo is 34 years of age and lives in his own home with his wife, age 37, and their 3 children ages 12, 10, and 8. Their house is located in the eastern zone of the province in a neighborhood called Alfredo Vaca. Medardo is a full-time bricklayer and part-time motorcycle taxi driver. He has a great deal of experience in both fields. He has medium competition because of the amount of bricklayers and motorcycle taxi drivers that exist in the community, but since there is a demand for both, there is always work available. Merdardo has been planning on purchasing a refrigerator with the loan as well as goods that his wife can sell during her free time. She currently works sweeping streets, but they only had enough money for their second goal. This is Medardo’s third loan request with the institution, and he has demonstrated to be a punctual and responsible member. He currently has another debt with a different institution.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Salustiano Medardo cuenta con 34 años de edad y vive en casa propia junto a su esposa de 37 años y sus tres hijos de 12, 10 y 8 años de edad. La casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona este de la provincia en un barrio denominado Alfredo Vaca. Medardo es albañil y desempeña en este rubro a tiempo completo y en sus momentos libres se dedica al transporte público urbano en su moto taxi. En ambos rubro tiene bastante experiencia. La competencia es de nivel medio, debido a la cantidad de albañiles y mototaxistas que hay en la comunidad, pero debido a la demanda que existe no le falta trabajo. Medardo tenía previsto comprar una heladera con el prestamo y también mercadería de abarrotes para que su esposa pueda vender en sus momentos libres, ya que ella actualmente trabaja barriendo las calles, pero el dinero sólo alcanzó para el segundo objeto. Esta es la tercera frecuencia de Medardo con la institución y en el tiempo que trabajo en la misma demostró puntualidad y responsabilidad. Tiene una deuda vigente en otra institución.

loans.use: Purchase refrigerator and goods

loans.name: Ana Veronica

texts.es:
Mrs. Ana Veronica is 32 years old, has studied through secondary school, and is married with three children, two sons and one daughter. Two of her children are students and the other is still a baby. She lives in the house of her mother which fortunately have basic services (light, water, etc.) on Ejercito Avenue in the Yunguyo province.

For the past 6 years, she has worked making macrame fabrics (wall decor, lamp carriers, flowerpots, paper holders, satchels, decorative mirrors, hats, and backpacks). She makes them using macramé and crochet. Sometimes she teaches knitting classes as well.

She is a member of the “Villa Copacabana” village bank where she initially took out a $125 loan in order to buy macramé and tape, and to acquire some land in Arequipa. With this $1,050 loan which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy material for manufacturing her fabrics.

She is very thankful for the loan she received as it allowed her to purchase land and to be responsible for her activities.

She dreams of building a home on her land and helping her children to study.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ana Verónica tiene 32 años de edad , tiene estudios superiores, es casada y tiene dos hijos varones y una hija mujer, dos de ellos estudian y el otro aun es bebe, vive en la casa de su mamá , cuenta con los servicios básicos y esta ubicada en la Av. Ejercito del distrito, provincia de Yunguyo. Desde hace seis años ella se dedica a elaborar tejidos de macramé (adornos para pared, porta lámparas, porta maceteros, porta papeles, carteras, espejos adornados, gorros, mochilas.) hechas de macramé, cola de rata y crochet. A veces dicta cursos de tejido. Integra el Banco Comunal “Villa Copacabana” donde saco un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 con el cual compró macramé y cinta cola de rata. Con este de S/. 3,000.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, compró material para la elaboración de sus tejidos. Así mismo compró un terreno en Arequipa. Esta muy agradecida con el crédito que se le dio por que pudo adquirir el terreno que tanto anhelaba y aprendió a ser responsable en sus actividades. Sueña hacer construir el terreno que compro en Arequipa, hacer estudiar a sus hijos

loans.use: Purchase of material to make decorative fabrics

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. C. Thi Tran has been participating in the Fund since 1999, like many others in a region where the main source of income is farming. She works as a tailor making gloves. When first joining the Fund, she borrowed money to buy a sewing machine and fabric to make gloves. She does not need to spend time marketing and selling her products because a company has placed orders for her gloves. In the years since she has been participating in the Fund and investing in buying fabric, her family’s finances have improved gradually, but markedly. The money that she is able to save goes to buying essentials for her family and to send her two children to school. In this round of funding she is requesting 9,000,000 VND to continue investing in buying fabric to make gloves. The family’s average income is 4,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị Chiêu tham gia quỹ từ năm 1999, cũng giống như bao thành viên khác tại địa phương nguồn thu nhập chính là làm ruộng, chị sống tại làng nghề may gang tay . Khi tham gia vào Quỹ chị đã vay vốn đầu tư vốn mua máy khâu và vải để may. Các sản phẩm của chị làm ra đều không phải mất thời gian đi bán vì các công ty đã đến đặt hàng. Qua các năm tham gia vay vốn chị đầu tư vào mua vải may gang tay kinh tế gia đình chị đã dần dần nâng lên rõ rệt. Số tiền tích lũy được chị đã đầu tư mua sắm trang thiết bị trong gia đình và đầu tư cho 2 con chị đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000đ tiếp tục đầu tư vào mua vải để may gang tay. Thu nhập bình quân. 4.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: buying fabric to make gloves

loans.name: Hadhra's Bread Group

texts.en:
Hadhra is 28 years old. She is married with 2 children aged 7 and 4 years old. She has been a bread seller since 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 70 from her sales.

Hadhra is now requesting a loan to expand her business by increasing her stock. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Eshe, who has a business dealing with charcoal, firewood and coconut sales.

loans.use: To expand her business by increasing her stock

loans.name: Vidalina

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=37840&_tpos=4&_tpg=1

Vidalina Es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen D. Cocharcas. Vidalina es casada, tiene 53 años y 2 hijos, Vidalina es artesana, realiza tejidos, bordados D. mantas, colchas, tapetes, actividad que realiza en su casa, además cuenta con personas que bordan y paga por piezas acabadas, además tiene 3 tejedores que trabajan en su casa haciendo mantas. Además Vidalina venD. productos naturales que ofrece a amigos familiares.

Vidalina necesita un préstamo D. 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. lanas D. variados colores. Vidalina sueña con tener una bodega en su casa que recientemente termino D. construir y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=37840&_tpos=4&_tpg=1 Vidalina is a member of the “Virgen D. Cocharcas” communal bank. Vidalina is married, 53 years old and has two children. Vidalina is an artisan that makes tapestries and embroiders blankets, bedspreads, and tablecloths. She conducts her business in her house. She also counts on people that embroider and she pays for finished pieces. Additionally, three weavers work in her household making blankets. Vidalina also sells natural products to her friends. Vidalina needs a 1050 soles loan that will be invested in the purchase of various colors of wool. Vidalina dreams of owning a small store in her house, which she just finished building. She also dreams of expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vidalina needs a loan for 1050 soles that will be invested in the purchase of various colors of wool

loans.name: Rosali

texts.es:
Rosalía tiene 43 años de edad, es casada, madre de 3 hijos, estudió el quinto año de secundaria y vive en el Jr. Santa Rosa Nº 456, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chuchito, departamento de Puno.

Es una de las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Pequeña Roma” de Juli. Al inicio, con el préstamo de S/: 300, compró gas para vender en el mercado, como este producto subió de precio y no tenia salida cambio de negocio, es así que continua tejiendo mantas de lana, los cuales vende a S/.150 en Juli y a veces los lleva a Desaguadero.

Con este préstamo de S/. 300, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas. comprará materiales para continuar confeccionando mantas.

Su deseo es salir adelante y seguir con su negocio para poder sobrevivir.
texts.en:
Rosalía is 43 years old, married, the mother of 3 children, studied up to the fifth year of secondary school and lives at Jr. Santa Rosa Nº 456, Juli district, Chuchito province, departament of Puno. She is one of the founding members of the “Pequeña Roma” Communal Bank of Juli. In the beginning, with the loan of S/: 300, she bought gas to sell in the market. As this product went up in price and there was no way out she changed her business and she continues weaving wool blankets, which she sells at S/.150 in Juli and sometimes she brings them to Desaguadero. With this loan of S/. 300, which will be paid back in 4 installments, she will buy materials to continue producing blankets. Her desire is to improve her life and continue with her business to be able to survive.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy materials.

loans.name: Primitivo

texts.es: Primitivo tiene 32 años, es casado, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos. Es agricultor desde hace 20 años, lo cual inicio con el fin de poder mantener su hogar y sobre todo para satisfacer las necesidades de sus hijos. Para Primitivo la agricultura es una actividad que le agrada realizar, dentro de ello, el la producción de paltas es lo que más le gusta, ya que es más fácil cultivar estas plantas, y el producto es muy rentable en temporadas, las cuales son anuales, pero  las ganancias son mayores y beneficiosas para todo agricultor, sobre todo cuando los comerciantes compran las producciones por grandes cantidades y se evitas el gasto de tener que trasladar los productos, ya que los propios comerciantes vienen a cosechar y se los llevan por su propia cuenta. Sin embargo, lo difícil es sembrar las plantas de palta,  como también abonar los terrenos para tener una favorable producción. Es su segundo préstamo con MFP, y hasta la fecha no ha tenido problemas en sus pagos, todos han sido puntuales. Primitivo desea invertir el dinero solicitado en mayores cantidades de plantaciones de naranjales.
texts.en:
Primitivo is 32 years old, is married, and lives with his wife and three children. He has been a farmer for the past 20 years, which he began with the goal of supporting his household and above all to satisfy the needs of his children. For Primitivo, agriculture is an activity that he likes to do. Within it, advocado production is what he likes most as it is easier to cultivate these plants and the product is profitable in season, which is annually. But the earnings are greater and beneficial for every farmer, especially when buyers purchase the production in great quantitites and the expense of transporting the products is avoided as the buyers come to harvest and take them away themselves. However, it is difficult to grow advocado plants as well as fertilize the lands to have a favorable production. It is his second loan with MFP, and to date he has not had problems in his payments as all have been punctual. Primitivo wishes to invest the money requested in greater quantities of orange groves.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Orange Groves

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.en:
Mrs. Teodosia C., age 59, lives in Miputak, in Dipolog City. She is married to Mr. Jaime C., age 62, who is a motor-cab driver. They are blessed with two children.

In 2006, Teodosia became an official member of Paglaum MPC. For her first loan, she borrowed PHP 3,000.00 and  established a small sari-sari (variety) store. Being a loyal member of Paglaum MPC for 3 years, she has borrowed for six loan cycles. She works hard for her family, despite of many challenges. Both the husband and wife have managed their business well.

Now Mrs. Teodosia is taking a loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase basic goods to display in her sari-sari store. She dreams of owning a lot. Paglaum helped to uplift their lives. They are so very thankful for everything that Paglaum has done for them.

loans.use: To purchase goods for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Mrs. Riza P. lives in Purok 4 Barra, Puntod, Lopez Jaena, one of the coastal areas in the Municipality of Lopez Jaena. She is married as young as 22 years old and is blessed with 1 child. Her husband supports his family with their fishing business as they own one fishing boat. 

In April 2008, she officially registered as a member of Paglaum MPC and has availed herself of the various programs and services of the cooperative. Their main source of income is derived from the selling of fresh fish. Being a member in good standing, she always pays attention to her loans. She now wants financial assistance amounting to PHP 10,000 for the purchase of a fishing boat. Through this project, she dreams of obtaining additional income in order to educate their son and uplift their quality of living.

loans.use: To acquire a fishing boat

loans.name: Abduvohid

texts.ru:
Абдувохид Ашуров женат ему  45 лет , у него шестеро детей. С детства ухаживал за скотом , помогал родителям  при продажи на рынке участвовал на торгах с отцом,когда  подрос и научился сам  откармливать скот и продавать  рынке. В свободное время работает пастухом, и на несколько дней уходит в горы на пастбище для откорма скота овец и коз, среди чужих овец  есть и его собственные овцы. Во дворе весной сеют огород , сажают овощи, чтобы не покупать из города, потому что до города более 60 километров и большие затраты на дорогу.
Абдувохид благодарен Микроинвест и КИВА   за поддержку.
texts.en:
Abduvohid A. is married, he is 45 years old and has 6 children. He has been taking care of livestock since his childhood while he helped his parents and during trading at the market he participated in bargaining with his father; he grew up and learned to raise livestock on his own and sell it at the market. In his free time Abduvohid works as a shepherd and goes for several days into the mountains to pasture in order to feed sheep and goats, including his own sheep. In the yard, in the spring, the family plants a garden with vegetables in order to not to have to purchase them from the city as it is more then 60 kilometers to the city and the trip is expensive. Abduvohid is grateful to MicroInvest and to KIVA for their support.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Khalida Parveen Ghulam Rasool Group

texts.en:
Khalida Parveen baji, a resident of Vehari, Pakistan for the past 11 years, is the wife of G. R., who has been selling seasonal fruits for the past eight years, travelling to various areas and attracting customers by announcing his produce in a loud voice.

Khalida baji operates a clothes-sewing business, sewing on a daily basis. The purpose behind her enterprise is very noble. Fully aware of her husband’s struggles, she wants to share his financial burden so that he can perform his duties without tension. She is now applying for a loan to buy seasonal fruits to expand his business.

Khalida is the group leader of four other women from her community: Sumera baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business; Samina baji and G. Fatima baji each desire a loan to buy lentils, cooking oil and spices for their food business; Parveen baji seeks a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans, so if one member does not repay, the others are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits to sell.

loans.name: Rajabmurod

texts.ru: Алиев Раджабмурод проживает в районе Файзабад. Садовод со стажем. имеет большой сад . Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 44 года. кроме того работает в хукумате района. Женат и имеет девятерых детей. Кредит планирует получить для того, чтобы закупить фруктовые деревья. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Rajabmurod A. lives in the Fayzabad area. He is a gardener with experience and has a large orchard. He has been in this business for 44 years, in addition he works in the city government. He is married and has nine children. He plans to take out a loan in order to purchase fruit trees.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit trees

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en: Susanna A. is a 60-year-old mother of four children with one grandchild. She lives in Nyamasaria slum with her husband who is alive, but very sick. She sells small fish, called Omena which she purchases in the town of Sori. She is asking for 20,000 KSH to increase her food stock.

loans.use: increasing her stock of small fish

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria D. resides peacefully in San Roque, Burgos, Isabela and she has been blessed with seven children. Supporting her seven children with their studies and ambitions in life is not an easy task, says Victoria. This is why she patiently works hard and sacrifices a lot in order to provide her children with the necessities. She is glad that some of her children are already finished their college courses. Victoria still strives hard to further provide her other children with a brighter future by continuing to send them to school.

The income from their tricycle transport business is not enough to support her family’s basic needs. Victoria hopes that she will able to increase her capital to improve her business. Recently, Victoria learned about ASKI. Upon learning their objectives in the community, she joined ASKI’s lending program. She is asking to borrow PHP 10,000 ($225 US). She will use the money to expand their current business into a general store business. The loan will also be used to make general repairs for their tricycle transport business to make its performance in good condition, thus acquiring many customers. They will be able to earn more and start their general store business. Eventually they will have an additional source of income.

loans.use: general repair of tricycle for transport business.

loans.name: Sumera M. Ashraf Group

texts.en:
Sumera baji is the wife of M. A.. They have lived in a city named Kasur in Pakistan for the past 15 years. Kasur city is famous for its sweetmeat. Her husband has a clothes-selling business. He buys clothes from cities (Multan and Lahore) and sells them in Kasur to earn income. Sumera baji is a very supportive lady. She sews clothes to share the financial burden with him. She is applying for a loan to buy clothes to expand her husband’s clothes-selling business.

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Parvaiz baji, Lubna baji, Abida baji and Farzana baji each want a loan to buy clothes for their clothes-selling businesses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Lucina

texts.en:
Lucina A. is from the village of Maquilao Tangub City. She is 50 years old and married with seven adult children. To make a living, Lucina raises pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Lucina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP to purchase feed for growing pigs. This will her second loan. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and supplement her family's needs.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feed for growing pigs.

loans.name: Begajeta

texts.en:
Begajeta Ć. is 46 years old and comes from the suburb of a town called Tuzla. She is married and her husband works in the coal mine. Begajeta keeps herself busy in the garden growing vegetables. Besides her garden, she has livestock and she fattens chickens.

Begajeta is one of our old clients and she has repaid four loans successfully. Two of these loans were invested in livestock and two in a poultry business. She is requesting her fifth loan through WWI (Žene za Žene International) in the amount of 1000 KM to purchase chickens and poultry feed.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and poultry feed.

loans.name: Muattar

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
       Муаттар 41 год. Она замужем и мать 5-х детей. Муаттар занимается пошивом женской одежды на заказ. Кроме этого она учит девушек шитью за дополнительную плату. Муаттар берет заказы и шьет разную женскую одежду, в том числе национальные платья, юбки, сорочки, брюки и т.д. Муаттар берет кредит в нашей организации второй раз. Она хочет приобрести импортную машину "Аверлог" для своего дела. Муаттар надеется, что кредит поможет ей расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Muattar is a 41-year-old, married mother of five. Muattar is engaged in sewing women's clothes to order. Besides that, she is teaching young women to sew for additional income. Muattar takes orders and sews various women's clothes, including national dresses, skirts, shirts, trousers and the like. Muattar is taking a loan from our organization for the second time. She wants to acquire an imported "Averlog" sewing machine for her work. Muattar hopes that the loan will help her to expand her business. --- MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Furniture and an Averlog sewing machine

loans.name: Yinka

texts.en: Yinka O. is 36 years old and married with two children. She sells kitchen utensils like plates, spoons, forks, etc. She is requesting a loan of NGN 60,000 to purchase more kitchen utensils.  She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kitchen utensils

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 42-year-old widow with five children, ages 13 to 18 years. Margaret also takes care of two additional family members. All of her children go to school. Margaret owns a small restaurant selling cold drinks and refreshments. She serves an average of 30 customers of all kinds every day. She works six days a week. She has been in this business for the last five years. She incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping.

Margaret owns a two-room house in the semi urban area where she works. She lives there with her eight family members. There is electricity and piped water in her home. The family gets three meals a day. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

Margaret has been with MCDT for five years and is now on her eighth loan working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of secondhand clothes. Margaret wants to see her business expand and to own rooms to rent.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of food

loans.name: Maxima Maria

texts.es: Maxima Marin O. Martínez tiene la edad de 33años. Ella vive junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella dio inicio a esta actividad como una alternativa para obtener lo necesario ya que ella siempre le ha gustado trabajar y es lo que le ha enseñado a sus hijos a trabajar muy fuerte ser muy buenas personas. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de perfumes, cremas, lápiz labial y ropa. Ella sueña con obtener un lugar en el mercado central en donde pueda ofrecer sus productos de una manera mucho más cómoda para sus clientes.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Sylivia's Group

texts.en: N. Sylivia is a married woman with five children. The eldest is 22 and at University. For the last five years, she has had a water and juice packing business and she is able to make 60,000/=  profit weekly. Although her business is doing well, she is adversely affected during the rainy season as then the consumption and sales are very low. She endeavors to sell more with favorable prices. Sylivia is grateful that she is able to pay school fees out of her profits as well as expand her business by buying more raw materials. She is seeking a loan in order to buy more polythene bags for packing her solids.

loans.use: To buy polythelyne bags

loans.name: Eddy

texts.es:
Eddy tiene 32 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 7 años se dedica a la crianza de cuyes en la granja que acondicionó en su misma casa. También tiene otros animales, como toros y vacas, pero éstos son cuidados por su esposo y sus hijos. Eddy está muy pendiente del adecuado crecimiento de sus cuyes, para que cada fin de mes los venda en la feria de su localidad o según los pedidos de sus clientes. Con estas actividades Eddy aporta para el incremento de los ingresos económicos de su hogar para el sustento de la familia. 
Este es su 11avo crédito con MFP y está muy contenta por haber logrado mantenerse durante todos estos años (5) en su banco comunal y su deseo es seguir adelante. El dinero que ahora solicita será destinado a la compra de fertilizantes para la siembra de alfalfa, la cual servirá de alimento para todos sus animales.
texts.en:
Eddy is 32 years old, and lives with her husband and their children in their own home. For 7 years she has worked raising guinea pigs in the farm she has set up in her own house. She also has other animals, like bulls and cows, but these are taken care of by her husband and children. Eddy pays close attention to the growth of her guinea pigs so that she can sell them at the fair at the end of each month, or according to her customers' orders. With these activities Eddy contributes to increase the household income to support the family. This is her 11th loan with MFP and she is very happy to have stayed for all these years (5) in her communal bank. Her wish is to keep going forward. The money she requests now will be earmarked for buying fertilizers for growing alfalfa, which serves as feed for all her animals.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fertilizers.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza C. is from the village of Magsaysay, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Liza is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Liza owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting rice for sale. Liza has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2,500.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2003, Liza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from PMPC. Liza is requesting a new loan of 10500 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 17th loan taken out by Liza from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca O. is married and has four children. She graduated from junior high school, and since 2005 has earned a living selling food and other provisions in the town of Elmina. Her husband is a fisherman. Rebecca uses her income to help pay her family's school fees and utility bills. She plans to use this loan to buy more provisions to sell, and will use the additional income she earns to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy more provisions to sell to her customers

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Mrs. Elsie J. is from the village of Salimpuno, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old. She is married and blessed with 4 adult children.To make a living, Elsie owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector.

In 2008, Elsie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsie has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Elsie is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Elsie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her existing business

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 52 years old. She is widowed and has given birth to three children. All of her children are still in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a fishing dominated community called Axim in the western region of Ghana. 

As a single parent, she works hard to be able to provide for the family. Martha trades in printed textiles. She hawks to sell in her community and also treks to nearby communities to sell on their market days. Martha has been in business for 10 years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy printed fabrics

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa  tiene 46 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres junto a dos hermanos, en el distrito de Cura Mori, ubicado en la región Piura, a tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de cinco años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales en su domicilio. Usualmente cría pollos, patos, pavos, carneros y cuyes los cuales comercializa entre los negociantes que eventualmente visitan la zona. Este negocio le provee los ingresos necesarios para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a la economía de su hogar.

Rosa desea engordar a sus animales para ofrecerlos durante esta temporada de Navidad y Año Nuevo, pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de alimento balanceado para sus animales.

Su más grande anhelo es ayudar a sus padres a mejorar la casa en donde viven y seguir adelante con su negocio, ella es una mujer responsable, trabajadora y muy entregada a su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is 46 years old, is single and lives in her parents’ house with her two siblings in the district of Cura Mori, located in the Plura region, which is three and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo. For more than five years, she has raised and sold animals in her home. Usually, she raises chickens, ducks, turkeys, sheep and guinea pigs, which she sells to the traders who frequently visit her area. This business provides the income necessary to pay for her personal expenses and to help with the household’s finances. Rosa wants to fatten her animals so that she can sell them during the holiday season, but she doesn’t have enough capital to do so. Because of this, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 500 PEN, which she wants to invest in the purchase of nutritious food for her animals. Her greatest desire is to help her parents improve their home and to go forward with her business. She is a responsible and hard-working woman and is very devoted to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nutritious food for her animals

loans.name: Utamadumi Group

texts.en:
Reham S. is 28 years old and lives in Dar es Salaam. Reham owns a telecom shop where he sells telephones and prepaid airtime. He has been in this business for two years and currently earns 196,000 shillings a month (~ $150 USD).

This will be Reham’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the loan, he hopes to increase the inventory of his telecom shop and improve his business. 

Reham will share this loan with his loan group which includes 18 other men and women from his community. They work mainly in food sales and retail sales. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan. 

In the picture, Reham is seated on the far left wearing a white t-shirt and white pants.

loans.use: To buy inventory for his telecom shop, such as phones and prepaid airtime vouchers

loans.name: Gloriose

texts.en:
Gloriose is 26 years old and is married with three children with ages 1, 3 and 6. She and her family live Gakenke, in the Northern Province of Rwanda. There, Gloriose owns a shop selling a variety of goods such as toothpaste, soap, and many other cosmetics products.

Apart from selling cosmetics products, Gloriose also sells some drinks. The hours of her business are from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day and this is her seventh successful year in this business.

Gloriose is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of adding some cosmetics goods and drinks to her business. With this additional merchandise, she hopes to earn more profits which in turn will allow her to save for the future of her family as well as keep her business stable.

loans.use: To buy a variety of goods including cosmetics and drinks

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn A. is from the village of San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 28 years old, is married, and has one infant child. Madelyn owns and operates a business providing trysikad (pedicab) services in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Madelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to provide service. Madelyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair her transport vehicle in order to provide better service. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in her business

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
La señora Candelaria, inicia sus ventas de comida desde las 10:30, sus ricos platillos son elaborados en su casa de habitación para luego ser trasladados a su puesto de venta en el mercado central.

Este crédito que solicito es  para la compra de arroz, frijoles, aceite, pollo, carne, pescados.

Algo relevante de la señora Candelaria es que su negocio lo inicio en su casa con la ayuda de su mamá, y hoy en día ha incrementado su clientela por los ricos platillos de comida que solo ella sabes hacer.
texts.en:
Candelaria starts her food sales at 10:30. She makes her delicious meals at home and then transports them to her sales stall in the central market. The loan will be used to buy rice, beans, cooking oil, chicken, meat and fish. Something relevant about Candelaria is that she started her business with her mother's help and to date her customer base has grown thanks to the delicious meals only she knows how to make.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains like: rice, beans, cooking oil, chicken, meat and fish.

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La Señora María Auxiliadora U. M. , es trabajadora de la Alcaldía desempaña el cargo de operaria de limpieza, Habita en la Reparto la Florida, es soltera y con 4 hijos todos viven con ella , de los cuales dos ya trabajan y cuenta con el  apoyo económico de ellos.

La Señora María Auxiliadora U. , solicito crédito  para reparar su vivienda ya que necesita brindarles a sus hijos un hogar digno y seguro a sus hijos, a pesar que es madre soltera ha sido emprendedora y sacado adelante a sus hijos, lleva ya 5 créditos con ceprodel y ha sido bien responsable.
texts.en:
Maria works as a cleaning woman for the city hall. She lives in Reparto la Florida, and is the single mother of four children, all of whom live with her. Two of them work and she relies on their economic support as well. She requested this loan so that she could repair her house, so that she would be able to give her children a safe and dignified home. Even though she is a single mother, she has been very entrepreneurial. She has had 5 previous loans through CEPRODEL and has been very responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials and labor

loans.name: Evariste

texts.en:
Evariste is 46 years old. He is married with five children aged between 3 and 18 years old. Evariste's wife is a farmer. Both of them work for the development of their family. Evariste is a serious man in his business and works hard to gain more interest from his business. Normally Evariste sells different kinds of products such as plastic shoes, soaps, other cosmetic products and so forth. This is his second successful year in business. His small shop is open from 6 in the morning to 8 in the evening every day.

Evariste is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by purchasing more products. This loan will be important for him because he will be able to attract more customers by satisfying their demands. With this loan, Evariste believes he will obtain more profit, which he will reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La señora Marina vive en casa propia con su hijo menor. Quedó viuda hace casi un año vive en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La paz; es jubilada y percibe una renta con la cual mantiene a su familia.

El crédito que solicita es para poner en orden los documentos legales de su casa.

Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2008 y tiene un historial de pagos muy bueno, por lo que puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Marina lives in her own house with her minor child. She was widowed almost a year ago. She lives in the Alto San Pedro area of the city of La Paz. She is retired. She gets a pension, which she uses to support her family. The loan she is requesting is to be able to put the legal documents for her house in order. She has been a client of Impro since 2008. She has a very good payment history, and she is therefore able to access a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Put the legal documents for her house in order

loans.name: Feiloaiga

texts.en:
Feiloaiga P. is 65 and married with 1 child.  She owns a business venture, selling puletasi (Samoan formal wear).  Feiloaiga  has many years of experience in this business.  Feiloaiga  needs a loan of WST $1200 to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Feiloaiga  joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Feiloaiga 's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Sakamo Ole

texts.en:
Sakamo Ole N. is 36 years old. He is married to Talash Ntayia, and he is the father of three children.

Sakamo is a farmer. He farms his own piece of land. He has been doing this for the last seven years.

Sakamo learned about KADET from a friend who is already a KADET registered client. This will be Sakamo's first loan. He is planning to spend 30,000 KES to prepare his farm for wheat planting and 20,000 KES to buy sheep to fatten and sell. With the profit he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to lease additional land for farming in order to increase his wheat production. He also hopes to buy more sheep to fatten and sell.

Sakamo's dream is to become a large-scale farmer both in wheat farming and sheep rearing. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to prepare his farm for wheat planting and to buy sheep

loans.name: Tuch

texts.en:
Mr. S. is highly skilled at making ferrous cask, which is how he earns a living. He receives a lot of flattery from his clients, who recognize what a good quality product he makes. 

S. was married, but divorced his wife when his child was young. He now takes care of a teenage child who attends the public local school. 

Recently, S. has been getting many orders from his customers, but he is now concerned that he doesn’t have any raw materials to make casks for the need of his client. Therefore, S. would like to ask a loan to use as capital to order to buy the required article.      
.

loans.use: To buy materials to make sets of cask

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es: Sabina tiene 57 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Hace mas de 9 años se dedica en la elaboración de panes y pasteles en su misma casa, donde ha implementado su taller de panadería, siendo su familia quien participa activamente en este negocio, en donde participan repartiendo los panes en las diversas bodegas y pastelerías  de su ciudad. Este trabajo le es rentable para su familia, porque las ganancias que obtienen la ayudan a cubrir las diversas necesidades que tienen, además le han ayudad a concretar en mejorar su  taller, implementando maquinas para que puedan elaborar pan. Es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, es por ello que será muy responsable con sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará los insumos, como: harina, manteca y levadura para la elaboración de más panes y pasteles.
texts.en:
Sabina, age 57, lives with her husband and their four children in her own house. She has been making breads and cakes in her own house for nine years. She has set up a bakery workshop, and her family actively participates in this business. They deliver the breads to various grocery stores and bakeries in her city. This work is profitable for her family. The income that they get helps cover the diverse necessities that they have. Also, it has helped her to improve her shop by installing machines so that they can make bread. This is her first loan with MFP. Therefore, she will be very responsible with her payments. She will use the requested loan to buy supplies like flour, shortening, and leavening to make more breads and cakes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies and ingredients to make more breads and cakes

loans.name: Las Flores Al Progreso Group

texts.es:
La señora Juana es la presidenta del grupo “Las flores al progreso” ella integra el grupo hace 5 meses, esta ubicada en el distrito de Los Olivos, departamento de Lima. 
Ella es una madre soltera que hace 28 años cuenta con un negocio de costura confecciona y arregla ropa  para damas, empezó su negocio para apoyar a su familia cuando llegó a Lima, ella  es originaria del departamento de Amazonas actualmente  tiene 59 años y tres hijos mayores de edad. La socia, La quisiera invertir el crédito en comprar materiales para la costura como telas, hilos y otros materiales necesarios gracias al crecimiento de su negocio financió los estudios de sus 3 hijos, de los cuales 2 son ahora profesores y una se dedica al negocio de la ferretería, Asimismo, espera que pueda mejorar su casa gracias a sus ingresos, por ejemplo financiando un techo. Anhela en largo plazo construir su casa.


* La Sra. Juana es la de gorrita azul el la segunda de la derecha (paradas).
texts.en:
Juana is the president of the Las Flores al Progreso (The Flowers for Progress) group. She joined the group five months ago. The group is located in the Los Olivos district in the Lima department. She is a single mother. For 28 years she has had a business making and repairing women’s clothes. She started her business to support her family when she arrived in Lima. She is from the Amazonas department. She is 59 years old, and she has three grown children. The member would like to invest the loan in the purchase of sewing materials like fabric, thread, and other needed materials. Thanks to the growth of her business, she paid for her three children’s education. Two of her children are now teachers, and one has a hardware business. Also, she hopes to be able to improve her house thanks to her income. For example, she will pay for a roof. In the long term she yearns to build her house. *Juana is in the blue hat second (standing) from the left.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric, thread, and materials for making clothes

loans.name: Javohir

texts.en:
F. Javohir is 56 years old. She is married and the mother of three adorable children. Javohir has a grocery store which she attends to herself, in addition to caring for her family and her home.

She began her small business 3 years ago with financial support from her husband, who is mechanic. The reason for starting the business was to increase her family’s income. The business has been gradually growing ever since.

In order to grow her business further, she requests a loan of $1,000 USD. Javohir is planning to spend the loan on more goods to sell, thus increasing the range of the goods she sells. She thanks everybody who decided to support her.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase goods to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita P. is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 56 years old. Teresita is married. To make a living, Teresita provides and manages a repair service for the trucks and other automobiles of local community members. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Teresita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in renovating the business. This will be the third loan taken out by Teresita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in renovating the business

loans.name: Eben Ezer Group

texts.es: Doña Olimpia  es divorciada, es una persona analfabeta, tiene 3 hijos los cuales dos  están casados y la otra  siguen a su cargo, ella se dedica a la crianza de animales domésticos  (Ganado Vacuno, Bovino, y pollos ponedoras), tambien a la Artesanía elaboración de Ponchos y blusas, tiene 10 años ya con este negocio. Contando con entusiasmo y la ayuda de algunas vecinas organizan un grupo, para poder solicitar un préstamo. El Grupo Solidario  se denomina Eben Ezer, El grupo cuenta con cinco  integrantes mujeres, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar, la crianza de animales, y crianza de animales domesticas,   El préstamo lo utilizarán para compra de materia prima y así incrementar el volumen de ventas, y generar mejores ganancias en cada una de las actividades que realizan.
texts.en:
Doña Olimpia is divorced and she is illiterate. She has 3 children, two are married and she is still responsible for a daughter. For a living she breeds domestic animals (cattle, sheep, and egg-laying chickens) and she also makes crafts such as ponchos and blouses. She has done this for 10 years. With her enthusiasm and the support from some neighbors, they have organized a group in order to request a loan. The solidary group is named Eben Ezer. The group has five female partners who carry out different activities such as breeding livestock as well as domestic animals. The loan will be spent on buying raw material and thus increase sales and generate higher profits for each of them.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita  U. is a married woman who lives in Orchids St., Brgy. Gairan, Bogo City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a business selling fish. Her husband Jose Stephen U. Jr., who is 40 years old, works as a clerk to earn his living. They have three children who are 2 to 15 years old. Amelita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2010 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Amelita  has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 4,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 800, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her second cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000, which she intends to use as additional capital for her fish selling business so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs. Amelita U. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional capital for fish selling business

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Blanca se dedica a la preparación y venta de tortillas, tiene 36 años de edad y reside en el Departamento de San Miguel donde vive con sus hijos de 10 y 6 años de edad; Ella tiene este negocio desde hace mucho tiempo en su casa de habitación y sus clientes son personas de la zona, ella los atiende desde las nueve de la mañana hasta las dos de la tarde.
Blanca solicita un préstamo para la compra de materia prima (maíz, leña, gas) y así contar con materiales suficientes en inventario para atender la demanda de los clientes, además que comprara por grandes cantidades lo que permitirá que obtenga mejores precios.
El sueño de ella es atender una pupuseria, y dar a sus hijos la educación necesaria para que estos puedan superarse y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Blanca prepares and sells tortillas. She is 36 years old and resides in the Department of San Miguel with her children, ages 10 and 6. Blanca has operated her business out of her home for a long time and her customers are people from the area. Her business is open from 9am until 2pm.

Blanca is requesting a loan to buy supplies (corn, firewood, and gas) so that she will have enough inventory to meet the demands of her customers. She plans to buy in large quantities so that she can obtain better prices.

Her dream is to open a pupusa shop, provide her children with the education they need to succeed, and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: Purchase corn, firewood, and gas

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina C. is from the village of Santo Domingo, Echague, Isabela. She is 34 years old. Rosalina is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a canteen inside the school campus. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $113 a month for these activities. She said that she works hard because she wants to offer a prosperous life to her family, especially to her children.

In 2009, Rosalina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Rosalina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 4th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Vanky

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanky V. (in the photo with her loom), 30, and her husband, Sokha Toek, 37, have been married since 1998. They have three children -- one son and two daughters. The family lives on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Vanky V. is a silk weaver. Her husband is a construction worker.  She is requesting her first loan of US$1,200 to purchase weaving materials (raw silk) for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials (raw silk) for her weaving business.

loans.name: Shakirah

texts.en:
Shakirah N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Natete in the Kampala region of Uganda.  She is married and has 3 children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Shakirah has a business of selling cold drinks, which she has had for 5 years.  She does outside catering  

To help expand her business, Shakirah has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more drinks, cooking oil and banking flour.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Shakirah hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Shakirah hopes to build a house for her mother. Shakirah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving on her business.

loans.use: To buy more drinks, cooking oil and baking flour.

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
Mr. Ramil P. is from the Barangay of Baybay, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. He is 27 years old, married to Vanissa P., and currently has no children. To make a living, he is presently engaged in a pig-trading business. He’s been engaged in this kind of business for 2 years. He is earning at least 2,000 PHP a month from pig sales.

Just this year, Ramil joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ramil, as a newly recognized member of PMPC under the Regular Loan Program, is now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP as his first loan, which will be used for additional capital for his existing pig buying and selling business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family, especially in meeting their basic needs, savings for future use, loan repayments and possible business expansions.


 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for his pig buying and selling business

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.en:
O. Marhabo is 30 years old. She is married with three children. Since she has lived with her husband, she has worked in the business of buying and selling cattle. She walks through the farms and several settlements to buy cattle at the lowest price to be able to increase her profits. She currently has two cows. 

Now Marhabo wants to expand her business and, as her children are grown up, she thinks that she will be able to look after more cattle with their help. So she is asking for 5,500 TJS in order to purchase cattle. Marhabo expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her and promises to repay the loan on time. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase small cattle to expand the business and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.name: Rugando Farmers And Tradesr Group B

texts.en: A. Grace is the leader of Rugando Farmers and Traders Association, Group B. She is 34 years old and married with 4 children, all above 6 years. Grace has a bar and grocery store where she sells beer, drinks, and edibles from Nyamirambi.  She sells mostly to the local people and travelers.  She makes 220,000 in monthly profit, in addition to her income from farming. Grace needs a loan to be able to buy more beer, especially for the festive season.

loans.use: To buy more beers for resale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 31-year-old married woman living with her husband and two young children, who are still attending school. She is from Lebanon. She helps her husband, a tailor, with the family’s income. She started a lingerie and accessories shop in 2008, after nine years of experience in this field. 

Today, she is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to increase her inventory so she can offer her clients new and different styles. She is confident that her work will continue to be successful in the coming year.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Estella

texts.en:
Because God is a God of chances, we ought to give other people chances to make right the mistakes they have done. Estella R., 33, lives to prove that, indeed, people deserve second chances. Estella is married to Jaime and together they raise a relatively young, big family of five children, of which one is adopted. One child is not yet of school age; two are enrolled in day care; and the other two are in elementary school.

Estella's involvement in CCT* as a Community Partner enables her to run a two-year business in direct-selling. She sells products from the clothing brand MSE Apparel to friends, neighbors, and business connections. She has no commercial space yet, and thus works at home. Estella has also begun a food stall at home, where she prepares breakfast for neighbors who are in too much of a hurry to prepare one. With these businesses, she earns around 18,000 PHP monthly.

Making room for failures while achieving the best that she can, Estella is determined to make this food stall work. To help her grow her business, she applied for a 10,000 PHP loan. She will use these funds to buy can't-do-without items like plates, spoons and forks, a kettle, and most importantly, a gas stove. While preparing for this, she also plans to boost her direct selling business by purchasing more MSE products like shirts, shoes, and pants to sell.

Estella admits struggling with the collection of payments from her customers. She mentions some have escaped the collection of payments. Also, she sees that there are times when her products would not sell. Nevertheless, Estella chooses to perceive these as second chances for her and for her customers to do better the next time. She aims to maintain a good savings account in CCT and grow her businesses so she will be able to make improvements on their house. Above all, she hopes that her children, young as they are, will not take chances, but will give it their best shot when it comes to their studies.

	
*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase utensils and facilities for cooking

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es:
José se dedica a trabajar en acarreo así como la venta de leche agria, desde hace varios años, pues es su medio de subsistencia. Logrando comprar una camioneta con ahorros de su trabajo anterior como albañil. 
Como objetivo ha sido la mejora de  su vivienda, ya que aun no ha hecho la remodelación debido que el crédito anterior era para comenzar la mejora lo que se descompuso su camioneta y como es su medio de trabajo desvió el dinero para repararla. Pero tiene materiales comprados, lo que podrá con este crédito comenzar a construir  su casa. Comprara materiales como: piedra, arena, cemento y comenzar.
texts.en:
José has worked as a hauler and also selling sour milk for several years; it’s his means of support.  With savings from a prior job as a bricklayer he was able to buy a pick-up truck.

His objective is home improvement since he hasn’t yet done the remodel because his previous loan was to repair is broken pick-up truck because since it’s his work tool he had to divert the money to repair it.  But, he now has the materials and supplies purchases and will use this loan to start building his house.  He will buy such things as: stone, sand, cement and get started.

loans.use: For building materials and supplies for home improvement in concrete for better family security.

loans.name: Mma

texts.en:
Mma H. has been cooking food for sale for about six years now. The type of foods she prepares are banku, rice and so on. She works at Nyame Bekyere in Cape Coast. She is requesting a loan to invest in her food preparation business. Her business plan in the next three years is to build a food joint. In the picture Mma is dishing up one of the sauces she serves with the rice.
Mma is divorced and has three children. She is responsible for their education, clothing, feeding and other expenses.

loans.use: To invest in her food business

loans.name: Adjo  Afidekemefao

texts.fr: Madame Adjo a 3 enfants  et est  âgée  de  29 ans.  Elle  est  née  dans  la  préfecture  de Yoto  et  habite quartier  Hedzranawoé.    Pour améliorer  les  conditions  de  vie  de  ses  enfants,  elle  vend  au  marché  de Hedzranawoé  les  oignons.  Elle  cumule  7 ans  d’expérience et  s’approvisionne  au   grand  marché  de  Lomé  en  gros  et  redistribue   en  détail.   Elle  demande  un  prêt  pour acheter  5 sacs  d’oignons.
texts.en:
Madame Adjo has 3 children and is 29 years old. She was born in the Yoto prefecture and lives in the Hedzranawoé neighborhood.

In order to improve her children's standard of living, she sells onions at the Hedzranawoé market. She has 7 years of experience, and obtains her supplies from wholesalers at the grand market of Lomé. She then re-sells the onions. 

Madame Adjo is asking for a loan to buy 5 sacks of onions.

loans.use: To buy onions

loans.name: Maneno

texts.en:
Maneno is married to a housewife. They have one child who is still too young for school. They live in a house that they own which has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Maneno has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) business for the past two years. In addition, he sells coconuts as his other source of business which adds additional income. He faces the challenge of transporting clients during the rainy season. 

Maneno decided to join Yehu because of affordable sustainable financial services. With the loan he is requesting he wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en:
Saidova Mavjuda lives in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. She is married and has two children. She is a hardworking woman, who sells fabrics for sewing women’s national dresses in the market of Korvon in Dushanbe city. Mavjuda has been in this business for 32 years. She imports her goods from China. Her daily amount of income on average is 500 Somoni. But during summer her daily income increases up to 2000 Somoni per a day.
