Mavjuda would like to get a loan of $1100 US for purchasing of new goods, which attracts her customers. She thanks all lenders who allow her to increase her living standards.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy new fabrics

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es:
Daniela forma parte del banco comunal “Los Jardines del bosque” perteneciente a la ciudad de Temuco. 
Ella se dedica al rubro de la venta de joyas, desde hace 3 años. Daniela compra joyas de plata al por mayor, lo que le es más conveniente. Ella vende durante todo el año, especialmente para el día de la madre y navidad. Sin embargo las temporadas más bajas de demandas, son durante las vacaciones de verano correspondiente a los meses de enero y febrero. Daniela vende joyas puerta a puerta, aunque igual tiene sus clientes frecuentes, quienes son amigas y conocidas.
Con éste préstamo comprará joyas.
Su sueño es tener un local establecido, en el cual pueda ofrecer y vender sus joyas. Por ende sus motivaciones de continuar en el negocio, ya que además quiere brindarle a su familia una vida más confortable. 
Daniela vive junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 6 años y 4 meses de edad.
Daniela está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito obtenido por Fondo Esperanza, ya que con éste podrá invertir mucho más en su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias. Además comenta de las facilidades de pago que éste tiene con las socias, lo que resulta muy conveniente para emprendedoras como ella. Respecto a las reuniones a las cuales participa Daniela, se siente muy a gusto, ya que le ha permitido conocer a los demás integrantes del banco comunal y le ha servido para distraerse de sus labores domesticas. 
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
Daniela is part of the communal bank "Los Jardines del Bosque" (the gardens of the forest), in the city of Temuco. She has been selling jewelry for three years. She buys silver jewelry wholesale, which is more convenient for her. She sells jewelry all year, especially for Mother's Day and Christmas. Nevertheless, the seasons with the lowest demand are during the summer vacations, in the months of January and February. Daniela sells jewelry door to door, although she also has her regular customers. who are friends and acquaintances. She will use this loan to buy jewelry.

Her dream is to set up a store, where she could offer and sell her jewelry. Therefore she is motivated to continue with her business, since she also wants to offer her family a more comfortable life. Daniela lives with her husband and their two children, ages 6 years and 4 months.

Daniela is very happy and thankful for the loan obtained through Fondo Esperanza, since she will be able to use it to invest more in her business and obtain better earnings. She also comments on the easy payment terms that it has for the members, which are very convenient for entrepreneurs like herself. As for the group meetings in which she participates, she feels very comfortable, since they have allowed her to meet the other members of the communal bank and also served to distract her from her domestic labors.

Temuco is the capital of the Araucania region. The city is located 670 kilometers south of Santiago, the capital of Chile. In this area are located a series of lake resorts (Pucón, Villarrica) and very showy native flora and fauna, concentrated in nearby natural parks. It is worth mentioning that about 50% of the Mapuche, the native people of our country, live in this region.

loans.use: to buy jewelry.

loans.name: Sabukhi

texts.ru: Sabukhi H. 31 qoda. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey kotoriye yesho ne xodat v shkolu. Sabukhi jivet v qorode Baku vmeste so svoimi lubimimi detmi i jenoy. On uje 5 let kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom prodaji tetradi knishki i druqiye shkolniye potrebnosti dlya detey. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo druqa kotoriy i pomoq yemu otkrit etoot magazin. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye tetradi knishki i druqiye shkolniye potrebnosti dlya detey.
texts.en: Sabukhi H. is 31 years old. He is married and has two preschool children. Sabukhi lives in Baku with his beloved children and wife.  He has been selling school supplies such as books and notebooks for five years.  He started this business with his friend who helped him open the shop.  Now he needs 2000 AZN to buy notebooks, books and other school supplies.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, books and other school supplies.

loans.name: Euclyne

texts.en:
Euclyne is a married woman with four children, 3 girls and a boy.  All the children attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, electricity bills and rent. 

For the past five years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other clothes sellers in the area. Her dreams in the business is to expand and operate as a wholesaler. 

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase a bale of mitumba(used clothes) for resale. She decided to join Yehu to gain access to loans that will help boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of mitumba(used clothes) for resale.

loans.name: Run

texts.en: Mrs. Run is 40 years old and a resident of Kompong Cham province, where she earns a living by planting a few crops on her own land. On average, she earns a profit of around $1.50 a day to support her family’s needs. Mrs. Run is married with six children; five of them have already started new families and the last one is married. Her husband, Mr. Soun, also works on the farm. Mrs. Run has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner, HKL, in order to rent some of the neighbor’s land to enlarge her crop plantation and to buy insecticides, fertilizers, and potato seeds for planting. Mrs. Run and her husband appear in the photo.

loans.use: to rent some of the neighbor’s land to enlarge her crop plantation and to buy insecticides, fertilizers, and potato seeds for planting.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La señora Martha es empleada y vende verduras en el mercado Achumani. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de diferentes verduras ya que ella quiere iniciar su propio negocio y tener su propio puesto de verduras. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Koani de la ciudad de La Paz, es casada y tiene dos hijos. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito en Impro. Su deseo de independizarse y formar su propio negocio complace notablemente a Impro y estamos seguros que así será para los financiadotes de Kiva.
texts.en: Sra. Martha works for a vegetable vendor in the Achumani market.  She is applying for a loan because she wants to start her own vegetable sales business and she will use the money to buy vegetables to stock the business.  She lives in a house she owns in the Koani neighborhood of La Paz.  She is married and has two children.  This is her first Impro loan.  Her goal is to establish her own business with help from Impro and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to start her own vegetable sales business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 42-year-old married woman with 2 children, aged 21 and 19.  Evelyn and her husband are farmers in Sta. Josefa Agusan Del Sur.  Evelyn has been growing rice for 16 years. Apart from farming, she also ventured into the hog-raising business.

This loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizer and piglets. Evelyn hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: purchase seeds, fertilizer and piglets.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 30 years old and married with five children. She comes from Kakamega, Kenya. She runs a tailoring services business. She has done this business for 10 years. She says the business is profitable and the major challenge she has is financial constraints.

She is borrowing a loan of KES 80,000 to buy materials to grow her business and serve more customers.  Her plans are to grow her business and start a tailoring school to empower the local people. She also hopes to give her children a good education to the university level. She describes herself as hardworking, patient and ambitious.

loans.use: to purchase more materials (fabric)

loans.name: Iris

texts.en:
Iris is 30 years old and lives with her partner. She is currently a student at the National University of San Antonio Abad Cusco, where she studies accounting. In addition, she is a docent at a local Inca museum in the city of Cusco. 

Iris works very hard in school and she is passionate about pursuing a career in accounting. She is asking for a 400 dollar loan in order to help pay for university. She is committed to making all of the necessary payments on time.

loans.use: to help pay for her university.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 53 years old and married to Jane. They have four school-going children. He has been in the carpentry business for 11 years, making a monthly profit of KES 15,000. He has been loaned KES 70,000, which he plans to use to purchase more timber to sell.

With the anticipated profit made, he plans to educate his children to higher levels and to expand his business.

He hope to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more timber to sell

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es: Lucía es socia del Banco Comunal Musuq Rumi, tiene 3 hijos, es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 4 años, tiene un tienda de abarrotes, y en ella invertirá el préstamo que sacara ahora ya que si no estuviera en Finca no tendría como mejorar su tienda y ni poder surtir como esta ahora, agradece a Finca ya que le enseñaron a poder ahorrar, y las capacitaciones le ayudaron a poder valorarse como mujer, aprendió a ser mas responsable, y desea que su negocio pueda crecer y Finca podrá ayudar en este propósito.
texts.en: Lucía is a member of the “Musuq Rumi” communal bank.  She has three children and has been a member of FINCA Perú for four years.  She has a grocery store and will invest the loan that she’ll take out now in it because if FINCA did not exist she’d have no way to improve her store or be able to stock it as well as she has.  She thanks FINCA because they taught her how to save and the training helped her value herself as a woman.  She learned how to be more responsible and she hopes that her business will grow and FINCA will be able to help her with this purpose.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Shabana's Group

texts.en:
Shabana is 36 years old and has six children. Her son works while her daughters are getting their education. Her brother also lives with her and operates a washing machine spare parts business.  

Shabana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her brother’s business. With the loan, her brother will buy spare parts in larger quantity to sell to his customers and earn better profit.  

Shabana is hopeful that after the loan investment, her brother’s business will grow further and he will be able to make more profits.

loans.use: To buy washing machine spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, a 40-year-old married mother of six, works hard to provide for her family. For the past five years she has been buying and selling charcoal, and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Having previously received and repaid 11 loans from NWTF, Grace is now requesting a loan of PHP 20000 to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is a married lady in Kenya. She has four children who she hopes to be able to provide a university-level education. She owns a business making jewelry at Dandora in Nairobi. She has been doing this business for the last nine years. She says that the business is profitable and her biggest challenge is financial constraints. She is using her loan of 20,000 KES to buy beads for making bracelets and necklaces in order to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. In the future, she plans to grow her business into wholesale. She describes herself as a very honest lady.

loans.use: To buy beads

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: Graciela tiene 42 años, es una mujer muy amable y sobre todo muy trabajadora, ella convive con su pareja pero es madre de una niña de seis años, por quien trabaja dia a dia para brindarle lo mejor. Juntos habitan en su casa propia. El trabajo de Graciela consiste en el corte y confección de prendas de vestir, en éste trabajo crea sus propios diseños, asimismo ofrece el remandado de algunas prendas. Tiene siete años realizando esta actividad, siendo un pequeño espacio de su casa, un taller montado de manera rustica, en donde sola confecciona prendas que le solicitan sus clientes. Ella al igual que su esposo se encargan de los gastos del hogar, por ello es que le gusta lo que hace, pues estando dentro de su hogar no se descuida de su hija. Actualmente tiene clientes que los ha sabido ganarse gracias al trabajo que realiza. Este será su onceabo crédito con MFP, por lo que espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes. Con el monto solicitado, comprará tela, hilos y otros materiales para que pueda seguir con su labor y poder brindar lo mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en: Graciela is 42 years old. She is a friendly, hardworking woman. She lives with her partner and is the mother of a six-year-old girl. She works every day to provide her daughter with the best. They live together in their own home. Graciela earns a living cutting and sewing garments. She creates her own designs and sells them to multiple customers. She's been making clothing for seven years in a small room in her house that she set up as an improvised workshop. She works by herself making the clothing her customers have requested. She and her husband are both responsible for the household expenses. She enjoys what she does, because working from home allows her to take care of her daughter, too. She has a number of regular customers because of the work that she does. This will be her eleventh credit with MFP, and she hopes for the support of each one of you. She will use the loan to buy cloth, thread, and other materials so she can continue her work and offer her customers the best.

loans.use: to buy cloth, thread, and other sewing supplies.

loans.name: Shushan

texts.en: Shushan is engaged in agricultural business. Shushan lives together with her husband and it's hard for them to cultivate the land themselves. Thus she has to hire workers to do the job. With the help of this loan Shushan plans to pay the hired workers, as well as to purchase fertilizier and fuel. Successful cultivation of the land will allow Shushan to get good harvest and develop agriculture. This also means improved living conditions for Shushan's family.

loans.use: to pay the hired workers and to purchase fertilizier and fuel.

loans.name: Mwangaluka Group

texts.en:
Aleleki, who is in her early 30s is married with four children. Three of them go to school, the fourth one is still a baby.  Alekeki has been running a  fruit and vegetable business for 6 months.  She works from 8 a.m to 10 p.m daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which she wants to use to increase her stock of fruits and vegetables.  Her dream is to one day be able to have a retail/wholesale shop.

Aleleki will share this loan with her loan Group "Mwangaluka" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase her stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Djrodekon 1 Group

texts.fr: DJRODEKON 1 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Assiba Micheline (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 58 ans et est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Bienvenu. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Assiba Micheline vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Assiba Micheline a très peu fréquenté l'école. Assiba Micheline vend du maïs , du charbon de bois ; et d'akassa (aliment local fait à base d'amidon de maïs) accompagné de poissons frits de façon secondaire. Assiba Micheline achète ses produits au Bénin. C’est la troisième fois que  Assiba Micheline et les autres membres du groupe DJRODEKON 1  sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
Djrodekon 1 Group is made up of three people, all living in the same neighborhood. The group is represented by Assiba Micheline, who is pictured raising her hand. She is 58 years old and married to Bienvenu, a mechanic. They have three children, all in their care and attending school. Assiba Micheline lives with her husband and their children. The parents share the various household expenses. Assiba Micheline has had very little formal education.

Assiba Micheline sells corn, charcoal and akassa (a local food made from corn starch), and as an additional activity she sells fried fish. She gets her supplies in Benin. This is the third time that Assiba Micheline and the other members of Djrodekon 1 Group came to the microfinance institution Alidé and applied for financial assistance in order to increase their working capital and raise their activity level, and thus better meet their clients' demand.

loans.use: to buy corn, charcoal and fish.

loans.name: Socias Por Siempre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SOCIAS POR SIEMPRE” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Rosa. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: costura de pantalones, tienda de carne, tejido de lana a macramé, venta de comida, ventad e chuño y papa, tienda de abarrotes.

La señora Rosa,  indica que es la primera ves que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tiende a barrio que viene trabajando hace años atrás, aprendiendo el mismo de su suegra.
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de viveres) que adquirirá de la Ceja y posteriormente lo venderá en su puesto comercial. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es soltera.
texts.en:
The “SOCIAS POR SIEMPRE” Communal Bank is starting out on their first loan with Pro Mujer, as part of the field partner's local centre in the Andes. The group is made up of six members and directed by a board led by Señora Rosa. The businesses run by the members of the group include: making trousers, a butcher's shop, weaving string into macramé handicrafts, selling food, selling potatoes and dried potatoes, and selling groceries.

Señora Rosa says this is her first time working with Pro Mujer and that she joined the organisation after being invited by a promoter. She presently has a shop in her neighbourhood, where she has been working for several years, having learned her business from her mother-in-law. The loan she will recieve is to increase her capital, to buy groceries, which she will get from the La Ceja market, and which she will then sell in her store. This type of work enables her to generate income to support her family, as she is not married.

loans.use: To buy groceries

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy six blankets, footwear, and kids' wear

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 45 and married with three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees.

For the past four years, Monica has operated a retail shop, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge with the seasonality of her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and tea leaves. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and tea leaves.

loans.name: Maryuri Mariuxi

texts.es:
Maryuri  tiene 22 años es soltera, vive con un hijo de 3 años. Vive en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios en el Cantón Ventanas.

Ventanilla VALLE ALTO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

Maryuri  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz en terrenos de familiares. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado de Ventanas.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir en la siembra. Su sueño es comprar un terreno para seguir sembrando.

Le gusta  pasar con el hijo jugando.
texts.en:
Maryuri is 22 years old, single, and lives with her 3 year old son. She lives in Voluntad de Dios in the canton of Ventanas.

The Valle Alto Communal Bank is located in Voluntad de Dios, belonging to the canton of Ventanas. This area is dedicated to agriculture activities of short-cycle planting of corn, rice, and pigeon peas.

Maryuri works in agriculture planting crops of corn and rice on family property. She buys her supplies in Ventanas, and she sells her crops at the market in Ventanas.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy seed, fertilizer and compost for the crops. The loan will help her increase her income for family use and to buy seed. Her dream is to buy land to continue planting. 

She likes to spend time playing with her son.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer, and compost for the crops

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 38 years old, married to John, and they are blessed with five children. She has been selling cereals for the past ten years with a monthly income of Kes 30,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Irene will use the loan to buy a stock of dry maize, beans and wheat for her business. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to build a store for her stocks of cereal.

loans.use: To buy a stock of dry maize, beans and wheat for her business.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine is married and has four children. Augustine is a peddler; she sells ladies wear, shoes, children’s wear,  underwear and soap in Asebu Ekroful, which she has done for five years. 

Augustine uses her income to support her husband with the general upkeep of their family. Augustine will use the loan to purchase ladies wear, children’s wear and underwear for sale. With the new profits from her business, Augustine plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ladies wear, children’s wear and underwear for sale.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
Rolando es un hombre de 34 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Huaraz con sus padres, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Rolando no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado ser un gran Abogado, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un  riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Rolando trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de extintores y artículos de seguridad, él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos productos y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Rolando se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea construir la parte trasera de su vivienda, así podrá brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar para sus padres, quienes son muy mayores y necesitan de sus cuidados, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Rolando is a 34-year-old, single man who lives in the city of Huaraz with his parents. He is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to excel. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and the need to work since he was very young, Rolando could not study for a professional degree, but he would have liked to have been a great lawyer. 

In his free time he likes to listen to music and, on some occasions, cook a delicious "Arroz con Pollo" (Chicken with rice) to share with his family.

Rolando works in his small business selling fire extinguishers and security items, on his own initiative, and with much effort and dedication. He works every day for approximately 12 hours and he believes it is going well for him due to the good products and friendly treatment he offers to his clients. 

Rolando is very thankful to the Kiva lenders since, thanks to the help they offer, he will be able to make improvements to his home, since he wishes to build the back of his house and thus offer better security and well-being to his parents, who are older and need his care. In this way, he will continue working and striving to achieve his great dream of having his own home.

loans.use: to make improvements to his home

loans.name: Djromahuton Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DJROMAHUTON est formé de quatre personnes qui résident dans la même localité et appartiennent à une même Église. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Rène, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Âgée de 37 ans, Rène est mariée à un certain Grégoire et a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Parmi les enfants, deux sont à la charge du couple. Rène et son mari assurent ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Pour y arriver, Rène  mène comme activité depuis huit ans, la vente de produits vivriers et des condiments dans son quartier. Rène s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Rène désire obtenir un troisième financement, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DJROMAHUTON. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des produits vivriers et des condiments.

loans.name: Daniel's Group

texts.en:
In Kenga village in Ndhiwa sub County, Kenya, Daniel has volunteered to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser. Daniel is a friendly member of the community with 5 children. Daniel lives with his family in a house made of mud walls, dirt floor, and an iron roof.

Kenga village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from Kadaniel well. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. Chlorine dispensers offer a solution to this problem by allowing people to treat their water to make it safe to drink. Daniel’s family, and the 14 other households using the local water source, need a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. 

Daniel has volunteered to act as the promoter to encourage the community to use the dispenser and to refill it with chlorine when the tank runs low. Daniel volunteered to be the promoter because he wants to help the community access safe water. There are also three other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Wilikista, Chrisencia and Maureen.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce world carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Daniel’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To ensure that the community has access to safe drinking water via chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Mahadeb Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Komala, pictured first from the right, is 24 years old. She hails from a remote village of Koraput district,Odisha, India. Her husband passed away two years ago in an accident. She is engaged in potato cultivation and works really very hard in order to earn her livelihood. She lives with her parents and her 3 years old son.  Her family is classified as a poor family and can not afford to have a sanitary latrine. 

Therefore,Komala along with her group member has requested for a loan amount of 36,000 INR. Komala will use her portion of the loan amount in order to build a sanitary toilet and a hand-washing device with soap. This will help to improve her family's hygiene and health and contribute to the sanitary improvement of her community thereby preventing them from harmful contagious diseases.

loans.use: to build a sanitary toilet and a hand-washing device with soap

loans.name: Phina

texts.en: Phina is married with three children and all go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She has a business selling dry fish and has been in this business for two years. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy fish. She works in her shop seven days a week on  retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, food, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is 36 years old. She is married and they are blessed with 2 children. 

Her business is beauty. She has been in the business for 6 years. She earns a monthly income of forty thousand Kenya shillings. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. 

She will use the loan to buy weaves, hair loans, Hair chemicals and braids for her salon. She will use the profits from expanded business educate her children and expand her business further.  

Her hopes and dreams are to be successful in life.

loans.use: to buy weaves, hair loans, Hair chemicals and braids for her salon.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.en:
Rosa Maria, day after day and filled with optimism, starts her work with confidence and faith in her job. She sells roasted chicken at a stand downtown in the city of Pedro Escobedo, Queretaro. She started her business in the year 2000 when she was let go of her job and she found herself without an income to support her children, seeing as she is a single mother. Despite the fact that she has had to struggle alone for the sake of her family and although she has had to go through some complicated times, the love for her children is what has kept her going.

She now needs a loan in the amount of $475 that she will use for the purchase of wholesale chicken, and in this way she will increase her income. Rosa Maria needs your generosity. The decision is in your hands. She and her children will sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa María día con día y llena de optimismo inicia sus labores con la confianza y fé en su trabajo, ella se dedica a la venta de pollo rostisados, en un local en el centro de Pedro Escobedo, Querétaro. Ella inició esta actividad en el año 2000 cuando fue despedida de su empleo y se quedó sin ingresos para mantener a sus hijos, pues es madre soltera. A pesar de que ha tenido que luchar sola por su familia y ha tenido que pasar por momentos muy complicados, el amor a sus hijos es lo que la mantenido de pie.

Ahora ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad e $ 475 DLLs mismos que utilizará en la compra de pollos por mayoreo y con esto incrementará sus ingresos. Rosa María necesita de tu generosidad, la decisión esta en tus manos, ella y sus hijos te lo vana agradecer sinceramente

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Djeyhun

texts.en: Djeyhun is 19 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan,  Kalbadjar region. He settled in Khirdalan settlement and is single. Having borrowed a loan of $500 he bought clothes for men and children. Now he needs a loan of $1000 to start selling clothes for men, women, children. He has been in this business for 2 years.

loans.use: To start selling clothes for men, women, children

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret J. is a 55-year-old entrepreneur who lives with her husband and six children in Rongo, Kenya. She trained as a community health worker to provide home-based care to people living with HIV/AIDS in her area.

Margaret (pictured with the children) is a proprietor of Westland Academy, initially started in 1998 as a nursery school with 40 children. Since then, the school has grown to 156 children. The school takes children from nursery level to primary level (now in class 6). Out of the 156 children, 63 are orphans, some of whom Margaret has taken into her home.

Owing to increased enrollment in her school, Margaret requires US $ 1200 to renovate classrooms that are in poor shape.

loans.use: Renovate classrooms

loans.name: Eva Esmeralda

texts.es:
Eva Esmeralda is a married mother of two children, one in elementary school and an infant. Her husband works in an office, and to help him with household expenses Eva opened a convenience store a year ago in Sabinas, Nuevo León, where they're from. She started selling only drinks and snacks at first, but now has been able to better stock her store and is making it grow thanks to the good service she provides.

To meet her customers' demands and increase the variety of products, Eva is requesting a loan of $925, which she plans to repay within six months. You can be a fundamental part of the growth of this business and help move Eva and her family forward. They are grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Eva Esmeralda está casada y tiene dos hijos uno estudia la primaria y el más pequeño tiene poco tiempo de nacido. Su esposo trabaja como empleado en una oficina y para poder ayudarlo con los gastos del hogar Eva emprendió su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes hace un año en la localidad de Sabinas, Nuevo León de donde son originarios. Comenzó vendiendo sólo refrescos y botanas pero ahora ha podido surtir bien su negocio y ha estado creciendo gracias al buen servicio que ofrece.

Para poder cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes e incrementar la variedad de los productos que ofrece Eva está solicitando un préstamo de $ 925 dólares, mismos que se compromete a regresar en 6 meses. Se parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio y ayuda a Eva y a su familia a salir adelante, muchas gracias.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Rosalbina

texts.es:
With the help of her children and her beloved and yet old mother, in her own humble house, Rosalbina has installed a service to handle telephone calls for all the residents of her comunity with the purpose of keeping them close to their beloved ones despite the distance. This clever service came up after watching the needs of communication of the members of the comunity.The demand and the enormous distance they had to cover in order to access this tool for communication were enough reasons to set up a telephone inside her little house providing a friendly and efficient service. Today, Rosalbina wants to expand the customers attention space to provide a better and renewed service to her regular customers. With the purpose of reaching her goals, she asks for a 350 dollars loan to begin cristallizing her desires. Let’s keep this comunity communicated with the important support we can bring to Rosalbina. p>Translated from Spanish by Augusto Salazar, Kiva volunteer.

Rosalbina, con ayuda de sus hijos y su adorada madre que ya es muy anciana, dentro de su humilde morada, ha instalado el servicio de recepción de llamadas telefónicas para todos los residentes de su comunidad con el objetivo de mantenerlos cerca de sus seres queridos a pesar de la distancia.El ingenioso servicio de recepción surgió a causa de observar la necesidad de comunicación de muchos miembros de su localidad; la demanda y la enorme distancia que tenían que recorrer para hacer uso de esta herramienta comunicativa se convirtieron en motivos suficientes para instalar un teléfono en las instalaciones de su pequeña casa con el fin de prestar sus servicios de manera amigable y eficiente. Hoy Rosalbina quiere ampliar su espacio de atención con el objetivo de brindarles un mejor y renovado servicio a cada uno de sus asiduos clientes.Con el propósito de alcanzar sus metas solicita la suma de 350 dólares para iniciar la cristalización de sus anhelos.Hagamos que esta comunidad siga manteniéndose comunicada con el importante apoyo que le podemos generar a Rosalbina.

loans.use: Seting up the reception area to improve the service.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth owns a retail shop and is married with four children ages 3 years, 9 years, 13 years, and 15 years. Her husband is a jobless man. Ruth is a very creative woman and she struggles for the betterment of her family and society as well. She is asking for a loan of USD 550 to buy a refrigerator for cooling soft drinks to sell at her shop. She is proposing to repay loan in 12 months and thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipments from the said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: TO BUYING  REFRIGERATOR

loans.name: Faalogoifo

texts.en: The family plantation has always been one of the main sources of income for Faalogoifo and her family. She continues to be part of the SPBD program because she needs the financial backup to sustain her plantation. She depends on her plantation to finance her children’s schooling, and this is why she continues to seek assistance from SPBD.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Namungoona 1G (C) Group

texts.en:
Esther is married with three children. Estehr, Martha and Rose all sell new clothes to earn a living. With the extra business profits, Esther intends to build a house for the family. Norah and Florence both have beauty salons and want to use the loan to buy more salon equipment.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: These women would like to improve their sewing and beauty salon businesses.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.fr:
Rosalie A., age 35, is married and the mother of four. She has been in this business for nearly seven years. Thanks to her good management, she has considerably increased her bottom line in the course of 2007. She has also hired a girl, who helps her in her tasks. With the help of this loan, Ms. Rosaline Amablé would like to increase the size of her business by buying 20 bowls and some dinner plates.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame Rosalie A. est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Agée de 35 ans elle exerce ce commerce depuis bientôt 07 ans. Grâce à sa bonne gestion elle a considérablement augmenté son chiffre d’affaires au cours de l’année 2007. Elle a aussi engagé une jeune fille qui l’aide dans ses tâches. A l’aide de crédit, madame Rosaline Amablé désire augmenter la taille de son commerce en achetant 20 bassines et des plats à manger.

loans.use: To buy 20 bowls and 5 cartons of dinner plates

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
In spite of the hardships she has gone through Hermelinda is trying to get ahead, aided by her her family's devotion and commitment. For many years this selfless mother earned a living making beautiful and distinctive garments. Everything was going well with her family life as well as with her work when a few months ago she suffered an unfortunate robbery. All of her tools where taken (sawing machines) as well as all of her merchandise. Since then she has been trying to cover the household expenses and schooling of her five children with her husband's income, which he obtains working as a motorcycle taxi driver. Unfortunately, it was not enough so Hermelinda decided to earn extra money offering telephony services for a fee to the people of Juliaca.

Her hope if to be able to go back to creating her beautiful garments but in order to do that she must to recover her sawing machines. It is with this hope that she comes to you requesting a loan. Hermelinda and her family anxiously await your response.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Pese a los difíciles momentos que le tocó vivir doña Hermelinda está tratando de salir adelante con el compromiso y entrega de toda su familia.Ésta abnegada madre durante muchos años estaba dedicada a la confección de hermosas y distintivas prendas de vestir, todo marchaba bien en su vida familiar y laboral, desafortunadamente hace pocos meses sufrió un robo de sus herramientas de trabajo (máquinas de coser) y toda su mercadería, desde entonces sólo ha cubierto sus gastos familiares y la educación de sus 5 hijos con los ingresos que obtiene su esposo con su noble labor de moto taxista, pese a los esfuerzos esto no era suficiente y es así que doña Hermelinda decidió trabajar brindando el servicio de llamadas telefónicas a la población Juliaqueña.

El deseo de Hermelinda es volver a poner su creatividad y paciencia a cada una de sus confecciones, para ello requiere recuperar sus herramientas de trabajo, con ese fin recurre a tu buen corazón para solicitarte un préstamo.“Hermelinda y su familia esperan ansiosos por tu respuesta”

loans.use: Purchase of sawing machines

loans.name: Hib

texts.en: Mrs. Hib L. makes about $4.50 per day selling clothes at the market. L. has been selling for eleven years. Her husband, Mr. Tan Than, is a 55-year-old who makes $3.30 per day sewing clothes. L. and Than live with one child in Chykreng District, Siem Reap Province. L. and Than are requesting a loan of $ 1,100 to purchase more clothes to sell. By using this loan L. can improve her business and increase her famiL.’s income.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa is the mother ot 2 school-age childes. She lives with relatives and her husband is an employee at a lodging in the city. The income he receives is minimum wage and is not enough to support the family. For this reason, two years ago Elsa decide to open her own business so she could help her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

LA señora Elsa es madre de dos niños en edad escolar vive en casa de sus familiares, el esposo es empleado en un alojamiento de la ciudad donde el ingreso que persive es el equivalente a un salario minimo nacional que no abastece para el sustento de la familia es por este motivo que ella hace dos años atrás decidió abrir su megocio para ayudar a su esposo.

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar and canned goods for her business.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza is very cheerful and industrious. Since her beloved sons were born, she has worked with dedication alongside her husband, Elmer. They sell natural products on market days in the small towns surrounding her home city, Juliaca. She and her family currently live in a rented room. This young couple hopes to be able to give a safe roof of their own to their children. They are both aware that in order to do this they will need to work even harder and your help would an important contribution toward crystallizing this family’s dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Maritza, es una dama muy alegre y hacendosa, desde que les concedió el don de vida a sus dos amados hijos trabajó denodadamente junto a su esposo Elmer, con quien se dedica a la venta de productos naturales los días de feria en los distintos pueblitos aledaños a su ciudad natal, Juliaca.Ella y su familia actualmente viven en una habitación alquilada, el deseo de estos jóvenes padres es brindarles un techo propio y seguro a sus amados hijos, ambos son conscientes que para ello tienen que esforzarse mucho más y vuestra ayuda podría significar un aporte importante para cristalizar los sueños de esta familia.

loans.use: To increase her capital so that she can buy a larger stock of items for her business.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza- Grupo 4 Group

texts.en:
Teodora A. is a kind and gentle older lady who has used her loans from Esperanza Internacional for a little over one year now to sustain and grow her business. She owns a shop specializing in the sale of food and drink items, such as bread and various kinds of juice, and therefore uses her loans for the operation of the store, primarily purchasing goods to sell. Ms. A. is the mother of four children, three of whom are still her dependents. When not doing work for her store, she enjoys watching television and has a particular love for various juices. In the future she hopes to see her business grow and progress to better the lives of herself and her family.

In the picture provided, Ms. A. is with her loan group, but she is just one of 20 members of a micro-bank called Nueva Esperanza, or New Hope in English. Her story is just one among many of this group of men and women who are improving their quality of life through the help of the micro-credit loans of Esperanza. This group has come together with a common vision of a better life, with faith and hope in their hearts and an unbreakable spirit. The concept of group lending is to have loans paid back in a group to reduce the risk of any one person defaulting, as others pick up where a person may lag so as to receive the next loan. Each of the associates in this bank has a similar business whether it be selling bread and various kinds of juice or cutting hair. Thank you for your support and awareness of this issue. It is your concern and efforts that are able to bring a difference to the lives of these wonderful people.

loans.use: purchasing items such as clothing to sell or materials to operate a restaurant, etc.

loans.name: Ou

texts.en:
Ou C., age 57, owns a plot of land growing rice and makes around $1.50 of profit a day. Her husband is a construction foreman who builds houses. Normally he earns around $2 of profit each day. This couple has three children, one of them is a student and the two others are garment workers.

Mrs. Ou C. would like to request a loan from Kiva via Credit, a local partner, to purchase more construction tools such as an electrical saw and a cement mixer. (Her husband is pictured becaused Mrs. Ou C. was not available.)

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase more construction tools such as an electrical saw and a cement mixer for her husband's business.

loans.name: Ngano

texts.en:
Ngano is 49 and a widow with 5 children between 28 and 18 years old. She has been a clothes and food seller since 2000. Every day, she works from 6am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Ngano now requests a loan to buy more food items and clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items and clothes for her business.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes es socia del Banco Comunal Lila. Lourdes es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Lourdes tiene un locutorio en un local alquilado que se ubica al frente de un mercado de la zona, además vende celulares, recargas virtuales para celulares y brinda servicios de fotocopiado, actividad que realiza durante todo el día, su local esta ubicado cerca de un colegio y tiene proyectado implementar su negocio con útiles de escritorio.

Lourdes necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de útiles de escritorio. Lourdes sueña con culminar sus estudios universitarios, tener una librería, casa propia, comodidades primordiales para su familia y sus hijas sean profesionales con buenos valores.
texts.en:
Lourdes is a member of the Lila Community Bank. Lourdes is married, is 28 years old, and has 2 children. She has a call center in a rented location in front of a market in the area. In addition, she sells cell phones, recharges for cell phones, and offers photocopying services. She does this all day. Her premises are located near a high school and she has planned to supple her business with desk equipment.

Lourdes needs a loan of 1000 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of desk equipment. Lourdes dreams of finishing her university education, having a bookshop, her own home, fundamental comforts for her family and that her daughters will become professions with good values.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Lourdes needs a loan of 1000 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of desk equipment

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.en: Mrs. Tetmarina U. is 44 years old, married, and has six children, one of whom helps her in her business, while the others still attend a local school. Mr. Ke Kannara, her husband, works as a policeman, making a small salary, while Mrs. Tetmarina U. earns income as a tailor. Currently, her business is facing some difficulties, because the sewing machine is very old and does not allow to produce high quality garments. Mrs. Tetmarina U. is therefore asking for a loan to buy a new sewing machine. She is the leader of a group of five businesswomen who all live in the Yok Bath Village in Kandal Province and are willing to take out a joint loan.

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine for a tailoring business

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim U., 50, and her husband, Mr. PhU. Morm, 54, have been married for over twenty years and have two daughters. Both of them are garment factory workers. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number Five about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sim is a full-time employee repairing fishing nets. Her husband has been a fisherman for over twenty years. He catches fish from the Tonle Sap River and sells the fish in the village.

Sim is requesting a loan of US$ 250 to level the foundation of her house.

loans.use: To level the foundation of her house

loans.name: Theng

texts.en:
Mrs. Theng N. was born in 1966 and lives in Prey Chuor Village in Takeo Province. She is 42 years old and the mother of five children.  Two of her children are employed in a garment factory, two attend the local school, and one stays at home. She is photographed with her husband.

Both her and her husband, Mr. Kong Chhaom, make baskets out of bamboo. Since the business is going well, they want to expand it.  Mrs. Theng N. is requesting a loan to buy more bamboo to make baskets.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo to make baskets

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is married with two children. She sells jeans at the city market. Her monthly gross income is 5,000 UAH; the profit is about 2,500 UAH per month.

Valentina started her business 11 years ago. Now she has got two kiosks and many repeat customers. Valentina loves to sell jeans and believes this is what she can do best. The profit from her business has helped this family to fix their old house and put a new heating system in.

Valentina would like to get 7,000 UAH as a loan to increase her inventory. She hopes to increase her sales and help her daughter to purchase home equipment.

loans.use: To Increase her inventory

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha P. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Martha is 30 years old and married. Her husband is a teacher. She has three children, who all go to school. With the extra profits generated from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay her house rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business selling charcoal.

loans.name: Altantuya

texts.en:
Altantuya G. is a married mother of five. She has four daughters and one son. Her eldest two daughters live in the countryside and work as herders. Her son lives and studies in the city of Erdenet. She lives with her husband and two youngest daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

Together with her husband, she started a business in 2000, running a fruit stall at the Narantuul ("black market"), the biggest year-round outdoor market in Mongolia. She sells fruit at all times except winter. During the winter months, she sells frozen fruits, such as cranberries, and many types of jellies. Her husband buys a variety of fruits wholesale.

When she started her retail business, her family lived on someone else's plot of land, renting it for MNT 15,000 ($10). As a result of her retail business profits, she was able to buy a plot of land and her husband has built a little house on it. They are a hard-working, friendly and nice couple. With this loan, Altantuya will buy more fruit.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.es:
La señora Remedios vive en casa propia con su hijo en la calle Valentín Abecia de la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz , la actividad que ella tiene es la venta de productos que contienen vitaminas alimenticias. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y comprar más productos y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos ya que con este negocio, el cual ella conoce muy bien, tiene mucha clientela y las posibilidades de aumentarla son muy buenas. 

No es cliente de Impro pero por su carácter social, experiencia en el negocio y el análisis de su flujo de fondos puede acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Remedios lives in her own home with her son on Valentín Abecia Street in the Alto San Pedro zone of La Paz. Her activities include the sale of food products that contain vitamins. The loan that she requests is to increase her capital and to buy more products. In this way, she will improve her income. Given that she knows the business very well and has a large clientele, the opportunities for growth are very good.

She is not a regular client of Impro, but because of her good social character, business experience, and her own cash flow analysis, she is qualified for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of products that contain vitamins for her clients

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: Justina is 45 years old and she is married with 5 children. She sells foodstuffs like bags of rice, beans, peanut oil, etc. She hopes for the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a resident of Barangay Minanga Norte Iquig, province of Cagayan. She is 48 years old and has eight children. Four of her children are married, one is still single and helps them earn a living while the three youngest are still studying in public school in their village.
Evelyn has a hog-raising business that serves as her source of income. She has a small piggery in her backyard. She wants to develop her piggery to make it bigger and more progressive. She believes that through her piggery business, she will be able to give her children a good education and someday will able to finish college courses.

She also responsibly supports her family by providing their basic necessities for daily living. All her children are very cooperative and responsible. They always assist her in her piggery. Evelyn earns a good profit from her hog-raising business. That’s why she wants to maintain it and make it grow more. She is requesting a loan of PHP10,000.00 to purchase feed and vitamins for her livestock. The loan will be of great help in increasing her income. She also hopes that upon selling her pigs, she will be able to allot some of her income for the repair of their house. She always wanted to have a comfortable living and a better life, which is why she is very patient in working all through her life.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her livestock

loans.name: Farukh

texts.en:
S. Farukh is 36 years old. He is married with three children. Farukh has already run his business for seven years. He sells household appliances and different cosmetics for women. The business generates a significant income for the family allowing him to improve the living conditions. Today Farukh requests $1500 USD. He is going to spend the loan to purchase new goods to sell. Having loans from IMON since 2006, Farukh had shown himself as a reliable client with a positive credit history.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new goods to sell

loans.name: Aminedeke Alwano Beatrice Group

texts.en:
A. Beatrice is a 35 year old married woman with two children who are attending school and she looks after one dependent who is also attending school. She has sold local brew for 10 years so far. She has learned a lot in her business, most especially how to deal with the customers.

She is using the loan to purchase millet and yeast for making local brew for sale. This is really helping her in paying school fees for her children and it has taken away her stress. She is a hardworking and encouraging woman whose dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase millet and yeast for making local brew for sale

loans.name: Ni Putu Warnati

texts.en:
Ni Putu Warnati is 54 and lives in the town of Manistutu - Melaya. She is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, Ni Putu Warnati raises pigs for sale. Ni Putu Warnati has been engaged in this business for more than four years and earns approximately 450,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2007, Ni Putu Warnati joined DINARI, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ni Putu Warnati has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,500,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. Ni Putu Warnati is now requesting a new loan of 3,600,000 IDR, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the third loan taken out by the borrower from DINARI. Ni Putu Warnati plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small-business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Ni Putu Warnati - (DNR.M-0707) merupakan 54 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Manistutu - Melaya.  Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 2 anak usia sekolah.  Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Putu Warnati memiliki & menjalankan usaha.  Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian.  Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak.  Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Ni Putu Warnati sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 4 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Putu Warnati menghasilkan sekitar 450,000 IDR sebulan.


Dalam 2007, Ni Putu Warnati bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Putu Warnati meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI.  Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang.  Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 3,600,000 IDR.  Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli pakan ternak & pasokan lain.  Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 3rd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI.  Ni Putu Warnati berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis  untuk menambah penghasilan keluarga.


Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. .  Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam  Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Adewumi

texts.en:
Adewumi is a hair stylist and also sells hair extensions. She learned her business within two years and she has been in the business for the past five years.

Adewumi is 35 years of age and she has three children. She is requesting the loan of N70,000 to purchase more hair extensions and hair cream to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and hair cream

loans.name: Aegamberdi

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Эрбоев Эгамберди кредитор в организации уже второй год. На следующий кредит он планирует  купить два молодых быка и откормив их продать с прибылью. Эгамберди работает электриком в колхозе, также по выходным работает на вызов. Для получения дополнительного дохода Эгамберди  постоянно занимается куплей скота. На снимке Эгамберди в день выдачи займа.
texts.en:
Aegamberdi A. has been a client of our organization for the second year already. He plans to use his next loan to purchase two young bulls, raise and sell them at a profit. Aegamberdi works as an electrician at a collective farm and also works on-call on weekends. In order to supplement his income, Aegamberdi is constantly involved in livestock sales. The photograph shows Aegamberdi on the disbursement day.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy A. operates a fufu chop bar. Fufu is a local food: she usually makes it with cassava and plantain which she cooks and pounds to get her fufu for sale at Elmina. Dorothy has received junior high school education. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. Dorothy has been operating this bar since 1984. She helps pay for school fees and the upkeep of her home. Her loan will be used to buy more cassava, meat, plantain, and so on to operate her fufu chop bar. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy cassava, meat, plantain and so on for her fufu chop bar

loans.name: Socorro Maria

texts.es: La señora Socorro Mejía C. La señora se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, los cuales comercializa en el mercado. Hace más de 22 años que se dedica a esta actividad principalmente por su mama a ganarse la vida.  Poco a poco ella fue obteniendo la experiencia necesaria, hasta llegar a tener el negocio que ahora posee. El crédito será invertido en la compra de frutas y verduras, entre lo que se destaca las naranjas y las verduras, ya que desea comprar ahorita que los precios han estado un poco bajos. Su sueño a corto plazo es invertir más en el negocio de tal forma que brinde mayores ganancias. A largo plazo la señora desea realizar mejoras en su vivienda que le brinden mayores comodidades a ella y a los que con ella conviven.
texts.en:
Socorro Mejía C. sells fruit and vegetables in the market. She started in this business over 22 years ago, which was run primarily by her mother to earn a living. Little by little, she gained the necessary experience until she came to have the business she now has. The loan will be used to buy fruits and vegetables, especially oranges and vegetables. She wishes to buy them right now because the prices have gone down a bit. Her short term dream is to invest in her business in such a way as to bring greater income. Her long term wish is to make improvements on her house that will make her and those with whom she lives more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sabine Madeleine

texts.fr: H. Q. Sabine Madeleine est née le 22/07/1967 à Allada une ville du Département de l’Atlantique. Sabine Madeleine est mariée à AGOSSOU Léon, hôtelier et employé dans l’un des hôtels de la place. Sabine Madeleine est mère de 3 enfants tous scolarisés. La famille réside depuis 11 ans dans le quartier Yagbé une banlieue de Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Sabine Madeleine vend depuis 17 ans dans sa boutique: des tissus, des chaussures, des sacs et des objets d’art au Centre de Promotion de l’Artisanat de Cotonou. Sabine Madeleine a déjà eu de crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Pour  continuer à développer son activité, Sabine Madeleine demande un nouveau crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement afin de répondre efficacement à la demande de sa clientèle.

loans.use: Achat de cinq pièces de tissus, de six douzaines de sacs et des objets d’art.

loans.name: Rosa Imelda

texts.es: La señora Rosa Imelda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 49 años y es madre de 02 hijos, 01 que todavía depende de ella.Rosa Imelda, es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora, que tuvo que esforzarse bastante en su camino de vida, pero las ganas de salir adelante le dieron muy buenos resultados, hoy en día vende sus productos de catálogos de las diferentes líneas como: Unique, Esika, Avon y se siente muy contenta por lo logrado.Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas,  asimismo otra vitrina para exhibir  sus productos.Rosa Imelda, con su madurez es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Imelda belongs to the community bank "Manos Unidos" in the Tarapoto District, San Martín Province, Department of San Martín. She is single, 49 years old and a mother of two, one of which still depends on her. Rosa Imelda is a hard-working strong woman who had to work extremely hard in her life, but her desire to get ahead resulted well for her. Currently, she sells products from catalogs from different brands like Unique, Esika and Avon. She is very happy with what she's accomplished. With this loan of 3000 soles she will buy beauty products for her stock to sell like perfumes and colognes for women and men, cream, compact powder, lip liner, and nail polish, as well as another glass case to show her products. Due to her experience, Rosa Imelda is an example for other women to follow to start their own businesses and, with perseverance, realize their dreams. She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her and other women like herself to begin their own businesses and grow as businesswomen.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing beauty products to sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita M. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 37 years old. Anita is widowed and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Anita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Anita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Anita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Anita is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Anita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the hog-raising business

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en:
Roberta is fifty-four years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Kade, a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Roberta is a trader and runs a provision store by the roadside in her community. She has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to increase her stock.

Roberta desires to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es:
La socia MARIA JESUS pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA”, ella vive en el distrito de calca de La socia MARIA JESUS pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA”, ella vive en el distrito de calca de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. La ciudad de Calca esta a una hora de la provincia de Cusco. 
  
La socia es la presidenta del banco comunal. La socia tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos, es docente del colegio “Sagrado Jesús de Calca”. 

Ella por las mañanas enseña en el colegio y por las tardes ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la atención del pequeño negocio de abarrotes donde vende víveres como azúcar, arroz, fideo, pan, gaseosas, etc. Ya son varios años con esta actividad y le ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone para en su trabajo.

La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio de venta de comestibles.    
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
María Jesús belongs to the Virgen Asunta Communal Bank. She lives in the Calca district, Urubamba province, Cusco department. The city of Calca is an hour from the Cusco province. She is the president of her communal bank. She is a 49 year old single mother. She has two children. She is a teacher at the Sagrado Jesús de Calca School. She teaches in the mornings, and in the afternoons she alternates between her household chores and working in her small grocery business. She sells food like sugar, rice, noodles, bread, and soft drinks, etc. She has been doing this for several years. It has gone very well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her work. She needs a loan to increase the capital in her business of selling food. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan. She promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more food like noodles, sugar, and rice, etc. to sell to her customers

loans.name: America

texts.es:
Nuestra socia AMERICA es una humilde madre de familia, tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos. Ellos viven en la ciudad imperial del Cusco. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO” de la Asociación Arariwa. 
  
La socia tiene un pequeño negocio  de producción y venta de velas, Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora, emprendedora, responsable que trata casar adelante a sus hijos dándole una buena educación. La socia cuenta que este negocio lo empezó su abuelo de su esposo hace trece años y ahora ella es quien administra el negocio junto con su esposo. La socia requiere el dinero para comprar más materiales para producción de velas como parafina y pabilo. 
    
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
AMERICA, 33, is married and has two children; she lives in the imperial city of Cusco and is a member of the “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO” communal bank of Asociación Arariwa. She has a small candle-making business. She has been in this line of work for several years now and has done well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.
