She is a humble, hard-working, enterprising, responsible mother who strugles to get her childen ahead in life providing them with a good education. She tell us that her husband's grandfather started this business 13 years ago and now she, with her husband, run it. She needs financing to buy supplies like paraffin and wicks. She is grateful for the opportunity granted by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy candle-making supplies like paraffin and wicks.

loans.name: Edgard Antonio

texts.es:
El Señor Edgard Antonio C. Sánchez, Labora como encargado de limpieza (Higienista) en el Mercado Oriental de Managua, el tiene Seis hijos a su cargo, tres de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante Seis años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 11 créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Zinc, Perlines, etc. El cual utilizara para la remodelación del techo de su casa de habitación, con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Edgard Antonio C. Sánchez in charge of cleaning in the Oriental Market in Managua. He cares for six children, three of whom are of school-age. He is married and has taken loans from Ceprodel for six years. During this time, he has invested eleven loans in household improvements, thanks to the financing offered by Ceprodel. He is an excellent client. The credit he is requesting is to invest in the purchase of construction materials including zinc, beams, etc, which he will use to remodel the roof of his home. His goal is to offer more security and a better life to his children.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda M. is from the village of Research Minante 1, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 47 years old, married, and has two adult children. To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately $132 a month from this activity.

In 2007, Erlinda joined the Kiva field partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Erlinda is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 4th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en:
Gulbahor is a hard-working entrepreneur from Dushanbe, the capital of Tajikistan. She and her husband have two children. She runs a business where she sells kids' clothing and women's underwear.

Gulbahor started her business 10 years ago and has run it with extreme care and seriousness. It is an important source of income for her family of four, considering that her husband does not earn enough money to support the family. Gulbahor has requested a loan of 5000 Somoni so that she can purchase additional inventory of winter clothing for kids and to continue developing her business. Thanks to this loan, she will be able to grow her business further and help feed her family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing winter clothing for kids

loans.name: Marciano

texts.en:
Marciano I. is from the village of Lower Tiparak, Tambulig,Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 34 years old. Marciano is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Marciano raises livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Marciano has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Marciano joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marciano has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Marciano is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Marciano from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Juana Sobeyda

texts.es:
La señora Juana Sobeyda se dedica a la venta de comida, desde horas tempranas hace las respectivas compras para luego ponerse a elaborar los ricos platillos que solo ella sabe hacerlos, su puesto de venta esta en su propia casa de habitación.

Este crédito fue para la compra de granos básicos para la  realización de sus platillos, tales como: gallo pinto, maduro con queso, carne desmenuzada, tacos y otros mas 

Un hecho relevante de la señora Juana ella inicio a vender comida con su mama hoy en día ella esta a cargo del negocio.
texts.en:
Juana Sobeyda sells food. She does her shopping very early in the morning and then makes the delicious meals as only she knows how; her sales stall is in her own house. The loan will be used to buy basic grains needed to prepare her dishes, such as: gallo pinto (rice and beans), maduro con queso (baked, cheese-filled plantain), carne desmenuzada (shredded beef), tacos and others. An interesting fact about Juana is that she started out selling food with her mother and now she is in charge of the business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains like: rice, beans; sugar and firewood.

loans.name: Presentación Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Presentación del Carmen N., Habita en la Comarca la mora, tiene un tramo en el bisne en el sector de la ropa, tiene de trabajar con ceprodel desde que inicio, y siempre ha solicitado créditos pequeños para ir aumentando su inventario poco a poco.
	

 La señora Presentación del Carmen N. solicito el crédito para incrementar su inventario de ropa  ya que estamos en temporada de playa y  no poseía ropa playera.
texts.en:
Presentación lives in the "la Mora" area and has a cart where she sells clothing. She has been working with CEPRODEL since it began and she has always requested small loans in order to increase her inventory little by little Presentación requested this loan in order to be able to increase her inventory of clothing, now that the beach season has begun and she has no beach clothing to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Beach clothing for resale

loans.name: Sylverien

texts.en:
Sylverien is 37 years old and married with three children between 2 and 12 years of age. Sylverien is a motorbike driver. He offers the service of transportation in his region. Sylverien’s wife right now is a housewife. The hours of his work are from 5 in the morning to 10 in the evening every day, except on Saturday. Sylverien has been in this business for three years.

Sylverien is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to improve his family's economy through creating another business of selling shoes. This new business will be operated by Sylverien’s wife in order to help her to contribute to their family. This loan will be fruitful in this family simply because both will work hard for family and community.

loans.use: To start a business selling shows

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia M. is a married woman who supports her family by running a general store and a rice retailing business. She lives in Prk Saisi Brgy Tan-awan Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental with her husband Victorian, who is 68 years old and engaged in buying and selling livestock, and their 5 children who are between 20 and 30 years old.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and rice retailing businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000.

Lydia is now borrowing PHP 15,500 so that she can continue her general store and rice retailing business. This will be her 6th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 13,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Lydia aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Faavae

texts.en:
Faavae Chou L. is 40 and married with three children.  She owns a business venture, selling ice-cakes (flavored ice in styrofoam cups).  Faavae has four years of experience in this business.  Faavae needs a loan of WST $1500 to invest in renovating the business.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Faavae joined SPBD.  This is her 4th loan with SPBD.  SPBD's loans are Faavae's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To invest in renovating the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: expand his cultivated area and buy agricultural inputs

loans.name: God Is Able Group

texts.en:
Melvin J., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God Is Able. He is 30 years old, married and has three children who range from 2 to 9 years old. He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to financial difficulties. 

All of his children are in school and he also cares for one sibling.

For six years, he has been selling gospel and sports posters on the Old Road in Monrovia, Liberia.

He plans to use his 8,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 39,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more gospel and sports posters.
 
His dream is to expand his business, save some money and go back to school.

loans.use: To buy more gospel and sports posters

loans.name: Belgica Petra

texts.es:
Bélgica de 62 años, ella vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil un lugar urbano donde esta la mayor parte de la gente de bajo recursos económicos, tiene dos hijos. Ella tiene una tienda de víveres. 

Antes de tener la tienda ella tuvo que sacrificar muchas cosas, una de ellas fue vender ropa artesanal a sus conocidos, poco a poco y con la ayuda de su esposo compro víveres para venderlos desde la ventana de su casa porque no tenia un local. Por ahora ya tiene un local y trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 21h00pm. 

Para incrementar su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, azúcar y aceites. En el futuro quiere darles a sus hijos la tienda para que ellos la administren.
texts.en:
Bélgica is 62 years old. She lives in Guasmo, Guayaquil, a urban area where the majority of the people have limited economic resources. She has two children and she has a grocery store.

Before her store, she had to sacrifice lots of things. She sold handmade clothing to acquaintances. Little by little and with the help of her husband, she bought groceries to sell from her house’s window because she did not have an actual business location. Now she has a business location and she works from 6:00am to 9:00pm.

In order to increase her business she wants to buy rice, sugar and oil with her loan. In the future, she wants to give her children the store so they can manage it.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and oil

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene pertenece al Banco Comunal Glorioso y lo que mas le agrada es el incentivo al ahorro.
Irene es casada y tiene 2 hijos que estudian, vive en el Distrito de Chiara que se ubica a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Irene tiene un restaurante en su casa en donde brinda servicios de desayuno, almuerzo y cena, también vende helados, frutas y gelatinas que ella prepara, además Irene tiene una tienda de abarrotes en el mismo lugar, actividades que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de 2 personas.
Irene Solicita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas y una fotocopiadora para ampliar sus servicios.
Irene sueña con tener un restaurante en la ciudad de Ayacucho y que sus hijos estudien en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
texts.en:
Irene belongs to the “Glorioso” communal bank and what she likes the most about it is the incentive for saving. Irene is married and she has two children who are studying. She lives in the district of Chiara, which is located 45 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Irene has a restaurant in her house where she serves breakfast, lunch, and dinner. She also sells ice creams, fruits, and gelatins that she prepares. Irene also has a small grocery store in the same place. She works in both of these businesses everyday, with the help of 2 people. Irene is requesting a loan of PEN 3000.00, which she will use to buy soft drinks and a photocopier to expand her services. Irene dreams of having a restaurant in the city of Ayacucho and also that her children will study in the city of Ayacucho.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks and a photocopier to expand her services

loans.name: Cathy

texts.en:
Cathy Nakiraga is 18 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala west region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  Cathy has a business of selling fish, which she has had for less than one year.
  
To help expand her business, Cathy is requesting a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to buy more fish for selling.  Cathy hopes that the loan will help her by allowing her to go back for her studies.  In the future, Cathy hopes to see her business expand.

loans.use: more fish to sell

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina L. is from the village of Duka, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 51 years old. Crispina is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Crispina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Crispina has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 8,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Crispina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Crispina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Crispina is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Crispina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Valérie

texts.fr:
N. Valerie est une femme de 44 ans, née à Gasabo, province de la Ville de Kigali capital du Rwanda. Elle est mariée elle a quatre enfants le moins âgée a  10 ans, le plus âgée a 18 ans, tous vont a l’école. Valérie et  sa famille habite à Kinyinya- Gasabo- Kigali, son niveau d’éducation est  primaire. Elle est salariée dans une Eglise de PENTECOTE(ADEPR), Paroisse de Gasave ou elle est évangéliste de cette Eglise.
Le crédit contracté avec ACB est  le cinquième, le précédent lui a aidé d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et le présent prêt c’est pour réhabiliter  sa maison. Ses épargnes lui permettent  de payer le loyer ou elle habitait avec sa famille jusqu'à avoir sa maison laquelle elle veut réhabiliter ou faire le finissage.
Dans l’avenir, elle compte solliciter un nouveau prêt pour le minerval de ses enfants.
texts.en:
N. Valerie is a 44 year old woman, born in Gasabo, in the province of the city of Kigali, the capital of Rwanda. She is married and has four children between the ages of 10 and 18 years old, all in school. Valerie and her family live in Kinyinya- Gasabo- Kigali. She has a primary school education. She is paid by the Pentecote (Adepr) Church, Parish of Gasave, where she is a church evangelist. The loan she got from ACB is her fifth. The previous one helped her to improve her family's living conditions and her present loan is to renovate her house. Her savings allows her to pay the rent for where she lives with her family until they have the house, which she wants to renovate or finish. In the future, she expects to seek a new loan for her children's school fees.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of doors, windows, sand and cement

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda T.'s main source of income comes primarily from fattening pigs for sale. She is 55 years old, married and has five grown-up children. She is from the village of Nabbotuan, Solana, Cagayan. Erlinda has been in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2007, Erlinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her fourth loan from ASKI. She plans to save the additional revenue generated from the business to use as a reserve for future emergencies. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Madres Trabajadoras”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santiago, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana; ella tiene 43 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de cosmetóloga, ella tiene un salón de belleza que atiende desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,a ella le gusta hacer diferentes cortes de cabello para eso está estudiando, su esposo es policía, la socia quiere mejorar y ampliar su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para el salón de belleza como líquidos permanentes, tintes para el cabello, tijeras y ruleros. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Communal Bank “Madres Trabajadoras” (Working Mothers), which is located in the District of Santiago, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 43 years old, married, and has two children. Sra. Juana divides her time between her daily activities and her cosmetology business. She has a beauty salon that she manages from 9am until 7pm. Juana enjoys providing the different types of haircuts that she learned. Her husband is a police officer. Juana wants to improve and expand her business, so she is requesting a loan to buy supplies for her beauty salon such as liquid perms, hair coloring, scissors, and curlers.

Juana is grateful to those who made her dream come true and promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Purchase liquid perms, hair coloring, scissors, and curlers

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en: H. Nguyễn Thị is a 27-year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. She is married and has two small children. To make a living, H. owns and operates a specialized retail store selling health and medicinal products in her community. H. has been in this business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000,000 dong (VND) a month. In 2008, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA which was used to purchase products to sell. H. is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her fourth loan from SEDA. H. plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. No. 20213030033. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ====================================== H. Nguyễn Thị (20213030033) là 27 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi nhỏ. Để kiếm sống, H. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh. Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. Trong khi không pH. chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán các sản phẩm chăm sóc sức khỏe & dược phẩm trong cộng đồng địa phương. H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 3 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND một tháng. Vào 2008, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. H. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND. Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh. Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. H. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam. Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey has been practicing mixed farming for twelve years in the town of Nyamira in western Kenya. His farm produces milk, which he sells locally, and tea, which he sells through the Kenya Tea Development Authority. He also earns income from his employment at a local tea factory. His primary challenges are drought, the diseases that affect his crops and livestock, and poor road networks.

Geoffrey is 36 years old. He and his wife have five school-aged children, all of whom attend school.

He has requested this loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will go toward the education of his children and will improve the livelihood of his family. 

In future, he would like to expand his dairy and tea farming endeavors and also venture into maize farming. He would also like to be educated more on crop and livestock farming.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Mwinyi Group

texts.en:
Seleman R. is in his early-thirties and is married with one child who is four and a half years old. He owns a charcoal store and has a motorbike businesses.  He has been operating them for the past two years. He opens daily between 7 am and 4 pm and earns a good monthly profit. 

This will be Seleman's 8th loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to start selling charcoal and started building his house and he has successfully paid back all of his loans. He hopes to get another loan to continue building his house. Seleman's dream is to one day complete and stay in his house.

Seleman will share this loan with his loan group Mwinyi, which totals 19 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans. 

In the picture, Seleman is seen 3rd from right wearing a black heart.

loans.use: To finish building his house.

loans.name: Chhorn

texts.en:
Chhorn S., 24, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples.

Sophea is employed at a factory, earning an income of about USD 3 per day. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of USD 2 per day. S. has to spend USD 23 on food, USD 4 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 35 on other necessary expenses every month.  S. is requesting a loan of USD 250 to purchase a motorbike for the family's use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more medicine

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: G. Christopher is 68 and married with five children. He is a very committed man with an agricultural business where he sells and grows matooke from Kyatoko. He works hand in hand with his wife and children, in addition to selling vegetables in the same area. He has been in business for six years and he needs a loan to buy fertilizer and manure for improved output.

loans.use: To buying fertilizer and manure to improve matooke (plantain) production

loans.name: Odette

texts.en:
Odette is 29 years old, married and has three children between the ages of five and fourteen. Her husband is a businessperson as well.

Odette has been selling charcoal for eight years. Her loan will be used to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell. She hopes to reinvest all new profits and continue to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Joyce Njoki

texts.en:
Joyce is widowed and is a mother of four children – aged six, nine, twelve and sixteen. They live in Magina Limuru, on the outskirts of Nairobi. She relies solely on crop farming and livestock keeping to support her family. She has been farming for a period of sixteen years now. 

With this loan, she plans to buy a calf and two sheep to increase her livestock in order to earn more income. This is her third loan from KADET.  She had paid off her previous loans well and on time.  

In future she plans to buy  a dairy cow for milk production,so that she can start selling milk to the residents of Magina for better income and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy a calf and two sheep

loans.name: Yina Paola

texts.es:
Yina es una madre de familia, tiene de 26 años de edad, reside junto familia en el caserío Bello Horizonte del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa y plásticos, ella cuenta con una pequeño negocio instalado en su domicilio, aqui ofrece sus productos a los vecinos y clientes de la zona donde ella reside. Su negocio cuenta con buena acogida debido a la calidad de los productos que ofrece y a la buena atención que brinda. Con los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad ella se encarga de ayudar al sostenimiento económico de su familia.

Yina desea ampliar negocio con la compra de más mercadería de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y seguir incrementando sus ventas, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Ella es una persona bastante responsable y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Yina is a mother and is 26 years old. She lives with her family in the village of Bello Horizonte, in the agricultural district of Tambogrande, which is located in the Piura region, more than 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

She sells clothing and plastic goods. She has a small business at home where she offers her products to neighbors and customers who live in the area. Her business is well-received because of the quality of the products offered and the customer service she gives. With the income that this activity provides she takes care of supporting her family. Yina would like to expand her business by buying more merchandise to meet customer demand and further increase sales. This is why she thought it was a good idea to request a loan of 1500 new soles from Edpyme Alternative. She is a very responsible person and is very eager to get ahead.

loans.use: Expand her business.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu I. is married with two children and is from Nyame Bekyere in Cape Coast. She sells tuo zaafi (rice or corn balls, usually eaten with ground nut or green-leaves soup, beans, and cowpeas with shea nut oil and pepper.) 

Her husband is a mason and depends on her earnings to help pay for their children’s school fees and some household expenses. She wants to grow her business. She plans to use the loan to buy more ingredients to increase the volume of food for sale. She plans to save the added profits to purchase a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to increase the volume of food for sale

loans.name: Hozana Development Group-Kayunga

texts.en:
Ruth T., 45, is a member of this Hozana Development Group-Kayunga loan. She has been plying her retail shop business in Msotoka-Kayunga district for 15 years. Ruth was all this while also engaged in an agricultural business. This business has been growing steadily owing to her diligence, tenacity and perseverance.

Ruth, a happy go lucky, amiable and high-spirited mother of five, says she is going to use this Kiva loan to purchase more general merchandise retail stock to resell.

loans.use: To purchase more general merchandise retail stock to resell

loans.name: Amancio

texts.es:
El Sr. Amancio de 57 años de edad, vive en el Barrio Sportivo de la ciudad de Itá, se dedica a la venta de bebida en su domicilio y se halla trabajando también en conjunto con sus hermanos en una distribuidora de bebidas.
El es padre de familia de 4 hijos, quien con su esfuerzo desempeñado día a día va superando los problemas que se le presenta en la vida.
El crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de bebidas (jugos, vinos, wodka, cervezas, freeze, gaseosas) y también de diversos insumos de primera necesidad para el hogar, ya que la necesidad de los vecinos de contar con un almacén más cercano lo lleva a esta decisión acertosa para la venta de esos insumos.
texts.en:
Mr. Amancio is 57 years old and lives in the Barrio Sportivo in the city of Itá. He works selling drinks from his house and he works with his siblings for a drink distributor.
He is the father of 4 children who, with his continued strength, day to day go on overcoming the problems life presents them.
The loan he is requesting is to buy drinks (juices, wines, vodka, beers, freeze, sodas) and also a variety of basic necessities for the house. Because his neighbors need a store nearer to them, he has decided to sell these items.

loans.use: to buy drinks (juices, wines, vodka, beers, freeze, sodas)

loans.name: Ricarda

texts.es: La señora Ricarda García tiene 51años es viuda vive juntamente con sus 4 hijos que le ayudan en las faenas agrícolas y cuidado D. ganado en la comunidad D. Corani Pampa  están a 72 km D. la ciudad D. Cochabamba, Doña Ricarda García es agricultora produce papa, locoto necesita un capital para construir vivienda en su lote en Cercado Itocto Kara Kara, la señora Ricarda García es D. familia humilD. trabajadora y responsable, para ella es muy difícil acudir a los Bancos D. la ciudad además les piden muchos requisitos. Se tuvo la iniciativa D. ir a esa zona a otorgar crédito, la señora Ricarda esta muy contenta D. tener la oportunidad D. conseguir un crédito, asi podra construir la vivienda y sus hijos podrían vivir en mejores condiciones con los servicio básicos necesarios.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ricarda García, 51, is a widow living with her four children who help her with her farming chores and to care for livestock in the community of Corani Pampa which is 72 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba.

Mrs. Ricarda García farms potatoes and peppers and needs capital to build a dwelling on her lot in Cercado Itocto Kara Kara.  Mrs. Ricarda García is from a humble, hard working and responsible family.  For her it is very difficult to go to banks in the city; besides, they ask for too many requirements.

There was the initiative to go to that zone to offer loans.  Ricarda is very happy to have the opportunity to get a loan that will make it possible for her to build a dwelling and her children live in better conditions with needed basic utilities.

loans.use: to build a dwelling.

loans.name: Jaider

texts.es: Jaider es un joven muy conocido en el barrio la Sierrita al suroccidente de la ciudad de  Barranquilla, lugar donde habita y tiene el negocio de  vender comidas rápidas, el cual inició cuando se le ocurrió hacer fritos como arepas, empanadas rellenas de carne y queso entre otras delicias; como el espíritu emprendedor de Jaider no tiene límites, él vio una nueva oportunidad, al observar un carro de perros calientes en su vecindad,  que se encontraba en capacidad ociosa;   así  fue como  reunió dinero y lo compró a su vecino y hasta la fecha,  este ha sido la forma de generar sus propios ingresos, vendiendo perros calientes, hamburguesas, chuzos, a los que agrega las deliciosas salsas, que solo Jaider sabe preparar, su idea es estructurar mejor su negocio, organizándolo físicamente y promocionándolo, así como tener  un nuevo punto de ventas. Mientras tanto Jaider continua trabajando con una utilidad promedia sobre las ventas no menor del 38%, para lograr sus metas personales, familiares y de negocio. En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva con el cual comprará en mayor volumen,   materias primas e insumos al por mayor, como salsas, carnes, queso, embutidos, para obtener mejores descuentos y trasladárselos al precio de ventas de sus productos, así esta inversión sería exitosa porque su oferta es más llamativa para sus clientes,  que todos los días se incrementan  y Jaider no quiere quedarse con la posibilidad de brindarles  la oportunidad de consumir sus deliciosos  productos.
texts.en:
Jaider is a very well-known Young man from the Sierrita neighborhood in the south part of Barranquilla, where he lives and has a fast food business.  He started it when he came up with the idea of selling fried food, like arepas, empanadas stuffed with meat and cheese, and other delicacies.   Since his entrepreneurial spirit is limitless, he saw a new opportunity when he spotted an unused hot dog cart near his home.  He put together some money and bought it from his neighbor and it has been a source of income for him ever since; selling hot dogs, hamburgers, and chuzos, to which he adds delicious salsas that only he can make.

Jaider wants to reorganize his business and promote it.  He also wants to have a new point of sale.  In the meantime he continues to work at a profit margin of no less than 38% so the he can reach his personal, family, and business goals.

He is using his Kiva loan to buy supplies and ingredients, such as salsa, meats, cheeses, and sausages in bulk, in order to get them at better prices and pass the savings on to his customers.  This will be a successful investment because his offers are more appealing to his customers and he gets more each day.  Jaider does not want to deprive them of the chance to enjoy his delicious products.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies for his hot dog cart

loans.name: Jose Marcos

texts.es:
José, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, tiene casa propia y se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, vive solo con su esposa ya que sus hijos tienen sus propios hogares. 
Actualmente inicia el proceso para el cultivo de maíz y frijol, por lo que José solicita un préstamo para comprar los materiales agrícolas que le ayuden para tener una buena siembra y posteriormente una buena cosecha, él comprara fertilizantes y abono.
Sus proyecciones son que a través del esfuerzo diario que realiza, poder sacar a su familia adelante, mejorando sus condiciones de vida y brindándoles lo necesario para el futuro.
texts.en:
José lives in "El Transito" in the department of San Miguel.  He has his own home where he lives with his wife, and his business in growing corn and beans.  His children live in their own homes.

He is in the process of planting corn and beans and is requesting a loan to buy farm supplies, such as fertilizer, to grow a better crop and achieve a good harvest.  

By working hard everyday, his goal is to make a good living for his family, improve their lifestyle and give them all they need for the future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Mastura

texts.en:
Mastura is married and has two children. She sells clothing at the market and has been in this business for 10 years. Mastura is very creative in her business and has many new ideas as to business improvement and development. She talks a lot with her clients and helps them not only with their purchases but gives them encouragement and hope in the midst of crises. Mastura would like to borrow $1000 USD to increase her inventories. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 30 years old.  She is married and has 6 children, all of whom go to school.  Mary sells alcohol.  She has borrowed a loan to stock more alcohol to sell.  She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits.

loans.use: stock more alcohol to sell

loans.name: Danaire

texts.es: Donaire is 27 years old and lives in Tegucigalpa, Honduras with his wife. He operates a small convenience shop seven days a week in an area called "Flor del Campo." In this business he mainly sells meats and dairy products, though also sells basic foodstuffs and hygiene and cleaning supplies. He is requesting a loan of Lps. 20,000 to purchase merchandise for his store.
texts.en: Donaire is 27 years old and lives in Tegucigalpa, Honduras with his wife. He operates a small convenience shop seven days a week in an area called "Flor del Campo." In this business he mainly sells meats and dairy products, though also sells basic foodstuffs and hygiene and cleaning supplies. He is requesting a loan of Lps. 20,000 to purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.use: This loan will be used to purchase chicken, sausage, basic grains, dairy products, cooking oil, vegetables, fruits, cleaning supplies, and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Pheoun

texts.en: Pheoun, 43, resides in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. Pheoun sells groceries, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband grows yams to sell, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 50 on food and USD 10 on the other necessary expenses. Pheoun is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to stock the store.

loans.name: Maludahan's Group

texts.en: Maludahan is the treasurer of this group. She is 55 and divorced. Maludahan is a resident of Kerben, a small village in the south of Kyrgyzstan. Four years ago, with an initial investment of 15,000 soms, she started to sell fruits and vegetables in the market. At the moment, her business runs well; she earns about 9,000 soms per month. Maludahan applied for the loan because she needs additional financial funds for purchasing a variety of fruits and vegetables. In the future, with the profits gained from her business, she plans to start repairing her house. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Leidy Graciela

texts.es:
Leidy de 20 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijo en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por ser  agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Desde algunos años Leidy se dedica a la comercialización de ganado ovino (ovejas) y aves de corral (gallinas y pavos), los cría en los corrales que tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales, una vez que hayan completado su crecimiento, los vende a sus clientes o en los diferentes mercados de la zona  y con los ingresos podrá cubrir sus necesidades de su casa.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar de alimentos balanceados y de granos naturales, para que engorden y poderlos ofertar a un mejor precio a sus clientes, con las ganancias pagará el crédito otorgado y mejorará el nivel de vida de su familia.  Leidy con su vitalidad, trabajo y empeño a logrado salir adelante poco a poco junto con su familia y poderle dar mejores oportunidades académicas a su hijo.
texts.en:
Leidy, age 20, lives with her husband and child in their own house.  They do not have the basic services.  They live in the rural zone in the Tambogrande district, Piura department.  This zone is known for its agriculture, livestock, and handicrafts.

For some years Leidy has been selling sheep and poultry (chickens and ducks).  She raises them in corrals in her backyard.  She feeds them balanced feed and natural grains.  Once they have grown she sells them to her customers or at different markets in the zone.  With the income she is able to cover the household expenses.  

She has requested a loan for 1,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy balanced feed and natural grains.  She will use these to fatten the animals and to be able sell them for a better price.  With the income she will pay for the loan and improve her family’s standard of living.

With her vitality, work, and determination, Leidy has been able to get ahead with her family little by little.  Also she is able to give her son better educational opportunities.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and natural grains for her animals.

loans.name: Mwanauba

texts.en:
Mwanauba is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and running water and her greatest monthly expense is school fees. For the past six years, she has operated a clothing business and she sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. Mwanauba’s major business challenge is theft due to the insecurity of her area of operation. 

Mwanauba is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase bundles of clothing to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. In the future, Mwanauba dreams of having a formal store and business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es:
La Señora. María socia del banco comunal Barrio Sucre, vive por la parroquia de Cumbe, este sector es de clima frió y tiene una hermosa vista de la naturaleza, su gente es amable, carismática mantienen las tradiciones y cultura de sus padres, se dedican a la agricultura y cría de animales, mucha de su población ha migrado o salen diariamente a la ciudad a laborar en diferentes actividades.
 
La Señora María tiene 57 años, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 9 hijos, 3 de ellos son casados e independientes, 4 trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, 1 estudia en la universidad y 1 estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, la casa en la que habita es de una de sus hijas.
 
Doña María se dedica a la venta de comida en un mercado de la ciudad, labora sin un horario fijo 4 días a la semana y tiene este negocio 21 años. En su casa se dedica a la cría de cuyes y gallinas que son para su consumo y para la venta.
 
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes y chanchos, se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal.

Su meta es crecer en el negocio de cría de animales.
texts.en:
Mrs. María is a member of the Barrio Sucre communal bank. She lives in the Cumbe parish. This sector has a cold climate and a beautiful view of nature. Its people are kind, charismatic, and maintain the traditions and culture of their parents. They work in agriculture and raise animals. A lot of the population has moved away or travel to the city every day to work various jobs.

Mrs. Maria is 57, married, and has 9 children from this union. Three of these children are married and independent, four work and help out economically, one is in university and one attends a school in the city. Her husband works as a private employee. They live in the home of one of her daughters.

Maria sells food in a market in the city. She works without a fixed schedule 4 days a week and has had this business for 21 years. In her home, she raises guinea pigs and hens for her consumption and for sale.

She will invest the money from this loan in the purchase of guinea pigs and pigs. This is her second loan in the communal bank.

Her goal is to expand her business raising animals.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs and pigs.

loans.name: Nixon

texts.en:
Nixon, a 29-year-old married father of two children aged five and four years, is a resident of Kitale,Western Kenya, where he has been a farmer for four years, producing and selling milk, beans and eggs.

Nixon will be receiving his third loan from Juhudi Kilimo, this time for 60,000 KES, to purchase more poultry to increase his egg production. Providing more income for his family and quickly repaying the loan are his immediate priorities.

Nixon says a scarcity of both animal and poultry feeds remains a challenge to the farmers.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita, 58, a resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Dioscoro, a construction worker. They are working hard to support their children who are now in college, because they know that education is quite important for their children’s future and security.

Teresita operates a variety store adjacent to their house. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Teresita earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this she also earn extra income from a direct sales business like AVON.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 300 in sales every day

To help her expand her business, she is requesting a Php 21,000 loan to buy additional grocery items, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. The loan will also ensure extra capital for her direct selling business, and she can offer more AVON products to her old and new customers. This will bring forth added income for the family and will improve their living conditions.

Teresita dreams of expanding her business, possibly to a mini-grocery store. In this way she can give her children a good future and help them attain their dreams. She does not only hope for material things for her children, but most importantly she wants them to serve God and get involved in church ministry. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share her hopes and aspirations regarding her family.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 32 years old. She is married and is rearing her six school-aged children. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines.

To earn a living, Liza operates a transportation business - pedicab in particular. It is a vehicle, somewhat like a bicycle, capable of carrying a maximum of 7 persons, but only a short distance. She has been operating this kind of service for over 5 years, allowing her to receive a total monthly income of 9,400 PHP, taking into consideration other irregular sources of income. Liza has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

Liza is hopeful to sustain business deals and day-to-day needs of the family. She plans to save some portion of her income for her children's education.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Sara Rossana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”ATIPAY”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Sara; La socia tiene 33 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, la socia tiene 1 hijo de 1año de edad; la socia trabaja restaurando obras de arte, la socia tiene en casa un espacio perfectamente acomodado para poder  trabajar restaurando diferentes obras de arte; la socia requiere el crédito para invertir en su matrimonio, la socia desea casarse con su conyugue y para esto ella requiere el préstamo para poder comprar su vestido, pagar todos los gastos nupciales y en esta ocasión ella desea el crédito para invertirlo en ella y en su felicidad. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en su matrimonio.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Sara, 33, is a member of the “Atipay” communal bank that’s located in Huanchac District, Cusco Province and Department.  She’s in a common law relationship and has a 1-year-old son.  She works restoring works of art and has a space in her house that’s perfectly adequate to work restoring art.  

She needs the loan to invest in her wedding.  She wants to marry her spouse and needs a loan to buy her wedding gown and to pay the other nuptial costs.  On this occasion she wants the loan to invest it in herself and in her happiness. She requests the loan to invest in her wedding.  She is grateful for the loan and commits to repay according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to pay for her wedding.

loans.name: Denis F.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are a group of teachers from the eastern city of Koidu/Kono. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni city in northern Sierra Leone, to apply for a loan of 6,700,000 SLL. With the help of this loan, they will be able to meet their immediate financial needs and then gradually repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. 
Their leader is Denis. Born in Yengema in eastern Sierra Leone, the 56-year-old is married and has five children – three in primary school and two in secondary school. Denis has been a professional teacher for 35 years now. He has applied for this loan in order to pay school fees for his children and renovate his house. He will also invest some of the loan in business.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children, renovate his house, and invest in business.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married, and the father of three children. Hussein has owned an electrical equipment and materials shop since 2010. He has sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation. He is well known in the surrounding area. 

Hussein is requesting a loan of $2400 to renovate and repair the wall in his shop and to add to his inventory. He is aiming to earn more profits so he will have the opportunity to provide a better life for his whole family.

loans.use: to renovate and repair his shop and increase his inventory.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: La Sra. Beatriz, vive en la meseta D. Achumani y vive con sus dos hijos ya profesionales, uno D. ellos viaja constantemente, ella se dedica a la repostería, elaboración D. galletas, donas tortas, hace mas D. 20 años, elabora queques, tortas y humintas, que reparte en las confiterías D. la zona central y zona sur, es una cliente que trabaja con Emprender desD. el año 2002 , es una cliente muy responsable, y trabajadora, ya que al margen D. esa actividad se dedica a la venta D. refrescos y abarrotes, con el dinero del crédito comprara harina, levadura, etc. para la elaboración D. sus galletas, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Beatriz lives on the Achumani plateau with her two children who are already professionals. One of them travels constantly.

Beatriz spends her time baking. She has been making cookies, donuts, and cakes for more than 20 years. Beatriz distributes cupcakes, cakes, and corn cakes within the central and southern districts. She has been a client of Emprender since 2002 and has demonstrated that she is very responsible and hardworking. In addition to this business, she also sells soft drinks and groceries.

The money she requested will be used to buy flour, yeast, and other ingredients for making cookies. She is grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Carlos es de la ciudad de Santaní, vive en su propia casa con su esposa e hijos. Tiene 55 años de edad, tiene varios hijos que ya son todos adultos.
Es el dueño de una despensa, comenta que hace ya 10 años que mantiene su negocio, por lo que ya tiene bastante experiencia en el comercio. Dice que todo el esfuerzo que hace es por tener una vejez digna y decorosa, ya que no quiere ser molestia para nadie.
En cuanto a su negocio ya tiene muy buena clientela y siempre tiene muchos pedidos, es por ello que solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, lácteos, panificados y demás productos,con los cuales podrá abastecer su negocio y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carlos is from Santaní City. He lives in his own house with his wife and children. He is 55 and has several children, all of whom are adults.
He says he has had his business for ten years so he has a lot of experience in commerce. He says he makes all this effort in order to live decently in his old age. He does not want to depend on anyone.
As to his business, he already has a very good clientele and always has a very high demand. That is why he is asking for a loan in order to purchase groceries, drinks, diary, baked goods and other products that will allow him to stock his business and meet the demand of his customers.

loans.use: to purchase groceries, drinks, diary, baked goods and other products.

loans.name: Maximus

texts.en:
Maximus is  a 30 year old hardworking man.He is a banker and has been in this profession for three and a half years.His personal goal is to be going for further education and his business dream is to have well built rental houses.
Maximus intends to use the loan to renovate his rental houses.

loans.use: to renovate his rental houses.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma, 64, is a married woman with seven children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a goat meat selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. Her dream is to expand her business and improve her living standards.

With the Kshs 35,000 she wants to purchase goats for meat sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats for sale as meat.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en: Mariama is a petty trader selling tin tomatoes, salt, charcoal and other food items in Ayensudo, near Elmina.  She has been selling charcoal for two years. Mariama is married to a businessman and has three children. She uses her income to assist the husband in paying utility bills. She needs this loan to buy more food items and charcoal for sale. With the new profit, Mariama will expand her business.

loans.use: buy more food items and charcoal for sale

loans.name: Chansokun's Group

texts.en:
Chansokun is 32 years old, married and has two dependent children, one son and one daughter, who are too young to attend school. She is a farmer who has been farming on her two-hectare farmland to make a living for ten years and she supplements her income by selling Chinese noodle and rice soup in the village. 

Chansokun received a loan from VisionFund five years ago. The previous loan from VisionFund have helped her make a living better. She earns more than US$25 per day but is able to save less than five U.S. dollars daily. With her business growth, she and her co-member in the group, who has also been with VisionFund for five years, are applying for another loan. She wants to buy ingredients, kitchen ware etc. for her business. This loan will enable her to run her business well and she hopes to buy necessary comforts for her family and send her children to school and keep them there.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, kitchen ware, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Farihan

texts.en:
Farihan, a 19-year-old single lady, is the only girl in a family with five boys.

Farihan is a civil engineering student in one of the Jordanian universities. She has applied for a loan so she can pay for her semester's fees to get her bachelor's degree. Then she will work in the field while continuing to get a master's degree.

loans.use: to pay for her semester's fees.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself as determined and honest. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using bicycles. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be weather changes and insecurity. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more bicycles. His business goal is to expand within five years. This is Joseph's first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more bicycles

loans.name: Vaja

texts.en:
Vaja is 27 years old unemployed man, from Ivertubani, Tbilisi district. He has parents, who are temporarily unemployed also, little daughter and wife, who works as a cashier and gets fixed income. As the excisting income is't enough for four-members family and Vaja was unable to start any stable job, he decided to make his own business income. He seek for credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts was unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions and lack of experience. The startup program, that is joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poors and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan for purchasing a second-hand car and start serving local people as a taxi driver. Vaja will work through the district and will generate his own income. 
The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva startup loan, will significantly increase the family's income. Vaja will be able to create better living condition for his family members.

loans.use: To purchase a car and start serving local people as a taxi driver

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria owns a small store where she sells many food items. She started off by just selling fruits and vegetables, but eventually her business grew to include dairy products and soft drinks. She is requesting the loan because she wants to invest in canned goods that are very popular amongst her customers. She does not have the investment capital to go out and buy these goods and make them part of her product line. Maria has a very stable business that shows the capacity of introducing new products. Her customer base is very strong and the product she plans to introduce promise to generate revenue. Maria is a 28 year old single mother of three children who moved to Guayaquil in search of work and a better for life for her children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in new products for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Agnes wants buy 12 medium size steers.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is a sharp entrepreneur selling women’s clothing at one of the local markets in Zaporoshye. In the five years she has had her business, she has gained valuable experience and insight into running a successful market business. She sells a variety of clothing, and is careful with the products she chooses to offer. She watches what other vendors are selling and then tries to distinguish her business by selling different products. Currently, Nataliya makes about $400 profit every month.

Having the business has been a big help for Nataliya and her husband. Not long ago, they were able to purchase a home outside the city and eventually would like to do some remodeling. She and her husband have one son.

Nataliya has requested a loan for $1000 so that she can purchase additional inventory for her business. She would like to increase the selection of sizes she has available and buy seasonal clothing in bulk to prepare for the upcoming busy summer season.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Thum

texts.en: Mr. Thum P. is 66 years old and lives with his wife in Kampong Cham Province.  He owns a plantation that grows various crops, which gives him an average income of $4 per day.  This loan will be used to purchase seeds and farm supplies for him to increase his efficiency.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and farm supplies

loans.name: Gulnar

texts.en: Gulnar S. is  a 36-year-old woman, is married and has three children. She has her own orchard in Hasanli village in the Salyan region and has been in this business for four years. Now she requests a loan of $1200 to buy pesticides to improve her orchard.

loans.use: To buy pesticides for her orchard

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
In a humble home, in the village of Pukara, we find hardworking and joyful Doña Agustina (64 years old), making her beautiful pottery (pots). She makes them in the traditional manner, out of mud and clay. And, thanks to her nimble and creative hands, her work has enabled her to provide her 3 beloved children a higher education as well as fully meet the needs of her family. Now, despite her advanced age, she remains willing to continue expanding her business by working dilligently in her art. In order to continue realizing her plans, this exemplary woman wants to get a loan to be used fully for the purchase of raw materials (clay and wood), which she will use in the creation of her valuable pots, and thus move her small business forward. She promises to repay the loan over a period of 8 months. Let us support this worthy mother and help her prosper with her noble work.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

En un humilde domicilio del pueblito de Pukará, encontramos muy laboriosa y alegre a doña Agustina de 64 años de edad, realizando sus hermosos trabajos de alfarería (ollas), basados en barro y arcilla, de manera tradicional; gracias a sus ágiles y creativas manos esta labor le ha permitido brindarles estudios superiores a sus tres queridos hijos y satisfacer plenamente las necesidades de su familia, ahora, pese a su avanzada edad sigue deseosa de seguir expandiendo su negocio y para esto trabaja diligentemente en este bello arte.Para concretar sus planes esta ejemplar mujer desea obtener un préstamo para utilizarlos plenamente en la compra de materia prima (arcilla, leña) para la elaboración de sus valiosas y creativas ollitas y así sacar adelante su pequeño negocio, ella promete rembolsar el préstamo en un lapso de ocho meses. Apoyemos a esta digna madre a prosperar con su noble labor.

loans.use: Purchase of clay and wood to increase her production of pottery.  (Compra de arcilla y leña para incrementar su producción.)

loans.name: Justa Marleni

texts.es:
Señora Justa Marleny is a hard-working and very happy person. She was able to complete her studies only to the first grade of secondary school. She is 34 years old and has 4 children in all, but only two still need her care.

She works from10 in the morning selling cebiche (a Peruvian dish made from raw fish marinated in citrus juice and spices), noodles, papas a la huancaína (a potato dish served on lettuce with a special sauce) and combinations. At noon she prepares and sells lunches and in the evening she works selling anticuchos (a dish consisting of grilled, skewered meat). Her business is located near her house in the Nuevo Jerusalén sector of the district of La Esperanza, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad.

For many years Justa has worked hard at this business, but only working in the day. With the first loan of 100 soles that she received from Manuela Branches she bought a small grill and began to sell anticuchos in the evenings.

The loan of 400 soles, which she will pay in 4 months, will buy tables, a package of noodles, oil and dishes. Señora Justa dreams of being able to buy a refrigerator and finishing her house so that she can add on a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Justa Marleny es una persona muy alegre y trabajadora, estudió sólo hasta el primer grado de secundaria, tiene 34 años de edad y 4 hijos en total pero dos aún necesitan de su cuidado.

Ella trabaja desde las 10:00 de la mañana en la venta de cebiche, tallarín, papa a la huancaína y combinados. Al medio día prepara y vende almuerzos y por las noches se dedica a la venta de anticuchos. Su negocio está ubicado cerca de su casa en el sector Nuevo Jerusalén del distrito de La Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad.

Hace muchos años que se dedica a este negocio, pero sólo trabajando en el día. Con el primer préstamo de S/.100 que recibió de Manuela Ramos empieza a vender anticuchos por las noches, para ello compra una pequeña parrilla.

El préstamo de S/.400.00, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará mesas, un paquete de fideos, aceite y platos.

La señora Justa sueña con comprarse una refrigeradora y con terminar de construir su casa para que más adelante pueda poner un restaurante.

loans.use: To buy assets (tables and dishes) and groceries (noodles and oil).

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
Abra AZIAWONOU, age 33, sells "ablo", a local corn bread that is much appreciated by the Togolese people. She has been in this business for two years and is married with five children. To meet the extreme demand, she would like to use this loan to buy three sacks of corn and two cartons of sugar, thus increasing her production capacity and finally to clear profits that would enable her to make ends meet for her and her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Madame Abra AZIAWONOU est revendeuse de « ablo », une pâte locale qui est tant appréciée par la population togolaise. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 02 ans. Agée de 33 ans, madame Abra est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Pour répondre à la demande exorbitante, madame Abra AZIAWONOU désire par ces fonds acheter 03 sacs de maïs et 02 cartons de sucres, augmentant ainsi la capacité de son activité et in fine dégager des profits lui permettant de venir à bouts de ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants.

loans.use: To buy 80 sacks of corn for making a local style of bread called "ablo"

loans.name: Zulayho.

texts.ru:
Zulayho M. lives in Vahdat. She is married, has 5 children and is 50 years old. Zulayho is a homemaker and raises livestock. She has 6 years of experience in this area. Zulayho plans to use her loan to purchase a dairy cow which will provide her with milk. She will sell the milk in her town, which will help her family’s finances. In addition, this will provide local residents with fresh milk at affordable prices. Zulayho plans to pay back the loan over a 10 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Мусулмонова Зулайхо Рахмоновна проживает в городе Вахдат. Замужем имеет 5 детей. Возраст 50 лет. Домохозяйка , занимается животноводством. Опыт в бизнесе 6 лет.на планируемый кредит хочет купить дойную корову, что позволит ей получать молоко. Полученное молоко планирует использовать для продажи в городе.. Что поможет улучшить финансовое положение ее семьи.Кроме того продажа молока позволяет обеспечить население свежим молоком по доступным ценам.Погасить кредит клиентка планируе в течении 10 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Lorgia

texts.es:
Señora Lorgia belongs to the community bank Santa Bárbara, located in the food section of Market No. 2, of the district of Calleria in the province of Ucayali. She is 43 years old and a mother of five children. Her husband is a construction worker, but the income that he has does not meet the family's needs to sustain themselves. With her first loan received through Manueal Ramos of 300 Soles, she decided to invest in food sales.

Presently she has a food sales position. She wakes up very early to prepare her foods and focuses on opening up her business in the morning, once finished her daily duty she prepares herself for tomorrow's work day.

With this loan of 1500 Soles, which she will pay back in five months, she will invest it in purchasing supplies for preparing her dishes like: rice, sugar, milk, condiments, chicken, stews, vegetables, etc.

Lorgia is very happy: her business is growing, her family feels very proud of her for her achievements, and now she is able to give the best to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La señora Lorgia pertenece al Banco Comunal Santa Bárbara, ubicado en el Mercado No 2 Sección comidas, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 43 años y es madre D. 5 hijos, su esposo es albañil, pero los ingresos económicos que tiene no le alcanzan para el sustento familiar. Con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 deciD. invertirlo en la venta D. comida.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un puesto D. venta D. comida, se levanta muy temprano para preparar sus comidas y dirigirse a abrir su negocio, una vez terminado su faena diaria se prepara para la jornada del día siguiente.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,500 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, lo invetira en la compra D. víveres para preparar sus comidas como: arroz azúcar, leche, condimentos, pollos, menestras, verduras, etc.

Lorgia esta muy feliz, su negocio esta creciendo, su familia se siente muy orgullosa D. ella por sus logros y ahora pueD. darles lo mejor a sus hijos.

loans.use: products for the preparation of her foods

loans.name: Tchotcho Anastasie

texts.fr:
Mrs. Tchotcho Anastasie A. was born on March 13, 1969 in Lomé. She is married to Mr. Parfait Paraiso who is a bicycle mechanic. She sells cooked food and locally produced clothing in the Agoè neighborhood. In the mornings, she sells cooked rice and in the afternoons she displays tailor-made clothing.
